<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>refresh_token</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The refresh token returned from the authorization <code>code</code> exchange.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>reset_refresh_token</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional and not advised to use</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use 1 to reset your refresh token. <b>This should only be used if you think your refresh token was compromised.</b> Otherwise you might run into race conditions when saving the refresh token. We have seen multiple cases of partners getting 404 (not found) errors when they use 1 by default.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-request-4">Example Request</h5>
<p>Example request utilizing cURL's automatic Base64 encoding for <code>-u</code> option strings.</p>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X POST <span class="se">\</span>
  -d <span class="s1">'{"refresh_token": "3ygawaklwqt5ottmghf9l0xi6", "reset_refresh_token": 0}'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'Content-Type: application/json'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -u <span class="s1">'4n764q9f97ai0wwz9veq23e4u:7hx9qmsdfdasf246en5ja5'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  https://api.airbnb.com/v2/oauth2/authorizations?_unwrapped<span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">true</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-3">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"access_token"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"40xdf4fvdotrpnwv6tkuroaze"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">//</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">new</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">access</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">token</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">to</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">use</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">in</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">API</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">calls</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">for</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">the</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">next</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">24</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">hours</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"expires_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1422594787</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">  </span><span class="err">//</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">Unix</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">time</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"refresh_token"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"d1gwltceepbiouw6dznxpf7k2"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">//</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">returned</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">if</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">reset_refresh_token</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">was</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">set</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">to</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="err">1</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"user_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1603070</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Revoking a Token
sections.content:
<p>A Partner can choose to stop working with a host that had previously authorized their application. In this case, the Partner can request to remove the association with the host by calling the API as described below. A host can similarly revoke your access by choosing to disconnect your application at <a href="https://admin.airbnb.com/users/apps">https://airbnb.com/users/apps</a></p>
<blockquote>NOTE: After revoking the token, the host can continue to manually manage their account and all of their listings, if any, on the Airbnb website. </blockquote>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>DELETE /v2/oauth2/authorizations/:token?_unwrapped=true</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-headers-5">Request Headers</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Header</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>Authorization</code> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The Client ID and Secret retrieved from the Developer Console, formatted for Basic Auth. For more information, see <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default#formatting-a-basic-auth-header">Formatting a Basic Auth Header</a>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="request-url-parameters-4">Request URL parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Param</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>_unwrapped</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <code>true</code> for the OAuth2-spec-compliant format.</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="request-url-id-2">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>token</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Either an access or refresh token for this host.</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-request-5">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X DELETE <span class="se">\</span>
  -u <span class="s1">'4n764q9f97ai0wwz9veq23e4u:7hx9qmsdfdasf246en5ja5'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  https://api.airbnb.com/v2/oauth2/authorizations/d1gwltceepbiouw6dznxpf7k2?_unwrapped<span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">true</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-4">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"user_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1603070</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"valid"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Formatting a Basic Auth Header
sections.content:
<p>Some calls must include your Client ID and Client Secret as a Basic Auth HTTP header. </p>
<p>To format the <code>Authorization</code> header for Basic Auth, its value should be the word <code>Basic</code>, followed by a space, then by a Base64-encoding of the <b>colon-separated </b>Client ID and Client Secret, e.g., <code>client id:client secret</code></p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>Client ID = 4n764q9f97ai0wwz9veq23e4u
Secret = 7hx9qmsdfdasf246en5ja5
 Base64 encoding = NG43NjRxOWY5N2FpMHd3ejl2ZXEyM2U0dTo3aHg5cW1zZGZkYXNmMjQ2ZW41amE1</code></pre>
<p>Example header:</p>
<pre class="highlight http"><code><span class="err">Authorization: Basic NG43NjRxOWY5N2FpMHd3ejl2ZXEyM2U0dTo3aHg5cW1zZGZkYXNmMjQ2ZW41amE1</span></code></pre>
<blockquote>If, in your language of choice, you are using an HTTP client, please make sure to set a User Agent.</blockquote>

sections.name: Other Operations
Retrieving All Authorized Hosts
sections.content:
<p>This call allows you to retrieve all hosts who have given you authorization. This allows you to verify that your local list of User IDs matches Airbnb's list.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>GET /v2/oauth2/clients/:api_key</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-headers-6">Request Headers</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Header</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>Authorization</code> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The Client ID and Secret retrieved from the Developer Console, formatted for Basic Auth. For more information, see <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default#formatting-a-basic-auth-header">Formatting a Basic Auth Header</a>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="request-url-id-3">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Value</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>api_key</code><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Your Client ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="request-url-parameters-5">Request URL Parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Value</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>_limit</code><br><u>optional, defaults is <code>25</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>How many records to return.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>_offset</code><br><u>optional, defaults is <code>0</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The offset of records to return</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-request-6">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl <span class="se">\</span>
  -u <span class="s1">'4n764q9f97ai0wwz9veq23e4u:7hx9qmsdfdasf246en5ja5'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  https://api.airbnb.com/v2/oauth2/clients/4n764q9f97ai0wwz9veq23e4u</code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-5">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"count"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"items"</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"user_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">22909678</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"user_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">18890019</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Webhook Calls
sections.content:
<p>Airbnb uses Webhook Notifications to alert API Partners when important events occur. You can provide an endpoint for Airbnb to asynchronously send events to. Examples of these events include:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Listing approval status updates</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Reservation updates</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Payment updates</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Messages </span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>All relevant notifications and their payload are described in the corresponding sections of the documentation, e.g. <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#webhook-notifications">Listing Management REST Webhook Notifications</a>.</p>
<p>Airbnb also performs <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#confirming-reservations-using-synchronous-availability-checks">Synchronous Availability Checks</a> for partners with <code>reservations_web_hooks</code> scope (which is automatically included in <code>vr</code>). </p>

sections.name: Setting up Webhook Calls
sections.content:
<p>Your application can specify a notification Webhook URL in the <a href="/partner/profile/settings">Partner Portal</a>. For security, all Webhook URLs MUST be HTTPS.</p>
<p>To run the Webhook notification test, go to your <a href="/partner/profile/settings">Airbnb App Settings</a>  page and click the ‘<b>Test</b>’ button where you entered your Notification URL. The report page that gets generated in a new tab will show you the request body that is sent, and whether or not the received response was valid.</p>
<p>For <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#confirming-reservations-using-synchronous-availability-checks">Synchronous Availability checks</a>, you need to specify the Reservation URL. The test request that is sent has fixed dates and listing ID = 0. It's recommended you bypass actual reservation logic when receiving a request with listing ID = 0, and return a result as though the operation succeeded.  </p>

sections.name: Authenticating Airbnb Requests
sections.content:
<p>This section describes how you can authenticate Airbnb requests. Two kinds of authentication are supported — Signature and Basic:</p>
<h5 id="signature-authentication">Signature Authentication</h5>
<p>Webhook requests are signed using a RSA certificate. You can obtain the public key of the key from the developer portal. The recommendation of <a href="https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-cavage-http-signatures-00">this standard</a> is followed with some modifications.</p>
<p>If the basic authenticate method is not enabled, the signatures are embedded in the <code>Authorization header</code>.</p>
<p>For example:</p>
<pre class="highlight http"><code><span class="err">Authorization: Signature keyId="booking_web_hooks",algorithm="rsa-sha256",headers="host url method date content-type body",delimiter="|",signature=""</span></code></pre>
<p>This header includes:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><b>keyId</b>—Currently, only <code>booking_web_hooks</code></span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>algorithm</b>—Currently, only <code>rsa-sha256</code></span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>headers</b>—List of items used to construct the payload:</span><br>
</li>
<ul>
<li>
<span><code>url</code> — Endpoint relative url</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><code>method</code> — <code>GET</code>, <code>POST</code>, <code>PUT</code>, or <code>DELETE</code></span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><code>host</code> — The host's name as specified in the dev portal without the port</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><code>body</code> — Request content</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><code>date</code> and <code>content-type</code> — Respective headers.</span><br>
</li>
</ul>
<li>
<span><b>delimiter</b>—Currently, only <code>|</code></span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>signature</b>—As computed from above fields.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>To verify the signature, the client construct the payload in the order specified by the <code>headers</code> parameter, delimited by the <code>delimiter</code>.</p>
<p>For example:</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>host|url|method|date|content-type|body</code></pre>
<p>Then, the client uses the RSA certificate to verify the payload. <i><annotation>Ensure to Base64 decode the signature before verifying.</annotation></i></p>
<p><b>A Concrete Example</b></p>
<p>Assuming the client gets the following request:</p>
<pre class="highlight http"><code><span class="nf">POST</span> <span class="nn">/foo</span> <span class="k">HTTP</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="m">1.1</span>
<span class="na">Host</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s">example.org:123</span>
<span class="na">Date</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s">Sat, 20 Jun 2015 00:47:57 GMT</span>
<span class="na">Accept</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s">application/json</span>
<span class="na">Content-Type</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s">application/json</span>
<span class="na">Authorization</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s">Signature keyId="booking_web_hooks",algorithm="rsa-sha256",headers="host url method date content-type body",delimiter="|",signature=""</span>

<span class="p">{</span><span class="nt">"payload"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"test"</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>
<p>The client first constructs the payload:</p>
<pre class="highlight http"><code><span class="err">// example payload
example.org|/foo|POST|Sat, 20 Jun 2015 00:47:57 GMT|application/json|{"payload": "test"}

// example check_availability payload
example.org|/reservations?action=check_availability&amp;listing_id=0&amp;start_date=2015-10-10&amp;nights=1|GET|Sat, 20 Jun 2015 00:47:57 GMT||

// example make_reservation payload
example.org|/reservations|POST|Sat, 20 Jun 2015 00:47:57 GMT|application/json|{"payload": "test"}

</span></code></pre>
<p>Then the client uses the signature as specified in the header and the public key to perform the verification. The following is how it is done in Ruby:</p>
<pre class="highlight ruby"><code><span class="n">payload</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'example.org|/foo|POST|Sat, 20 Jun 2015 00:47:57 GMT|application/json|{ "payload" : "test" }'</span>
<span class="n">decoded_signature</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="no">Base64</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nf">strict_decode64</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">signature</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">public_key</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="no">OpenSSL</span><span class="o">::</span><span class="no">PKey</span><span class="o">::</span><span class="no">RSA</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nf">new</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">public_key_string</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">digest</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="no">OpenSSL</span><span class="o">::</span><span class="no">Digest</span><span class="o">::</span><span class="no">SHA256</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nf">new</span>
<span class="n">public_key</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nf">verify</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">digest</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">decoded_signature</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">payload</span><span class="p">)</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="basic-authentication">Basic Authentication</h5>
<p>The client has the option of implementing HTTP Basic Authentication. Please note that this authentication is still insecure and prone to brute force attacks.</p>
<p>If this authentication method is enabled, the following header is sent in all Webhook requests:</p>
<pre class="highlight http"><code><span class="err">Authorization: Basic dXNlcm5hbWU6cGFzc3dvcmQ=</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Application Response
sections.content:
<p>For Webhook notifications, we expect the partner to return the HTTP 200 response within 10s order to confirm the <b>receipt</b> of the notification. Otherwise, the call is considered a failure and will be retried.  To additionally confirm successful processing of the notification you should add the following payload (note that <b>only</b> the response code is used to trigger a retry).</p>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="nt">"succeed"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">true</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>
<blockquote>When a Webhook notification's <code>action</code> field is unknown to your application (usually when we add a new one),  we suggest you respond with a 200 code and ignore the notification. Otherwise, we will keep retrying and these failures will show up on your events dashboard.</blockquote>

sections.name: Notification Best Effort Delivery
sections.content:
<p>All notifications are asynchronous and are retried up to 5 times. Exponential back-off occurs after each failed call (0 seconds, then 10s, 1 minute, 20 minutes, 3 hours). Call failure does not impact the user experience, but could impact the consistency between our data and the Partner’s data.</p>
<p>The Synchronous Availability checks have no retries, since they happen in real time while the guest is booking a listing. A failure to respond on time will result in a failed booking.</p>

sections.name: Notification Failure Summary
sections.content:
<p>In the daily summary email, the previous day's Webhook notification failure count, if any, for each notification category is listed. Notification failures refer to those with response statuses other than 200. Note that this refers to the number of requests made to your server (i.e. it includes the notification retries), not the actual number of unique notifications.</p>
<p>The listing takedown number refers to the number of listings taken down in the previous day due to invalid document format or other errors.</p>
<p>No email is sent if there was not a Webhook notification failure or a listing taken down in the previous day.</p>

sections.name: Notes on Testing
Test listings
sections.content:
<p>Any host connected to a test application is considered a <i>test host</i>. Any listing created by a <i>test host</i>, either manually on Airbnb or via the API, will be considered test listings and cannot be viewed by normal Airbnb user accounts. Even after the test host disconnects from the test application, their listings will remain hidden. <b>Do not create production listings under the test application as their status can not be changed.</b></p>
<p>Other things to note:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>All rules and policies that apply to creating production listings will apply to test listings.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>There is a hard cap of 100 listings that can be created on any test application.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>There is a rate limit of <annotation>600</annotation> API requests per minute from any test application.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Adding Test Users
sections.content: <p>You should create test user accounts and grant them access to view and book your test listings. Once the test accounts are created, you can grant them access to your test application using the <i>Testing access</i> section under Settings. Only user accounts with access to your test application can view your test listings and book test reservations.</p>

sections.name: Testing Checklists
sections.content:
<p>Before granting supply partners a production application, Airbnb will verify that they have completed the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#testing-checklist">Listing Management Testing Checklist</a> and the <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#testing-checklist">Reservation Management Testing Checklist</a> using their test application.</p>
<h5 id="document-feedback">Document Feedback</h5>
<p>If you have any feedback on this document, please let us know. We are always interested in learning how we can improve the documentation and the reader's experience. <annotation>Please submit your feedback through the <a href="https://airbnb.secure.force.com/contactus/APICaseForm">API Technical Support Request Form</a>.</annotation></p>

sections.name: Introduction
sections.content:
<p>The REST Listing Management APIs allow you to create and manage listings.  Managing a listing involves calling multiple APIs</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><b>Basic listing details,</b> such as name and location using <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listings-api">Listings API</a>.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Detailed listing descriptions</b> in multiple languages, including space summary, house rules, etc. using <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-descriptions-api">Listing Descriptions API</a>.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Multiple photos</b> using <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#photos-api">Photos API</a>.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Booking settings, </b>such as check in/check out time, cancellation policy, etc using <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#booking-settings-api">Booking Settings API</a>. </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Availability rules, </b>such as advanced notice, turnover days using <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#availability-rules-api">Availability Rules API</a>. </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Pricing settings, </b>such as cleaning fee, weekly/monthly discounts etc using <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#pricing-settings-api">Pricing Settings API</a>. </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Custom pricing and availability for each day</b> using <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#calendars-api">Calendars API</a> or <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#calendar-batch-operations-api">Calendar Batch API</a>.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Seasonal rule groups of pricing and availability</b> to specify special pricing or availability adjustments for seasons using <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#seasonal-rule-group-api">Seasonal Rule Group API</a>.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>Before proceeding, please ensure OAuth and Webhook Notifications are integrated and working properly. See the<i> </i><a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default">Getting Started</a> guide for more information.</p>
<p>To implement REST API Listing Management, you need <code>vr</code> scope, which you should have been granted during the application credentials process as detailed in <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default">Getting Started</a>.</p>

sections.name: Publishing a Listing
sections.content:
<p>Your application can create new listings as well as connect to existing listings that are not API-connected on behalf of a Host. You need to obtain OAuth authorization from the Host in order to create and manage listings on their behalf. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default">Getting Started</a> for more information.</p>
<p>When publishing a listing from your application, you have the following options:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span> <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#creating-a-new-listing">Create a new listing</a>. You can:</span><br>
</li>
<ul>
<li>
<span>Create and automatically publish a new listing.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Create a listing and let the Host decide whether to publish it as new or merge it with an existing listing.</span><br>
</li>
</ul>
<li>
<span><a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#connecting-to-an-existing-listing-via-the-api">Connect to an existing listing via the API.</a></span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Sync Categories
sections.content:
<p>An Airbnb listing that is synced via your application contains a special field called <code>synchronization_category</code> (or sync category), which describes how the listing is being synced.</p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Category name</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Category value</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span>Everything</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"sync_all"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>All listing data is synced via your application. Hosts cannot modify listing details, pricing or availability on the Airbnb website.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span>Limited</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"sync_rates_and_availability"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Only pricing and availability data is synced via your application. Hosts can modify listing details on the Airbnb website, but not pricing and availability data.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span>Undecided</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"sync_undecided"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>All listing data is synced via your application, but the listing cannot be published. The sync category must be updated to Everything or Limited in order for the listing to be published.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span>None</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>null</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The listing is not API-connected. The Host manages the listing directly on the Airbnb website.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p>Setting of the sync category can be done in two ways:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>You can set the sync category through the API when publishing a listing from your application. You do so by either creating a brand new listing with a sync category or connecting to an existing listing on Airbnb by writing a sync category to it. </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Alternatively, you can leave this action to be done by the Host on the Airbnb <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/sync">sync page</a>.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Creating a New Listing
sections.content:
<p>The steps below describe the flow for publishing a new listing from your application.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><b>Create a listing: </b>Call the Listings API to <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#creating-a-listing">create a listing</a> with basic details. By default, the <code>requested_approval_status_category</code> is set to <code>"new"</code>, meaning Airbnb's automated review process is not invoked. When you create a listing, you have two options for the <code>synchronization_category</code>:</span><br>
</li>
<ul>
<li>
<span>Set it to <code>"sync_all"</code> to mark it as a new listing to be automatically published.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Set it to <code>"sync_undecided"</code> (the default value) to let the Host decide whether to publish it or merge it with an existing listing.</span><br>
</li>
</ul>
<li>
<span><b>Update details: </b>Call other APIs to upload or update listing attributes, photos, descriptions, availability and pricing to match the listing data in your software. Do not update the <code>has_availability</code> field until the listing is published, as setting it to <code>false</code> will reset the approval status to <code>"new"</code>.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Request review: </b>Once the listing is ready, call the Listings API again to <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#updating-a-listing">update the listing</a> and set the <code>requested_approval_status_category</code> to <code>"ready for review"</code>, triggering Airbnb's automated review. The review validates the listing against the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#api-program-listing-requirements">API Program Listing Requirements</a>. If the listing is rejected, you must address the rejection reason(s) and re-submit for review. Please note that some listings require manual approval, in which case the status  will remain as <code>"ready_for_review"</code>. Once these listings are reviewed by Airbnb, you will be notified of the result.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Publish: </b>Once the listing is approved, one of three things will occur.</span><br>
</li>
<ul>
<li>
<span>If the  <code>synchronization_category</code> was set to <code>"sync_all"</code> via the API then it will automatically be published<b>,</b> and <code>has_availability</code> will be set to <code>true</code>.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>If the <code>synchronization_category</code> is <code>"sync_undecided"</code> and the Host has no existing listings on Airbnb that are not API-connected, then the new listing will automatically be published. The sync category will be set to Everything (i.e. <code>"sync_all"</code>) and you will receive a <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-synchronization-settings-updated">Listing Synchronization Settings Updated</a> notification. The Host can subsequently change the sync category at any time on the <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/sync">sync page</a>.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>If the <code>synchronization_category</code> is <code>"sync_undecided"</code> and the Host has existing listings on Airbnb that are not API-connected, the Host must go to the <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/sync">sync page</a> to ensure a duplicate listing is not created when publishing.</span><br>
</li>
</ul>
</ul></div>
<blockquote>You cannot create a new listing with a Limited sync category. The Host must first create the listing on the Airbnb website and then your application can connect to it with a Limited sync category.</blockquote>
<h5 id="merging-with-an-existing-listing-on-the-sync-page">Merging with an Existing Listing on the Sync Page</h5>
<p>If you create a new listing without setting the sync category via the API and the Host has existing listings on Airbnb that are not API-connected, the Host must go to the Airbnb <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/sync">sync page</a> to choose whether to merge the newly-created listing with an existing listing, or publish it as a new listing.</p>
<p>On the sync page the Host can:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>merge a newly-created API-connected listing with an existing listing on Airbnb, if applicable. Note that the host can only merge with existing listings that they are an owner of,  cohosted listings are not supported.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>choose the sync category for the newly-created API-connected listing and publish it.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>You will receive a <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-synchronization-settings-updated">Listing Synchronization Settings Updated</a> notification whenever the Host performs an action on the sync page. See this <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/2347/">Help Center article</a> for more information on merging listings using the sync page.</p>
<p>The example below describes what happens when a Host merges a newly-created API-connected listing with an existing listing.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Your application successfully creates a surrogate listing through the API which gets assigned a listing ID of 12345.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>On the sync page, the Host merges this listing with one of their existing listings with a listing ID of 67890.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>You receive a <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-synchronization-settings-updated">Synchronization Settings Changed notification</a> that contains both IDs.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Your application is now allowed to edit listing 67890. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#existing-listing-content">Existing Listing Content</a> for details on what happens when the existing listing becomes API-connected.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Listing 12345 is deleted.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Connecting to an Existing Listing via the API
sections.content:
<p>You can connect to an existing listing that is not API-connected when publishing from your application through the API. To do so, first retrieve the Host's existing listings and provide an interface for the Host to map the listing in your software to an existing listing on Airbnb. Then call the Listings API to write a sync category to the existing listing. </p>
<blockquote>You can only connect to existing listings owned by the Host. You cannot connect to listings that are cohosted by the Host.</blockquote>
<h5 id="retrieving-a-host-s-existing-listings">Retrieving a Host's Existing Listings</h5>
<p>You can fetch the Host's existing Airbnb listings using the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#retrieving-all-host-listings">Listings API</a>. </p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>To retrieve only the listings that are not API-connected, select the listings whose <code>synchronization_category</code> field is <code>null.</code></span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>To retrieve only the listings that the Host owns (i.e. is not a cohost of), use the <annotation><code>exclude_cohosted_listings</code></annotation> query parameter.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<h5 id="connection-steps">Connection Steps</h5>
<p>The steps below describe the flow for connecting to an existing listing from your application.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><b>Connect to an existing listing</b>: Call the Listings API to <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#updating-a-listing">update the listing</a> and set the <code>synchronization_category</code> to either <code>"sync_all"</code> or <code>"sync_rates_and_availability"</code>. Unless specified in the request, the <code>requested_approval_status_category</code> will be initialized to <code>"new"</code> and the listing will be temporarily unlisted until it is approved.  See Existing Listing Content for details on what happens when an existing listing becomes API-connected.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Update details: </b>Call other APIs to upload or update listing attributes, photos, descriptions, availability and pricing to match the listing data in your software. Do not update the <code>has_availability</code> field until the listing is published, as setting it to <code>false</code> will reset the approval status to <code>"new"</code>.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Request review: </b>Once the listing is ready, call the Listings API again to <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#updating-a-listing">update the listing</a> and set the <code>requested_approval_status_category</code> to <code>"ready for review"</code>, triggering Airbnb's automated review. The review validates the listing against the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#api-program-listing-requirements">API Program Listing Requirements</a>. If the listing is rejected, you must address the rejection reason(s) and re-submit for review.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Publish: </b>Once the listing is approved, it will automatically be published<b>,</b> i.e. <code>has_availability</code> will be set to <code>true</code>.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<blockquote>
<b>Note:</b> If you use <code>"sync_rates_and_availability"</code> and the existing listing's content does not meet the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#api-program-listing-requirements">API Program Listing Requirements</a>, the connection will be rejected. The existing listing will be unaffected by the connection attempt.</blockquote>

sections.name: Existing Listing Content
sections.content:
<p>When you connect to an existing listing on Airbnb via the API, or when the host merges a newly-created API-connected listing with an existing listing on the sync page, none of the existing listing's content is replaced. All reservations, reviews, and content of the existing listing remain untouched. Most pricing and availability settings also remain, with the following exceptions:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Any imported iCals on the existing listing are unlinked when it becomes API-connected. This may open up dates that were previously blocked by iCals. After the connection is made, check the listing's availability and make necessary updates through API.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>The existing listing is converted to Instant Book if it was previously Request to Book.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Custom pricing and availability settings, such as discounts, seasonal rules and standard fees are cleared as they may not be supported by your application. <b>After the connection is made, perform any updates that are needed.</b></span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>To update the existing listing's information, make all the necessary listing update calls. </p>
<p>You will not receive any webhook notifications for existing bookings for the newly connected listings. <b>We suggest you perform an initial fetch of all existing reservations</b> using the <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#retrieving-all-reservations">Reservations API</a>.</p>

sections.name: Syncing Only Pricing and Availability
sections.content:
<p>If you only have pricing and availability data for a listing and want to sync that with Airbnb without providing listing content, you can do so using Limited sync.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>First, the Host must create the listing on the Airbnb website if it is not already created. They can enter any valid values for pricing information as these fields will be overwritten when your application connects to the listing. An API-connected Host can create listings on the Airbnb website.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Once the listing has been created, you can connect to the listing and set the sync category to <code>"sync_rates_and_availability"</code>. You do not need to provide any content when you connect to the listing.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>The listing is now connected with your application and will sync pricing and availability data from it. Any pricing data on the listing prior to the connection is overwritten with data from your application.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Managing a Published Listing
Updating the Sync Category
sections.content: <p>You can update the sync category of a listing at any time. The Host can also update the sync category of a listing after it is published via the sync page. You will receive a <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-synchronization-settings-updated">Listing Synchronization Settings Updated notification</a> when any changes to the sync category occur. </p>

sections.name: Updating Limited Sync Listings
sections.content:
<p>For listings with a Limited sync category, API requests to update listing content are blocked and will return a 403 (Forbidden) error. </p>
<p>Your application has full write access to the  <code>/pricing_settings</code>, <code>/availability_rules</code>,  <code>/seasonal_rule_sets</code>, <code>/seasonal_rule_set_timelines</code>, <code>/calendars</code>,  <code>/calendar_operations</code>, and <code>/<annotation>listing_permits</annotation></code> endpoints. For the <code>/listings</code> endpoint, however, only the <code>has_availability</code> , <code>total_inventory_count</code> and <code>property_external_id</code> fields can be updated for Limited sync listings.</p>

sections.name: Unlisting Listings
sections.content: <p>To unlist a listing, set its <code>has_availability</code> field to <code>false</code>. This removes the listing from search results and hides it from guests' view. While unlisted, you can still update the listing's content. To re-list the listing, set the <code>has_availability</code> field to <code>true</code>. </p>

sections.name: Disconnecting (Unlinking) Listings
sections.content:
<p>An API-connected listing can be disconnected from your application at any time. The Host can do this on the sync page using the “Stop Sync” button.  Your application can do this by <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#updating-a-listing">calling the Listings API to update</a> the <code>synchronization_category</code> to <code>null</code>. Once disconnected, the Host must manage the listing directly on the Airbnb website. You will receive a <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listings-unlinked">Listings Unlinked notification</a> when a listing is disconnected from your application. Once disconnected, any updates to that listing through the API will result in a 403 error.</p>
<blockquote>The Host cannot reverse a stop sync. If the Host wants to resume managing the listing through your application, you must connect to the listing again.</blockquote>

sections.name: Deleting Listings
sections.content: <p>You can choose to completely delete a listing. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#deleting-a-listing">Deleting a Listing</a>. You will receive a <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listings-unlinked">Listings Unlinked</a> notification when this happens.</p>

sections.name: Disconnecting the Host's Account from your Application
sections.content: <p>Your application can be disconnected from the Host's account at any time. You can do this by <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default#revoking-a-token">revoking their token</a> and the Host can perform this action from their Account Settings. When this occurs, all the Host's listings will be disconnected from your application and you will lose access to the Host's account. You will receive an <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#authorization-revoked">Authorization Revoked notification</a> when a Host's account is disconnected from your application.</p>

sections.name: API Program Listing Requirements
sections.content: <p>All listings published via the API are subject to our <a href="/partner/api-docs/overview/default#listing-api-program-policies">Listing API Program Policies</a>. Any listing that fails to meet the requirements of the policies will not be approved for publishing.</p>

sections.name: Notes on Testing
Creating Test Listings
sections.content:
<p>Do not create test listings under the Airbnb partner account (i.e. the account that owns the test application). Instead, create a new Airbnb account and authorize your test application for access.</p>
<p>Always authorize your test application with your test user account <i>before</i> creating test listings with that account. Once you authorize your test application with the account, any listings created with that account will only be visible to your test users. Furthermore, these listings will not be subject to our fake inventory monitors. Creating test listings without first authorizing your test application with the test user account could result in those listings being deleted by our fake inventory monitors. </p>

sections.name: Testing Checklist
sections.content:
<p>Before granting supply partners access to a production application, Airbnb will verify that they have completed the following listing management checklist using their test application.</p>
<h5 id="onboarding-listings">Onboarding listings</h5>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Create listings that both meet and don’t meet our minimum standards.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Confirm receipt of listing approval notifications (both approval and rejections).</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Publish at least 5 listings. Make sure to test all variations:</span><br>
</li>
<ul>
<li>
<span>publishing a new listing with full sync and with with limited sync</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>connecting to an existing listing with full and with limited sync. When connecting to existing listings make sure to import all current reservations. Tip: a quick way to create listings to use for connecting to is to stop sync some API listings, which will disconnect them from your application.</span><br>
</li>
</ul>
<li>
<span>Confirm the receipt of the Synchronization Settings notifications.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<h5 id="managing-listings">Managing Listings</h5>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Make sure you can successfully unlist and relist listings.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Try unlinking (stop sync) several listings. Confirm the receipt of unlinked notifications.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Try unlinking the entire account in two ways: by revoking a token, and by clicking Disconnect under Connected Apps as a host. Confirm the receipt of the authorization revoked notification.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Rate Limits
sections.content:
<p>Please first review the general API <a href="/partner/api-docs/overview/default#rate-limiting">Rate Limiting </a>requirements and ways to handle such issues. Listing Management comes with its own specific requirements, described below.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><code>POST/PUT .../listings</code> . We have a per application limit of 40 <code>lat</code>, <code>lng</code> updates per minute. Once reached, an error is returned for up to one minute.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><code>POST .../listing_photos</code> . We have a per application limit 50,000 image uploads per hour. Once reached, an error is returned for up to one hour.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><code>POST/PUT .../calendar_operations</code> requests. We have a per application limit of 160 batch calendar uploads per minute. Once reached, an error is returned for up to one minute.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Listings API
sections.content: <p>You can use the <code>/listings</code> API to <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#creating-a-listing">create</a>, <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#updating-a-listing">update</a>, <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#retrieving-a-listing">retrieve</a>, and <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#deleting-a-listing">delete</a> a listing.</p>

sections.name: Creating a Listing
sections.content:
<pre class="highlight text"><code>POST /v2/listings</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-body-parameters">Request Body Parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>synchronization_category</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional, default is <code>"sync_undecided"</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>One of <code>"sync_all"</code>, <code>"sync_undecided"</code>. Note that <code>"sync_rates_and_availability"</code> is not supported for listing creation. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#sync-categories">Sync Categories</a> for more info.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>name</code> <br> <i>string</i><br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing name. 255 chars maximum, 8 chars minimum. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>property_type_group</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Generalized group of the property types. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#property-type-groups">supported property type groups</a> and allowed property types for each.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>property_type_category</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Property type, e.g., <code>"apartment"</code>, <code>"house"</code>, <code>"bnb"</code>, etc.. Must be from list of <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#property-types">supported strings</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>room_type_category</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional, default is </u><u><code>private_room</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Property privacy description. One of <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code> or <code>"entire_home"</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>bedrooms</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional, default is 1</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Number of bedrooms.  The minimum value is 0, and the maximum is 50. <b>Note: 0 bedrooms indicates a studio, and should only be used for this case.</b></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>bathrooms</code> <br> <i>float</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Number of bathrooms. The minimum value is 0, and the maximum is 50. Half values can be used, e.g. 1.5.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>beds</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Number of beds. If only one, the <code>bed_type_category</code> field must be set to describe its type.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>amenity_categories</code> <br> <i>array of strings</i> <br> <u>optional, default is [ ]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Amenity array. Must be from list of <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#amenity-strings">supported strings</a>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>check_in_option</code> <br><i>object</i><br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Describes how guests will check in. See Checkin Option parameter below.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>permit_or_tax_id</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The local permit or tax ID (if required) for display on public listing page. <b>Note:</b> should not be used to provide registration information in cities where Airbnb works with local governments to register hosts.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>apt</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Apartment/Unit. Non-special characters only. E.g: "Apt 32"</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>street</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Street address. Should include number, street name, and street suffix.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>city</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>City</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>state</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>States, territories, districts, or province. For US states use the two letter abbreviation.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>zipcode</code><br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Zipcode</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>country_code</code><br> <i>string</i> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing's two-letter country code, capitalized. Format: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2">ISO 3166-1 alpha-2</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>lat</code> <br> <i>float</i> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Latitude. You can use Google Maps to find the listing's latitude and longitude.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>lng</code> <br> <i>float</i> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Longitude.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>directions</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Directions for confirmed guests. Directions are private and only shared with guests after a reservation is confirmed.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>person_capacity</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional, default is 1</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Maximum number of guests that can be accommodated. Default is 1.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_currency</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional, default is country's currency</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Currency used for setting listing price. Only <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#supported-currencies">supported strings</a> are accepted. Format: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217">ISO 4217</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_price</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing's base nightly price. Price is in <code>listing_currency</code> currency. Minimum = 10 USD, maximum = 25000 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>bathroom_shared</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Is the bathroom shared? Ignore for <code>"entire_home"</code> listings.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>bathroom_shared_with_category</code> <br> <i>array of strings</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Who is the bathroom shared with? Pass one or more from <code>"host"</code>, <code>"family_friends_roommates"</code>, <code>"other_guests"</code>. Ignore for <code>"entire_home"</code> listings. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>common_spaces_shared</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Are the common spaces shared? Not applicable for <code>entire_home</code> listings.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>common_spaces_shared_with_category</code> <br> <i>array of strings</i><br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Who are the common spaces shared with? Pass one or more from <code>"host"</code>, <code>"family_friends_roommates"</code>, <code>"other_guests"</code>. Ignore for <code>"entire_home"</code> listings.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>requested_approval_status_category</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional, default is <code>"new"</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing’s Airbnb review status. Use <code>"new"</code> during creation (also the default value).</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>total_inventory_count</code><br><i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><b>Room Type inventory only.</b> The total amount of rooms of a certain room type.<br>Valid value: &gt;0. For more information about room types, see the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#room-type-inventory">Room Type Inventory section</a> of the Appendix.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>property_external_id</code><br> <i>string</i><br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><b>Room Type inventory only. </b>A string indicating which property current listing belongs to. This id can be the property's id on PMS platform; the id for each property should be unique. For more information about room types, see the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#room-type-inventory">Room Type Inventory section</a> of the Appendix.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>Checkin Option Parameters</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>category</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The type of check in the host offers. Must one of <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#check-in-option-types">supported strings</a>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>instruction</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The instructions for guests on how to checkin. Only shared with confirmed guests.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>Deprecated Parameters</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>bed_type_category</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br><u>[DEPRECATED]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-rooms-api">Listing Rooms API</a> instead. The type of bed for listings with only one bed. Only <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#bed-types">supported strings</a> are accepted.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>check_in_time</code> <br> <i>integer </i> <br>[DEPRECATED] </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#booking-settings-api">Booking Settings API</a> instead. The check-in hour of the listing, from 0-23. Examples: 0 (midnight), 1 (1am), 13 (1pm). A value less than 0 or bigger than 23 will result in flexible check-in time. This field is deprecated - you should use <code>check_in_time_start</code> and <code>check_in_time_end</code> instead<u>.</u></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>check_in_time_start</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>[DEPRECATED]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#booking-settings-api">Booking Settings API</a> instead. Earliest time the guest can check in, indicated as hour between <code>"8"</code> and <code>"24"</code>, or  <code>"FLEXIBLE"</code>. Use this instead of <code>check_in_time</code> if you want to specify a check-in window, as it can be combined with <code>check_in_time_end</code> to specify a window that a guest can check in. Note: only supported for updates.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>check_in_time_end</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>[DEPRECATED]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#booking-settings-api">Booking Settings API</a> instead. Latest time the guest can check in, indicated as hour between <code>"8" </code>and <code>"26"</code>, or <code>"FLEXIBLE"</code> (Note: <code>25</code> and <code>26</code> are 1am and 2am for the <b>next</b> day, respectively). <code>check_in_time_start</code> required for the end time to apply. Note: only supported for updates.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>check_out_time</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br>[DEPRECATED]</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#booking-settings-api">Booking Settings API</a> instead. The check-out hour of the listing, from 0-23. Examples: 0 (midnight), 1 (1am), 13 (1pm). A value outside the 0-23 range results in a flexible check-out time.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>min_nights_input_value</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>[DEPRECATED]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#availability-rules-api">Availability Rules API</a> instead. Minimum number of nights allowed for a reservation. Default is 0;</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>max_nights_input_value</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>[DEPRECATED]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>User <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#availability-rules-api">Availability Rules API</a> instead. Maximum number of nights allowed for a reservation. Default is 0.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>cancellation_policy_category</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br><u>[DEPRECATED]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#booking-settings-api">Booking Settings API</a> instead. Listing's cancellation policy. Only <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#cancellation-policies">supported strings</a> are accepted. Default is <code>flexible</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_weekend_price</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>[DEPRECATED]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#pricing-settings-api">Pricing Settings API</a> instead. Weekend price per night. If specified, this price is applied to every Friday and Saturday for this listing. Price is in <code>listing_currency</code> currency. Minimum = 10 USD, maximum = 25000 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_weekly_price</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>[DEPRECATED]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#pricing-settings-api">Pricing Settings API</a> instead. Listing's discounted weekly price. Price is in <code>listing_currency</code> currency.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_monthly_price</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>[DEPRECATED]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#pricing-settings-api">Pricing Settings API</a> instead. If set, this price applies to any reservation 28 nights or longer. Price is in <code>listing_currency</code> currency.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_security_deposit</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>[DEPRECATED]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#pricing-settings-api">Pricing Settings API</a> instead. A security deposit held by Airbnb and refunded to the guest unless you make claim within 48 hours after guest checkout. Minimum=100 USD, maximum = 5000 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_cleaning_fee</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>[DEPRECATED]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#pricing-settings-api">Pricing Settings API</a> instead. Cleaning fee, denoted in <code>listing_currency </code>currency. The cleaning fee must be at least USD $5 and can be at most USD $600 + 25% nightly price.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>guests_included</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>[DEPRECATED]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#pricing-settings-api">Pricing Settings API</a> instead. Number of guests permitted without any additional fees. Default is 1.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_extra_person_price</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>[DEPRECATED]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#pricing-settings-api">Pricing Settings API</a> instead. Amount added to the listing's nightly price for each guest beyond the number specified in <code>guests_included</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>instant_book_welcome_message</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>[DEPRECATED]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#booking-settings-api">Booking Settings API</a> instead. Paragraph for Hosts to Introduce themselves and ask for the things that are important for them to know, like the purpose of the guest's trip and their check-in time. Guests are asked to respond to this when they book.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response">Response</h5>
<p>A <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-object">Listing Object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"POST"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/listings"</span>  <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key:cgdrdjfv4hvzptgcax0ncplnf'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-OAuth-Token:12taga7tyfzgm3bf73fwaq0e2'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -d <span class="s1">'{
  "amenity_categories": [
    "kitchen",
    "wireless_internet",
    "tv",
    "ac",
    "washer",
    "dryer"
  ],
  "bathrooms": 2,
  "bedrooms": 3,
  "beds": 3,
  "city": "St Helena",
  "state": "CA",
  "street": "1691 Sulphur Springs Ave",
  "zipcode": "94574",
  "country_code": "US",
  "directions": "Take a cab from the airport",
  "lat": 38.490468,
  "listing_price": 100,
  "listing_currency": "USD",
  "lng": -122.460452,
  "name": "Amazing House in Wine Country",
  "person_capacity": 8,
  "property_type_category": "house",
  "room_type_category": "entire_home",
  "user_defined_location": true
  }'</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response">Example Response </h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"listing"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"amenity_categories"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="s2">"tv"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="s2">"wireless_internet"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="s2">"ac"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="s2">"kitchen"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="s2">"washer"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="s2">"dryer"</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"apt"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"bathrooms"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"bedrooms"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"beds"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"city"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"St Helena"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"country_code"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"US"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"directions"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Take a cab from the airport"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">21425420</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"lat"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mf">38.490467</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_price"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_currency"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"USD"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"lng"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mf">-122.460449</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"name"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Amazing House in Wine Country"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"permit_or_tax_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"person_capacity"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"property_type_category"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"house"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"requested_approval_status_category"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"new"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"room_type_category"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"entire_home"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"state"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"CA"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"street"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"1691 Sulphur Springs Ave"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"user_defined_location"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">true</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"zipcode"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"94574"</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"metadata"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    
  </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Updating a Listing
sections.content:
<p>You can update an existing listing. </p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>PUT /v2/listings/:listing_id</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-id">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>id</code> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the listing passed in the URL.</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="request-body-parameters-2">Request Body Parameters</h5>
<p>Use any of the fields from the create call. Only included fields are updated, the rest are left the same. Below are some of the update fields with special update behavior:</p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>synchronization_category</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <code>"sync_all"</code> or  <code>"sync_rates_and_availability"</code> to update the sync category of an API-connected listing or connect to an existing listing that is not API-connected. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#sync-categories">Sync Categories</a> for more info. Use <code>null</code> to disconnect an API listing from your application.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>requested_approval_status_category</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing’s Airbnb review status. Use one of <code>"new"</code>, <code>"ready for review"</code>. We suggest using this field in a separate call from listing content fields, as we can't ensure the order in which payload keys are processed. If the listing is already approved, please leave out this field to avoid triggering another review.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>has_availability</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Set this field to <code>false</code> to take the listing offline. Set it to <code>true</code> to re-publish it. Do not use this field until the listing is published (at that point, it is set to <code>true</code>). If you explicitly set it to <code>false</code> before the listing is published, the onboarding process is reset and the approval status is set to "<code>new"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-2">Response</h5>
<p>A <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-object">Listing Object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-2">Example Request</h5>
<p><b>Note:</b> This is the call you would make once you are done making all the API calls for your new listing and you are ready to have it approved or rejected via Airbnb's automated review process.</p>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"PUT"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/listings/12345678"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
-H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: dzg84rxxxjkr4qo99so9rd8n0"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
-H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: 5jah5juioe4rnbbd7xef5xqnnThe "</span> <span class="se">\</span>
-d <span class="s1">'{"requested_approval_status_category":"ready for review"}'</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Retrieving a Listing
sections.content:
<pre class="highlight text"><code>GET /v2/listings/:listing_id</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-id-2">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>id</code> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the listing </span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-3">Response</h5>
<p>A<a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-object"> Listing Object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-3">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"GET"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/listings/166916"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 8uaxi4r1busbeg21fuacga40c"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: av8mf8kd4k40fq26xxd9w4p44"</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Retrieving all Host Listings
sections.content:
<p>Fetch a Host's listings as <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-object">Listing Object </a>array.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>GET /v2/listings</code></pre>
<blockquote>NOTE: All listings are returned, including manual (not API-connected) listings. Look at the <code>synchronization_category</code> field to see whether the listing is connected to the API or not.</blockquote>
<h5 id="request-url-parameters">Request URL parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Param</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>user_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The owner of the listings</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>has_availability</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <u>optional, default is </u><u><code>true</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Set this to <code>false</code> if all user listings (including unlisted) should be returned. If not specified, only the listed listings are returned.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>exclude_active</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <u>optional, default is </u><u><code>false</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If <code>true</code>, only the unlisted listings are returned.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>exclude_cohosted_listings</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <u>optional, default is </u><u><code>false</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If <code>true</code>, only the owned listings are returned.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>_limit</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional, default is 20</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The maximum number of listings to return, up to 50.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>_offset</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional, default is 0</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The number of listings to skip over, where the ordering is consistent but unspecified. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-4">Response</h5>
<p>Array of <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-object">Listing Objects</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-4">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"GET"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/listings?user_id=1234567&amp;has_availability=true"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 8uaxi4r1busbeg21fuacga40c"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: av8mf8kd4k40fq26xxd9w4p44"</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Deleting a Listing
sections.content:
<p>Upon success, the deleted listing is returned. Failure returns a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_404">404 (not found)</a> error.</p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Fails if a listing has an upcoming reservation. Use the unlisting option instead.</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>DELETE /v2/listings/:listing_id</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-id-3">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>id</code> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the listing</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-request-5">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"DELETE"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/listings/12345678"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
-H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
-H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: dzg84rxxxjkr4qo99so9rd8n0"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
-H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: 5jah5juioe4rnbbd7xef5xqnn"</span> </code></pre>

sections.name: Listing Object
sections.content:
<p>Airbnb creates a Listing Object for each listing created through the API. This object is returned for all API calls.</p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>id</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing ID - Airbnb assigned.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>name</code> <br> <i>string</i> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing name</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>property_type_group</code> <br> <i>string</i> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Generalized group of the property types. See the list <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#property-type-groups">supported strings</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>property_type_category</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Property style description, e.g., <code>"apartment"</code>, <code>"house"</code>, <code>"bnb"</code>, etc.. One of <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#property-types">supported strings</a>. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>room_type_category</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br></span><br>
</td>
<td>
