sections.name: Pricing Settings API
Updating Pricing Settings
sections.content:
<p>You can use call endpoint to update the listing's associated global pricing settings, including weekly/monthly discounts, Standard Fees and others. To add pricing settings for specific periods of time, use the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#seasonal-rule-group-api">Seasonal Rule Group API</a> or the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#los-records-api">LOS Records API</a>.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>PUT /v2/pricing_settings/:listing_id</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-id-14">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>the ID of the listing</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="request-body-parameters-10">Request Body Parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_currency</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Currency used for listing prices. Note that you can't include any other pricing fields when updating the currency. Split such requests into two. Only <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#supported-currencies">supported strings</a> are accepted. Format: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217">ISO 4217</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>default_daily_price</code> <br><i>integer</i><br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The default daily price for the listing. Must be between 10 and 25,000 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>weekend_price</code> <br><i>integer</i><br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The default price to apply for the weekend nights (Friday night and Satruday night). Must be between 10 and 25,000 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>security_deposit</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A security deposit held by Airbnb and refunded to the guest unless you make claim within 48 hours after guest checkout. Must be between 100 and 5000 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>cleaning_fee</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Cleaning fee, denoted in <code>listing_currency</code> currency. Maximum  cleaning fee is (600 USD + 25% nightly price). Minimum cleaning fee is 5 USD. To remove a cleaning fee, set the value to 0.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>guests_included</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Number of guests permitted without any additional fees. The minimum and default is 1.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>price_per_extra_person</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Amount added to the listing's nightly price for each guest beyond the number specified in <code>guests_included</code>. Minimum is 5 USD. Maximum is 300 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>monthly_price_factor</code> <br> <i>float</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If set, multiply the price by this factor for trips of at least 28 days.  Range from <code>0</code> to <code>1</code>. For example, <code>0.7</code> means 30% off. Note that this is treated as an <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#seasonal-rule-group-api">LOS pricing rule</a>, so be careful to avoid conflicts.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>weekly_price_factor</code> <br> <i>float</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If set, multiply the price by this factor for trips between 7 and 28 days.  Range from <code>0</code> to <code>1</code>. For example, <code>0.7</code> means 30% off. Must be greater than <code>monthly_price_factor</code>. Note that this is treated as an <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#seasonal-rule-group-api">LOS pricing rule</a>, so be careful to avoid conflicts.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>standard_fees</code><br><i>array of objects</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Array of Standard Fees to be applied to the listing. For more information about fees see the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#standard-fees">Standard Fees section</a> of the Appendix. See the Standard Fee Parameters below.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>Standard Fee Paramaters</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>fee_type</code><br><i>string</i><br><b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>One of the following strings: <code>PASS_THROUGH_RESORT_FEE</code>, <code>PASS_THROUGH_MANAGEMENT_FEE</code>, <code>PASS_THROUGH_COMMUNITY_FEE</code>, <code>PASS_THROUGH_LINEN_FEE<br></code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>amount</code><br><i>float or integer</i><br><b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If <code>amount_type</code> is percent, this is a float between <code>0</code> and <code>100</code> (inclusive). If <code>amount_type</code> is flat, this is an integer in micros of the listing currency. For example, if a USD listing charged a $1 fee, this field should be <code>1000000</code>. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>amount_type</code><br><i>string</i><br><b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"percent"</code> or <code>"flat"</code> Please note, <code>PASS_THROUGH_LINEN_FEE</code> must be "flat". </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-22">Response</h5>
<p>A <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#pricing-settings-object">Pricing Settings object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-25">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"POST"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/pricing_settings/24567854"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 62dyanvq40b1hn5yor1cviqoe"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: 5jah5juioe4rnbbd7xef5xqom"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -d <span class="s1">'{
       "cleaning_fee": 50,
       "default_daily_price": 120,
       "guests_included": 4,
       "monthly_price_factor": 0.75,
       "weekly_price_factor": 0.8,
       "price_per_extra_person": 15,
       "security_deposit": 250,
       "standard_fees": [
         {
           "fee_type": "PASS_THROUGH_RESORT_FEE",
           "amount": 5,
           "amount_type": "percent"
         },
         {
           "fee_type": "PASS_THROUGH_MANAGEMENT_FEE",
           "amount": 20,
           "amount_type": "percent"
         }
      ]
    }'</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-18">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"pricing_setting"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"cleaning_fee"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">50</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"default_daily_price"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">120</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"guests_included"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"monthly_price_factor"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mf">0.75</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"weekly_price_factor"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mf">0.8</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"price_per_extra_person"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">15</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"security_deposit"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">250</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"standard_fees"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"fee_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"PASS_THROUGH_RESORT_FEE"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"amount"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"amount_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"percent"</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"fee_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"PASS_THROUGH_MANAGEMENT_FEE"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"amount"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">20</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"amount_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"percent"</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"metadata"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{},</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="err">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Retrieving Pricing Settings
sections.content:
<p>You can use this call to retrieve the listing's associated pricing settings.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>GET /v2/pricing_settings/:listing_id</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-id-15">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>the ID of the listing</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-23">Response</h5>
<p>A <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#pricing-settings-object">Pricing Settings object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-26">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"GET"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/pricing_settings/24567854"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 62dyanvq40b1hn5yor1cviqoe"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: 5jah5juioe4rnbbd7xef5xqom"</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-19">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"pricing_setting"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"cleaning_fee"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">50</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"default_daily_price"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">120</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"guests_included"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"monthly_price_factor"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mf">0.75</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"weekly_price_factor"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mf">0.8</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"price_per_extra_person"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">15</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"security_deposit"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">250</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"standard_fees"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"fee_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"PASS_THROUGH_RESORT_FEE"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"amount"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"amount_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"percent"</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"fee_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"PASS_THROUGH_MANAGEMENT_FEE"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"amount"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">20</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"amount_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"percent"</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"metadata"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{},</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="err">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Pricing Settings Object
sections.content:
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_currency</code> <br> <i>string</i> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Currency used for listing prices. Note that you can't include any other pricing fields when updating the currency. Split such requests into two. Only <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#supported-currencies">supported strings</a> are accepted. Format: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217">ISO 4217</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>default_daily_price</code> <br><i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The default daily price for the listing. Must be between 10 and 25,000 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>weekend_price</code> <br><i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The default price to apply for the weekend days. Must be between 10 and 25,000 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>security_deposit</code> <br> <i>integer</i> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A security deposit held by Airbnb and refunded to the guest unless you make claim within 48 hours after guest checkout. Must be between 100 and 5000 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>cleaning_fee</code> <br> <i>integer</i> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Cleaning fee, denoted in <code>listing_currency </code>currency. Maximum  cleaning fee is (600 USD + 25% nightly price). Minimum cleaning fee is 5 USD. To remove a cleaning fee, set the value to 0.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>guests_included</code> <br> <i>integer</i> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Number of guests permitted without any additional fees. Default is 1.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>price_per_extra_person</code> <br> <i>integer</i> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Amount added to the listing's nightly price for each guest beyond the number specified in <code>guests_included</code>. Minimum is 5 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>monthly_price_factor</code> <br> <i>float</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If set, multiply the price by this factor for trips of at least 28 days.  Range from <code>0</code> to <code>1</code>. For example, <code>0.7</code> means 30% off. Note that this is treated as an <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#seasonal-rule-group-api">LOS pricing rule</a>, so be careful to avoid conflicts.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>weekly_price_factor</code> <br> <i>float</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If set, multiply the price by this factor for trips between 7 and 28 days.  Range from <code>0</code> to <code>1</code>. For example, <code>0.7</code> means 30% off. Must be greater than <code>montly_price_factor</code>. Note that this is treated as an <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#seasonal-rule-group-api">LOS pricing rule</a>, so be careful to avoid conflicts.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>standard_fees</code><br><i>array of objects</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Array of Standard Fees to be applied to the listing. For more information about fees see the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#standard-fees">Standard Fees section</a> of the Appendix. See the Standard Fee Object below.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>Standard Fee Object</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>fee_type</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>One of the following strings: <code>PASS_THROUGH_RESORT_FEE</code>, <code>PASS_THROUGH_MANAGEMENT_FEE</code>, <code>PASS_THROUGH_COMMUNITY_FEE</code>, <code>PASS_THROUGH_LINEN_FEE</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>amount</code><br><i>float or integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If <code>amount_type</code> is percent, this is a float between <code>0</code> and <code>100</code> (inclusive). If <code>amount_type</code> is flat, this is an integer in micros of the listing currency. For example, if a USD listing charged a $1 fee, this field should be <code>1000000</code>. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>amount_type</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"percent"</code> or <code>"flat"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>

sections.name: Calendars API
sections.content:
<p>Hosts need to maintain accurate schedules across listing platforms. The <code>.../calendars</code> API lets you update daily availability and pricing for a given listing and date range. Prices set here override default nightly listing prices.</p>
<blockquote>By default, for new listings, the calendar is set to available for all dates. To reduce server load, it is recommended you only submit dates that are unavailable.</blockquote>
<blockquote>The price displayed on a listing when no dates are selected is the lowest price within the next 30 available days.</blockquote>

sections.name: Updating a Calendar Range
sections.content:
<p>You can use this endpoint to update daily calendar availability and pricing for a given listing ID and date range. Prices set here override default listing nightly prices.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>PUT /v2/calendars/:listing_id/:start_date/:end_date </code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-id-16"><b>Request URL ID</b></h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code><br><i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>start_date</code><br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Start date range start to update, in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601">ISO 8601</a> YYYY-MM-DD format.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>end_date</code><br><i>string</i><br><u>optional, default is <code>start_date</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>End date range to update, in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601">ISO 8601</a> YYYY-MM-DD format.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="request-body-parameters-11">Request Body Parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>daily_price</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Nightly price for this day. Minimum = 10 USD, maximum = 25000 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>availability</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Either <code>"available"</code> , <code>"unavailable"</code>  or <code>"default"</code>. Please use <code>"default"</code> instead of <code>"available"</code>  if you want the day to comply with any availability rules you set, since <code>"available"</code> overwrites any availability rules.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>min_nights</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Minimum length of stay if the trip starts on this day. Use <code>null</code> to unset this value.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>max_nights</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Maximum length of stay if the trip starts on this day. Use <code>null</code> to unset this value.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>closed_to_arrival</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <u>optional, default is <code>false</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If <code>true</code>, the guest cannot check in on this day. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>closed_to_departure</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <u>optional, default is </u><u><code>false</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If <code>true</code>, the guest cannot check out on this day. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>notes</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Optional notes.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-24">Response</h5>
<p>A <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest/#calendar-object">Calendar Object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-27">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key:cgdrdjfv4hvzptgcax0ncplnf'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-OAuth-Token:12taga7tyfzgm3bf73fwaq0e2'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -X PUT <span class="se">\</span>
     -d <span class="s1">'{"availability":"available","daily_price":66}'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     https://api.airbnb.com/v2/calendars/4525291/2015-02-23/2015-02-24</code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-20">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">

      </span><span class="nt">"days"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"availability"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"available"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"availability_sub_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"availability_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"available"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"closed_to_arrival"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"closed_to_departure"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"daily_price"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">66</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"2015-02-23"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"min_nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"max_nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">1125</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"notes"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"availability"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"available"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"availability_sub_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"availability_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"available"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"closed_to_arrival"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"closed_to_departure"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"daily_price"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">66</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"2015-02-24"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"min_nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"max_nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">1125</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"notes"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"end_date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"2015-02-24"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"host_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">22919678</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"listing_currency"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"USD"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">5240677</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"start_date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"2015-02-23"</span><span class="w">
   </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
   </span><span class="nt">"metadata"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="another-example-request">Another Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X PUT <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key:cgdrdjfv4hvzptgcax0ncplnf'</span> <span class="se">\</span>

  -d <span class="s1">'{"closed_to_arrival":true,"min_nights":12}'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  https://api.airbnb.com/v2/calendars/4525291/2015-07-01</code></pre>

  </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">

</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Retrieving a Calendar Range
sections.content:
<p>You can use this endpoint to retrieve daily calendar availability and pricing for a given listing ID and date range.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>GET /v2/calendars/:listing_id/:start_date/:end_date</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-id-17">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code><br><i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>start_date</code><br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Start date range start to update, in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601">ISO 8601</a> YYYY-MM-DD format.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>end_date</code><br><i>string</i><br><u>optional, default is <code>start_date</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>End date range to update, in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601">ISO 8601</a> YYYY-MM-DD format.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-25">Response</h5>
<p>A <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest/#calendar-object">Calendar Object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-28">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key: gu7tsjffe4vzptgcax0ncplnq'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-OAuth-Token: ezmlazpa7v25xb3f24mw6n4hx'</span> <span class="se">\ </span>
     -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> 
     -X GET https://api.airbnb.com/v2/calendars/21562250/2017-02-23/2017-02-24</code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-21">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
   </span><span class="nt">"calendar"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"days"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"availability"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"available"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"availability_sub_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"availability_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"available"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"closed_to_arrival"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"closed_to_departure"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"daily_price"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">66</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"2017-02-23"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"min_nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"max_nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">1125</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"notes"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"availability"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"available"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"availability_sub_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"availability_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"available"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"closed_to_arrival"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"closed_to_departure"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"daily_price"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">66</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"2017-02-24"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"min_nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"max_nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">1125</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="nt">"notes"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"end_date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"2017-02-24"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"host_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">22919678</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"listing_currency"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"USD"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">5240677</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"start_date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"2017-02-23"</span><span class="w">
   </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
   </span><span class="nt">"metadata"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Calendar Object
sections.content:
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code><br><i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>host_id</code><br><i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Host ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>days</code><br><i>array of objects</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Calendar Day object array.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>start_date</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Start date range, e.g., "2017-12-23".</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>end_date</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>End date range, e.g., "2017-12-30".</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_currency</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Currency used for setting listing price. Format: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217">ISO 4217</a> e.g., "USD" .</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>

sections.name: Calendar Day Object
sections.content:
<p>The Calendar Day Object contains, besides all the request parameters, the following additional fields:</p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>date</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Date in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601">ISO 8601</a> YYYY-MM-DD format.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>daily_price</code><br><i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Nightly price for this day.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>availability</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Either <code>"available"</code> , <code>"unavailable"</code>  or <code>"default"</code>. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>availability_type</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A detailed breakdown of the availability field.<br>* If <code>availability</code> is <code>available</code>, <code>availability_type</code> is <code>available</code>.<br>* If <code>availability</code> is <code>unavailable</code>,<code> availability_type</code> could be<br>     * <code>busy</code> ( this day is blocked off )<br>     * <code>reservation</code> ( this day has a reservation )<br>     * <code>rule</code> ( this day is unavailable due to a calendar rule )</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>availability_sub_type</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A detailed breakdown of the <code>availability_type</code> field.<br>* If availability_type is <code>busy</code>, <code>availability_sub_type</code> could be<br>    * <code>host_busy</code> (Host set these days as unavailable)<br>    * <code>external_calendar</code> (iCal sync caused days to be unavailable)<br>    * <code>busy_by_default</code> ( Host hasn't enabled this listing ).<br>* If <code>availability_type</code>  is <code>rule</code>, <code>availability_sub_type</code> will be the name of the availability rule restricting this date.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>min_nights</code><br><i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Minimum length of stay.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>max_nights</code><br><i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Maximum length of stay.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>closed_to_arrival</code><br><i>boolean</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>When <code>true</code>, the guest cannot check in on this day. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>closed_to_departure</code><br><i>boolean</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>When <code>true</code>, the guest cannot check out on this day. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>notes</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Optional notes.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>

sections.name: Calendar Batch Operations API
sections.content:
<p>You can use the <code>.../calendar_operations</code> API to update different daily availability and pricing for multiple dates or date ranges in one call. This is useful for avoiding issues with rate limiting.</p>
<blockquote>
<b>Note: </b>Up to<b> </b>160 batch calendar uploads per minute are allowed. Once reached, an error is returned for up to one minute.</blockquote>

sections.name: Updating Multiple Days
sections.content:
<pre class="highlight text"><code>POST /v2/calendar_operations?_allow_dates_overlap=true</code></pre>
<p>Use this endpoint to set availability and pricing for multiple dates or date ranges.</p>
<h5 id="request-url-parameters-5">Request URL Parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span> Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>_allow_dates_overlap</code><br><i>boolean</i><br><u>optional, default is <code>false</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>When <code>true</code>, dates can overlap across operations in the same request. Operations are executed in order as they are in the array. If dates overlap, the latter operation will override the previous operation for the same date. When <code>false</code>, dates cannot overlap and the API will raise an error if overlapped dates are detected. Default is <code>false</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="request-body-parameters-12">Request Body Parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code><br><i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>operations</code><br><i>array of objects</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Operation objects array for updating calendar. A max of 731 days can be included in one call.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="operation-object">Operation Object</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>dates</code><br><i>array of strings</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Array of strings representing dates in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601">ISO-8601</a> format specifying the dates or date ranges to update. Use <code>YYYY-MM-DD</code> format for a single date of <code>YYYY-MM-DD:YYYY-MM-DD</code> for a date range .</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>daily_price</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Nightly price for this day. Minimum = 10 USD, maximum = 25000 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>availability</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Either <code>"available"</code> , <code>"unavailable"</code>  or <code>"default"</code>. Please use <code>"default"</code> instead of <code>"available"</code>  if you want the day to comply with any availability rules you set, since<code> "available"</code> overwrites all availability rules (e.g. max days notice).</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>available_count</code><br><i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><b>Room Type inventory only.<i> </i></b>How many rooms are availabile for specific dates or ranges of dates.<br>Please refer to the requirements table below for the valid values of <code>availability</code> and <code>available_count</code>. For more information about room types, see the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#room-type-inventory">Room Type Inventory</a> section of the Appendix.<br>This value is not automatically incremented or decremented when a reservation is made. The maximum count is 500.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>min_nights</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Minimum length of stay if the trip starts on this day. Use <code>null</code> to unset this value.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>max_nights</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Maximum length of stay if the trip starts on this day. Use <code>null</code> to unset this value.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>closed_to_arrival</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <u>optional, default is false</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>When <code>true</code>, the guest cannot check in on this day. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>closed_to_departure</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <u>optional, default is </u><u><code>false</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>When <code>true</code>, the guest cannot check out on this day.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>notes</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Optional notes.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p>Requirements for valid  <code>availability</code> and  <code>available_count</code> values:</p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Possible values for availablility</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Allowed values for available_count</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Notes</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"available"</code> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>&gt;0, &lt;=500</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>- On listing's calendar, this date will be marked as "<i>available</i>"; all availability rules will be overwritten.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"unavailable"</code> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>&gt;=0</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>- On listing's calendar, this date will be marked as "<i>unavailable</i>"; all availability rules will be overwritten.<br>- A positive <i>available_count</i> can be used for stop sale.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"default"</code> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>&gt;=0</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>- If <i>available_count</i> = 0, this date will be blocked on calendar as "<i>unavailable</i>".<br>- If <i>available_count</i> &gt; 0, the availability of this date will conform to the availability rules.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-26">Response</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>days</code><br><i>array of objects</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>An array of <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#calendar-day-object">Calendar day object</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code><br><i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the listing</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-request-29">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X POST <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key: gu7tsjffe4vzptgcax0ncplnq'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-OAuth-Token: ezmlazpa7v25xb3f24mw6n4hx'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -d <span class="s1">'{"listing_id": 21562250, 
    "operations": [ { "dates": [ "2018-06-15:2018-06-21" ], "availability": "unavailable" }]}'</span>
    https://api.airbnb.com/v2/calendar_operations</code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-22">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"calendar_operation"</span><span class="p">:{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"days"</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"availability"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"available"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"availability_sub_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"availability_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"available"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"closed_to_arrival"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"closed_to_departure"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"daily_price"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">120</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"2015-06-15"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"min_nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"max_nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">28</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"notes"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"availability"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"available"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"availability_sub_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"availability_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"available"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"closed_to_arrival"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"closed_to_departure"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"daily_price"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">120</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"2015-06-16"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"min_nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"max_nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">28</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"notes"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="err">...</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">5240677</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="err">}</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"metadata"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="another-example-request-2">Another Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X POST <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key:cgdrdjfv4hvzptgcax0ncplnf'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-OAuth-Token:12taga7tyfzgm3bf73fwaq0e2'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -d <span class="s1">'{
    "listing_id": 5240677,
    "operations": [
      {
        "dates": [
          "2016-06-01:2016-06-07",
          "2016-06-15:2016-06-22"
        ],
        "daily_price": 120
      },
      {
        "dates": [
          "2015-06-08:2015-06-14",
          "2015-06-23:2015-06-29"
        ],
        "daily_price": 180
      },
      {
        "dates": [
          "2015-06-06",
          "2015-06-13",
          "2015-06-20"
        ],
        "daily_price": 220
      }
    ]
  }'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  https://api.airbnb.com/v2/calendar_operations?_allow_dates_overlap<span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">true</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Seasonal Rule Group API
sections.content:
<p>You can use<b> Seasonal Rule Group</b> objects to create pricing and availability rule sets and then apply them to listings for a specified date/time period. If you prefer to send us your pricing and availability rules for specific periods of time as a flat set of records, use the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#los-records-api">LOS Records API</a>. The LOS Records API offers more flexibility than Seasonal Rule Groups.</p>
<p>A Seasonal Rule Group is comprised of Pricing Rule objects and one Availability Rule object. <annotation>You can create up to 366 Seasonal Rule Groups and up to 3000 individual Rules in total</annotation>.</p>
<p>Implementing Seasonal Rule Groups is a two-step process:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Create Seasonal Rule Groups as standalone objects</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Apply Rule Groups to listings for specific date ranges.<b> </b>See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-rule-group-timeline-api">Listing Rule Group API</a>.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Pricing Rules Overview
sections.content:
<p>With Pricing Rules, you can set the following types of pricing adjustment or discount rules to be applied to your highest precedence daily rate (i.e rules are applied <b>on top of custom pricing</b>). Note that an “adjustment” can be either positive or negative.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><b>Seasonal adjustment</b> - A percentage or fixed dollar amount applied to the base nightly price (daily or custom price). For example, if they book during Christmas week when demand is high, they have to pay 40 USD more per night. This new nightly price is referred to as the <i><b>adjusted seasonal price.</b></i></span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Length-of-stay adjustment </b>- A percentage or fixed dollar amount applied to the adjusted seasonal price if they stay a specified length of time. <b>Overwrites weekly/monthly discounts</b>. For example, if they stay <annotation>more than 7 nights</annotation>, they pay 10% more. If the adjusted seasonal price is $100, then the new nightly price is $110.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Last-minute discount </b>- Modify the adjusted seasonal price  by a percentage or fixed dollar amount if guests book within a specified date/time of their stay. For example, if they book a week or less before their stay, they get a 10% nightly discount. If the adjusted seasonal price is $100, then the new nightly price is $90.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Booking-ahead discount </b>- Deduct a percentage or fixed dollar amount from the adjusted seasonal price if they book before a specified date/time before their stay. For example, if they book 60 days  before their stay, they get a $20 nightly discount. If the adjusted seasonal price is $100, then the new nightly price is $80. </span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>You can set price adjustments in one of two ways:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><b>Absolute</b> - A fixed dollar amount, e.g., $20</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Percent</b> - A percentage, e.g., 10%</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<blockquote>For examples and more details on how pricing rules are applied see the appendix section about <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#applying-pricing-rules">Applying Pricing Rules</a>.</blockquote>

sections.name: Availability Rules Overview
sections.content:
<p>We support the following types of availability rules: </p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Days of the week (Mon-Sun) when guests cannot check-in</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Days of the week (Mon-Sun) when guests cannot check-out</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>For each day of the week (Mon-Sun), the maximum nights guests can stay if they check-in on that day</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>For each day of the week (Mon-Sun), the minimum nights guest have to stay if they check-in on that day</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<blockquote>
<a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#updating-multiple-days">Custom daily changeover values</a> marking the dates as unavailable for checkin/checkout overwrite seasonal default/availability rules for checkin and checkout, if the latter mark days as available. <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#updating-multiple-days">Custom daily changeover values</a>  marking the dates as available for checkin/checkout don't overwrite seasonal/default availability rules if the latter mark days as unavailable.</blockquote>
<blockquote>For more details on how availability rules are applied see the appendix section about <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#applying-availability-rules">Applying Availability Rules</a>.</blockquote>

sections.name: Creating a Rule Group
sections.content:
<pre class="highlight text"><code>POST /v2/seasonal_rule_sets</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-body-parameters-13">Request Body Parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>color</code><br><i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Color to show on the UI Airbnb calendar for the rule group. Value from <code>0</code> to <code>8</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>title</code><br><i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Title to show on the UI Airbnb calendar for the rule group.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>pricing_rules</code><br><i>array of objects</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Array of <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#pricing-rule-object">Pricing Rule</a> objects</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>availability_rules</code><br><i>object</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#availability-rule-object">Availability Rule</a> object.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>Pricing Rule</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>rule_type</code><br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>One of:<br><code>SEASONAL_ADJUSTMENT</code> - Season adjustment<br><code>STAYED_AT_LEAST_X_DAYS</code> - Long-term stay adjustment<br><code>BOOKED_WITHIN_AT_MOST_X_DAYS</code> - Last-minute discount<br><code>BOOKED_BEYOND_AT_LEAST_X_DAYS</code> - Booking ahead discount<br></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>price_change<br></code><i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If <code>rule_type</code> is  <code>SEASONAL_ADJUSTMENT,</code>  this field can be either positive or negative.<br>Otherwise, <code>price_change</code> must be a negative value, meaning price decrease.<br><br><br></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>price_change_type</code><br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Either <code>PERCENT</code> or <code>ABSOLUTE</code> (fixed dollar amount).</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>threshold_one</code><br><i>non-negative integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Specifies the X value in the <code>X_DAYS</code> rules. Must be multiple of <code>28</code> or <code>30</code> for <code>"BOOKED_BEYOND_AT_LEAST_X_DAYS"</code>, and smaller than <code>28</code> for <code>"BOOKED_WITHIN_AT_MOST_X_DAYS"</code>. Not used for seasonal adjustments. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>Availability Rule</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>closed_for_checkout</code><br><i>array of strings</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Days in week that guest cannot check out. Comma-separated array of enum strings. One of <code>"MONDAY"</code>, <code>"TUESDAY"</code>, <code>"WEDNESDAY"</code>, <code>"THURSDAY"</code>, <code>"FRIDAY"</code>, <code>"SATURDAY"</code> or "<code>SUNDAY"</code>. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>closed_for_checkin</code><br><i>array of strings</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Days in week that guest cannot check in. Comma-separated array of enum strings. One of <code>"MONDAY"</code>, <code>"TUESDAY"</code>, <code>"WEDNESDAY"</code>, <code>"THURSDAY"</code>, <code>"FRIDAY"</code>, <code>"SATURDAY"</code> or "<code>SUNDAY"</code>. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>max_nights</code><br><i>map of string to integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Map from day of week to corresponding max nights value, which is the maximum length of stay if the trip starts on this day. Day should be one of <code>"MONDAY"</code>, <code>"TUESDAY"</code>, <code>"WEDNESDAY"</code>, <code>"THURSDAY"</code>, <code>"FRIDAY"</code>, <code>"SATURDAY"</code>, <code>"SUNDAY"</code> or <code>"UNSPECIFIED"</code>. If any days are missing, the <code>"UNSPECIFIED"</code> value is used. If there is no <code>"UNSPECIFIED"</code> value,  then 1095 days is used. E.g., <code>"max_nights": { "UNSPECIFIED": 14, "TUESDAY" : 21, "SATURDAY" : "7" }.</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>min_nights</code><br><i>map of string to integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Map from day of week to corresponding min nights value, which is the maximum length of stay if the trip starts on this day. Day should be one of <code>"MONDAY"</code>, <code>"TUESDAY"</code>, <code>"WEDNESDAY"</code>, <code>"THURSDAY"</code>, <code>"FRIDAY"</code>, <code>"SATURDAY"</code>, <code>"SUNDAY"</code> or <code>"UNSPECIFIED"</code>. If any days are missing, the <code>"UNSPECIFIED"</code> value is used. If there is no <code>"UNSPECIFIED"</code> value,  then 1 is used.  E.g., <code>"min_nights": { "UNSPECIFIED": 2, "TUESDAY" : 4, "SATURDAY" : "3" }</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-27">Response</h5>
<p><a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#rule-group-object">Rule Group</a> object</p>
<h5 id="example-request-30">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code> curl -X <span class="s2">"POST"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/seasonal_rule_sets"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
 -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
 -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: a880nfkw12clzxzkd0au0nb70"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
 -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: 5jah5juioe4rnbbd7xef5xqom"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
 -d <span class="s1">'{
  "color": 2,
  "title": "Winter",
  "pricing_rules": [
    {
      "price_change": -20,
      "price_change_type": "PERCENT",
      "rule_type": "STAYED_AT_LEAST_X_DAYS",
      "threshold_one": 7
    },
    {
      "price_change": -120,
      "price_change_type": "ABSOLUTE",
      "rule_type": "BOOKED_WITHIN_AT_MOST_X_DAYS",
      "threshold_one": 7
    },
    {
      "price_change": 120,
      "price_change_type": "ABSOLUTE",
      "rule_type": "SEASONAL_ADJUSTMENT"
    },
    {
      "price_change": 0,
      "price_change_type": "PERCENT",
      "rule_type": "BOOKED_BEYOND_AT_LEAST_X_DAYS",
      "threshold_one": 30
    }
  ],
  "availability_rules": {
    "closed_for_checkin": [
      "FRIDAY"
    ],
    "closed_for_checkout": [
      "SUNDAY",
      "SATURDAY"
    ],
    "max_nights": {
      "UNSPECIFIED": 1,
      "MONDAY": 1,
      "TUESDAY": 4,
      "FRIDAY": 2
    },
    "min_nights": {
      "UNSPECIFIED": 3,
      "MONDAY": 5,
      "WEDNESDAY": 6,
      "FRIDAY": 4
    }
  }
}'</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Replacing a Rule Group
sections.content:
<p>This operation entirely overrides the existing Rule Group.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>PUT /v2/seasonal_rule_sets/:rule_group_id</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-id-18">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>rule_group_id</code><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The ID of the Rule Group</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="request-body-parameters-14">Request Body Parameters</h5>
<p>Same as <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#creating-a-rule-group">Creating a Rule Group</a>.</p>
<h5 id="response-28">Response</h5>
<p><a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#rule-group-object">Rule Group </a>object</p>

sections.name: Retrieving a Rule Group
sections.content:
<p>This endpoint takes a Rule Group ID as a URL ID parameter</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>GET /v2/seasonal_rule_sets/:rule_group_id</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-id-19">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>rule_group_id</code><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the Rule Group</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-29">Response</h5>
<p><a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#rule-group-object">Rule Group</a> object</p>
<h5 id="example-request-31">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"GET"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/seasonal_rule_sets/1439311"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
-H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
-H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: a880nfkw12clzxzkd0au0nb70"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
-H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: 5jah5juioe4rnbbd7xef5xqom"</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-24">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"seasonal_rule_set"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1440227</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"created_by_user_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">151542124</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
