sections.name: France Required Fields
sections.content:
<p>A Categorization object is required in France.</p>
<h5 id="categorization-object">Categorization Object</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>residency_category</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Residency category that the listing belongs to. There are three types: <code>"primary_residence"</code>, <code>"secondary_residence"</code>, and <code>"non_residential"</code>. <code>"primary_residence"</code> is a place where you call home for at least 8 months per year. <code>"secondary_residence"</code> is a vacation home. <code>"non_residential"</code> is a room in a hotel or B&amp;B.</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-request-46">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"POST"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/listing_permits"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 8uaxi4r1busbeg21fuacga40c"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: av8mf8kd4k40fq26xxd9w4p44"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -d <span class="s1">'{
    "regulatory_body": "france",
    "listing_id": 1234567,
    "categorization": {
      "residency_category": "primary_residence",
    }
  }'</span>

</code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-39">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"listing_permit"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1234567</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"regulatory_body"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"france"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"status"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"pending"</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"metadata"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Webhook Notifications
sections.content: <p>This section details the Listing Management webhook notifications your application could receive. Please refer to the <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default">Getting Started </a>guide for information on how to get set up for handling them.</p>

sections.name: Listing Approval Status Changed Notification
sections.content:
<pre class="highlight text"><code>listing_approval_status_changed</code></pre>
<p>This notification is sent when a listing is approved or rejected.</p>
<h5 id="notification-payload">Notification Payload</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>action</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>"<code>listing_approval_status_changed</code>"</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_approval_status</code><br><i>object</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing Approval Status object</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="listing-approval-status-object"><b>Listing Approval Status Object</b></h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code><br><i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>host_id</code><br><i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Host ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>approval_status_category</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing status, one of <code>"ready for review"</code>, <code>"approved"</code>, <code>"rejected"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>notes</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Associated decision notes</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-notification">Example Notification</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"listing_approval_status"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"approval_status_category"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"rejected"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"host_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">2468</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1234</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"notes"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"The listing does not have enough amenities. The minimum is 5 amenities."</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"action"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"listing_approval_status_changed"</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Listing Synchronization Settings Updated
sections.content:
<pre class="highlight text"><code>listing_synchronization_settings_updated</code></pre>
<p>This notification is sent when a user has updated the synchronization settings for a set of listing, such as:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>updated a synchronization category</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>merged with (i.e. mapped to) an existing listing</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<h5 id="notification-payload-2">Notification Payload</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>action</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"listing_synchronization_settings_updated"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>host_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the host</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>updates</code> <br> <i>array of objects</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The array of Setting Updates that happened</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>Settings Update object:</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the listing</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>synchronization_category</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The synchronization category the user has chosen for this listing. One of <code>"sync_all"</code>, <code>"sync_rates_and_availability"</code>. See Sync Categories for more details.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>after_mapping_listing_id</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The new listing id that you should start using for updates</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="sample-notification">Sample notification</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"action"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"listing_synchronization_settings_updated"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
     </span><span class="nt">"host_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">12345</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
     </span><span class="nt">"updates"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
       </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">123</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="nt">"synchronization_category"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"sync_all"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="nt">"after_mapping_listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">999</span><span class="w">
       </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
       </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">124</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
         </span><span class="nt">"synchronization_category"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"sync_rates_and_availability"</span><span class="w">
       </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
     </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: [deprecated] Listings Mapped
sections.content:
<p><b>We have deprecated this notification in favor of combined payload inside<a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-synchronization-settings-updated"> Listing Synchronization Settings Updated</a> notification.</b></p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>listings_mapped</code></pre>
<p>This notification is sent when a user has merged (i.e. mapped) a set of listings pushed by your application to a set of existing listings on Airbnb.</p>
<h5 id="notification-payload-3">Notification Payload</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>action</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"listings_mapped"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>host_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the host</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>mappings</code> <br> <i>array(mapping)</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The array of Listing Mappings that user performed</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>Listing mapping object:</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The old id of the listing you have on file</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>updated_listing_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The new listing id that you should start using for updates</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="sample-notification-2">Sample notification</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"action"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"listings_mapped"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"host_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">12345</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"mappings"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">123</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"updated_listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">999</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">124</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"updated_listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">888</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Listings Unlinked
sections.content:
<p>This notification is sent when a host has disconnected (or unlinked) their listing(s) from your application in order to manage them directly on Airbnb.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>listings_unlinked</code></pre>
<h5 id="notification-payload-4">Notification Payload</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>action</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"listings_unlinked"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>host_id</code><br><i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Host ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_ids</code><br><i>array of integers</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Array of unlinked listings and their IDs.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-notification-2">Example Notification</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"action"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"listings_unlinked"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"host_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">12345</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_ids"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">123</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">124</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">125</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Authorization Revoked
sections.content:
<p>This notification is sent when a host has decided to unlink their account from the your application and manage their listings directly on Airbnb instead.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>authorization_revoked</code></pre>
<h5 id="notification-payload-5">Notification Payload</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>action</code><br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"authorization_revoked"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>host_id</code><br><i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Host ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_ids</code><br><i>array of integers</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The array of ids of listings that were unlinked.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-notification-3">Example Notification</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
   </span><span class="nt">"action"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"authorization_revoked"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"host_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">12345</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_ids"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">123</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">124</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">125</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>
<p>The payload is identical to the listings unlinked notification, however, note that if the Host had no listings the Listing ID array will be empty.</p>

sections.name: Accepted Enum Values
Property Type Groups
sections.content:
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Value</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Allowed Property Types</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "apartments"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Apartments or condominiums are typically located in a multi-unit residential building or complex where other people live.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"apartment"</code>, <code>"condominium"</code>,  <code>"loft"</code>, <code>"serviced_apartment"</code><code><br>"casa_particular"</code>(Cuba only)</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "bnb"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Bed and breakfasts are professional hospitality businesses that offer breakfast for guests. A host usually lives on the property.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"bnb"</code>,  <code>"farm_stay"</code>,  <code>"lodge"</code><br><code>"casa_particular"</code> (Cuba only), <code>"minsu"</code> (Taiwan only), <code>"ryokan"</code> (Japan only)</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "boutique_hotels<br>_and_more"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Boutique hotels are professional hospitality businesses that usually have a unique style or theme defining their brand and decor.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"boutique_hotel"</code>, <code>"aparthotel"</code>, <code>"hostel"</code>, <code>"hotel"</code>, <code>"lodge"</code>, <code>"resort"</code>, <code>"serviced_apartment"</code><br><code>"heritage_hotel"</code> (India only)</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "houses"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Houses are residential buildings that are often stand-alone structures. Some houses, like duplexes, may share walls or outdoor areas with other houses.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span> <code>"bungalow"</code>, <code>"cabin"</code>,  <code>"chalet"</code>, <code>"cottage"</code>,  <code>"dome_house"</code>, <code>"earthhouse"</code>, <code>"farm_stay"</code>, <code>"house"</code>, <code>"houseboat"</code>, <code>"hut"</code>, <code>"lighthouse"</code>,  <code>"tiny_house"</code>, <code>"townhouse"</code>, <code>"villa"</code><code><br>"casa_particular"</code>(Cuba only), <code>"cycladic_house"</code> (Greece only), <code>"dammuso"</code> (Italy only), <code>"shepherds_hut"</code> (UK, France only), <code>"trullo" </code>(Italy only), <code>"pension"</code> (South Korea only)</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "secondary_units"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Secondary units have a private entrance for guests and usually share property with another structure.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"guesthouse"</code>, <code>"guest_suite"</code>, <code>"farm_stay"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "unique_homes"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Unique stays include treehouses, tipis, and other property types with unexpected or surprising features and structural elements.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"barn"</code>, <code>"boat"</code>, <code>"rv"</code>, <code>"campsite"</code>, <code>"castle"</code>, <code>"cave"</code>, <code>"dome_house"</code>, <code>"earthhouse"</code>, <code>"farm_stay"</code>, <code>"houseboat"</code>, <code>"hut"</code>, <code>"igloo"</code>, <code>"island"</code>, <code>"lighthouse"</code>,  <code>"plane"</code>,  <code>"tent"</code>, <code>"tiny_house"</code>, <code>"tipi"</code>, <code>"train"</code>, <code>"treehouse"</code>, <code>"windmill"</code>, <code>"yurt"</code><br><code>"pension" </code>(South Korean only), <code>"shepherds_hut"</code> (UK, France only)</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>

sections.name: Property Types
sections.content:
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Value</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Allowed Room Types</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "aparthotel"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Aparthotels are hotel-like accommodations with rooms that feel more like apartments. They usually have a front desk, hotel-like amenities, and staff available to assist guests.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "apartment"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Apartments are typically located in multi-unit residential buildings or complexes where other people live.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "barn"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Barns that have been converted into living spaces may have been originally used for storing grains, livestock, or farming equipment.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "bnb"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Bed and breakfasts are professional hospitality businesses that offer breakfast for guests. A host usually lives on the property.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "boat"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Boats and ships range from sailboats to luxury yachts that are moored while guests are visiting. If you have a houseboat or floating home, choose “houseboat.”</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "boutique_hotel"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Boutique hotels are professional hospitality businesses that usually have a unique style or theme defining their brand and decor.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "bungalow"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Bungalows are houses with architectural features like a wide front porch and a sloping roof. They’re usually single-level homes.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "cabin"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Cabins are houses built with natural materials like logs and wood. They’re often located in natural settings like forests and mountains.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "campsite"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A campsite is an area of land where guests can set up their own tent, yurt, camper/RV, or tiny house. Let guests know what they can set up on your campsite.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "casa_particular"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A casa particular is a type of accommodation found in Cuba that may be more like a private apartment or a room in a bed and breakfast.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "castle"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Castles are majestic and often historical buildings with architectural features like towers, spires, and moats.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "cave"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Caves are natural formations like underground caverns and dwellings carved into hillsides or nuzzled into a cliff.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "chalet"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Chalets are houses that are usually made of wood and have a sloping roof. Many are holiday homes in locations popular for skiing or summer homes.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "condominium"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Condominiums or condos are units typically located in multi-unit residential buildings or complexes where other people live. Condos are owned by individuals whereas apartments are usually owned by a property management group.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "cottage"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Cottages are cozy homes. They’re often located in rural areas or near a lake or beach.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "cycladic_house"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Cycladic houses are traditional whitewashed houses with cubic shapes and flat roofs. Their unique style is found in the Cyclades—a group of Greek islands.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "dammuso"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Dammusos are stone houses with wide walls and domed roofs—an architectural style unique to the island of Pantelleria in Italy.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "dome_house"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Dome houses have a hemispherical roof or may have a completely spherical construction. Geodesic domes and bubble homes are types of dome houses.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "earthhouse"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Earth houses are homes that are built into the earth or made out of natural materials like terrain or rammed earth.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "farm_stay"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Farm stays are professionally managed accommodations in agricultural settings where guests may interact with animals or enjoy recreational activities like hiking or arts and crafts.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "guest_suite"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Guest suites have a private entrance and are inside of or attached to a larger structure like a house or garage. These are sometimes called in-laws.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "guesthouse"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A guesthouse is a detached building that shares a property with another stand-alone structure like a house. Sometimes these are called carriage houses or coach houses.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "heritage_hotel"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Heritage hotels are palaces, havelis, forts, and other historically significant buildings in India that have been converted into professionally managed accommodations for guests.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "hostel"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Hostels are professional hospitality businesses that usually rent beds in shared dorms and private rooms for guests.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "hotel"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Hotels are professional hospitality businesses that offer accommodations like private rooms and rental units for guests.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "house"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Houses are residential buildings that are often stand-alone structures. Some houses, like duplexes, may share walls or outdoor areas with other houses.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "houseboat"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Houseboats are boats that are more like homes and are often set up as a primary residence. Choose “houseboat” if you have a floating home.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "hut"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Huts are made from simple materials like wood or mud and often have thatched roofs made of straw.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "igloo"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Igloos are dome-shaped structures made of snow and ice. They’re typically found in cold climates where they’re less likely to melt.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "island"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>An island is a piece of land completely surrounded by water. Islands are great for private getaways in paradise.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "lighthouse"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A lighthouse is a tower with a bright light originally built to help ships navigate waterways. They’re usually found on the coast near large bodies of water.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "lodge"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Nature lodges are professional hospitality businesses located in natural settings like forests and mountains.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "loft"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A loft is a space—usually an apartment or condo—with an open layout. Most or all walls in a loft do not extend fully to the ceiling.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "minsu"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Minsus are professionally managed accommodations in Taiwan that offer private rooms for guests.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "pension"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Pensions are Korean holiday homes often found in the countryside. They often have barbeques and other communal spaces that make them a good choice for groups and families.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "plane"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Planes or airplanes are aircraft that were built to fly high in the sky and have now been converted into living spaces.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "resort"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Resorts are professional hospitality businesses with guest accommodations ranging from hotel rooms to private rentals. They may offer more amenities and services than other hotels.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "rv"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Some campers/RVs may be half-home, half-vehicle while others are camping trailers with compact spaces built for the adventurous at heart.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "ryokan"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Ryokans are traditional Japanese inns that usually have a small number of professionally managed rooms and offer a cultural experience for guests.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "serviced_apartment"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Serviced apartments are furnished and serviced by professional management companies. They offer hotel-like amenities such as daily cleaning, laundry service, concierge, and a front desk, making them popular choices for corporate housing and guests staying longer than 30 days.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "shepherds_hut"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Shepherd’s huts are tiny wagons on wheels originally used by shepherds on the move with their sheep.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "tent"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Tents are structures made of fabric and poles. They’re usually portable and collapsible, but some tents, like bedouin tents, are more permanent.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "tiny_house"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Tiny houses are stand-alone houses that are very small in size and have compact interior living spaces. They’re usually less than 400 square feet or 37 m2.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "tipi"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Tipis are cone-shaped tents supported by poles. They usually have a flap door and may have an opening at the top of the tent.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "townhouse"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Townhouses, row houses, and terraced houses are private units that share walls and may share outdoor spaces with other units.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "train"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Trains are cabooses, boxcars, and other railroad cars that have been converted into living spaces.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "treehouse"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Treehouses are built into the trunks or branches of trees. Nature-loving guests may climb a ladder or stairs to enjoy beautiful views.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "trullo"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A trullo is a round, stone house with a cone-shaped roof that originated in the Apulia region of Italy.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "villa"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Villas are luxurious homes that tend to have outdoor-indoor spaces and large yards, gardens, or pools.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "windmill"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Windmills are unique structures originally designed with blades to catch the wind and use its energy. Some windmills may be fully functioning while others are primarily used as living spaces.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "yurt"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Yurts are rounded tents usually made from a collapsible wooden framework. They’re a sturdier option for guests who love the outdoors and creature comforts, too.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"entire_home"</code>, <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="deprecated-property-types">Deprecated Property Types</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Deprecated type</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "car"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Deprecated. Please update to new type.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "condohotel"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Deprecated. Please update to new type.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "dorm"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Deprecated. Will be replaced with <code>"hostel"</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "in_law"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Deprecated. Will be replaced with <code>"guest_suite"</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "other"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Deprecated. Please update to new type.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "parkingspace"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Deprecated. Please update to new type.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "pousada"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Deprecated. Please update to new type.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "timeshare"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Deprecated. Will be replaced with <code>"resort"</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "vacation_home"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Deprecated. Will be replaced with <code>"house"</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "van"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Deprecated. Please update to new type.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>

sections.name: Amenity Strings

</td>

</td>

<tr>
<td>

<tr>

<span><code> "ac" </code></span><br>
</td>

<span>Air conditioning.</span><br>
</td>

<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "heating" </code></span><br>

<tr>

<span><code> "hair-dryer" </code></span><br>
</td>

<span>Iron.</span><br>

<tr>

<td>

</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "dryer" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Dryer. In the building, free or for a fee</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "hot_water" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Hot water.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "tv" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>TV.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "cable" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Cable TV.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "fireplace" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Indoor fireplace.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "private-entrance" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Private entrance. Separate street or building entrance</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "private-living-room" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Private living room.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "lock_on_bedroom_door" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Lock on bedroom door. Private room can be locked for safety and privacy</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "shampoo" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Shampoo.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "bed_linens" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Bed linens.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "extra_pillows_and_blankets" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Extra pillows and blankets.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "wireless_internet" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Wireless Internet. Continuous access in the listing</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "ethernet_connection" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Ethernet connection.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "pocket_wifi" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Pocket wifi.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "laptop-friendly" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Laptop friendly workspace. A table or desk with space for a laptop and a chair that’s comfortable to work in</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="kitchen">Kitchen</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Amenity string</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "microwave" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Microwave.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "coffee_maker" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Coffee maker.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "refrigerator" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Refrigerator.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "dishwasher" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Dishwasher.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "dishes_and_silverware" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Dishes and silverware.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "cooking_basics" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Cooking basics. Pots and pans, oil, salt and pepper</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "oven" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Oven.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "stove" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Stove.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="facility">Facility</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Amenity string</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "free_parking"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Free parking on premises.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "street_parking"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Free street parking.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "paid_parking"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Paid parking off premises.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "paid_parking_on_premises"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Paid parking on premises.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "ev_charger" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>EV charger.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "gym" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Gym. Free, in the building or nearby</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "pool" </code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Pool. Private or Shared</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code> "jacuzzi" </code></span><br>

sections.name: Instant Booking Allowed Category
sections.content:
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Value</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>

<span><code>"everyone"</code></span><br>

</td>

<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"experienced_guest_with_government_id"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>

</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>

sections.name: Cancellation Policies
sections.content:
<p><annotation>The API only supports some of Airbnb's policies.  Must be one of the following: </annotation></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Value</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"flexible"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Full refund 1 day prior to arrival, except fees</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"moderate"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Full refund 5 days prior to arrival, except fees</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"strict_14_with_grace_period"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Full refund within 48 hours of booking if before 14 days of checkin. After, 50% refund up until 1 week prior to arrival</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"strict"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><b>Deprecated.</b> Please use <code>strict_14_with_grace_period</code>. 50% refund up until 1 week prior to arrival</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"super_strict_30"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>50% refund up until 30 days prior to arrival, except fees</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"super_strict_60"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>50% refund up until 60 days prior to arrival, except fees.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p>Policies with a <code>"_new"</code> suffix are only used in Italy. They include fees in refund. For example, <code>"super_strict_60"</code> in Italy is recognized as <code>"super_strict_60_new"</code>, 50% refund up until 60 days prior to arrival, including fees. Likewise for the other ones.</p>

sections.name: Listing Expectation Types
sections.content:
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Type</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"requires_stairs"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Must climb stairs. Describe the stairs (for example, how many flights).</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"potential_noise"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Potential for noise. Describe the noise and when it’s likely to take place.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"has_pets"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Pet(s) live on property. Describe the pets.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"limited_parking"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>No parking on property. Describe the parking situation around the listing.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"shared_spaces"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Some spaces are shared. Describe the spaces the guests will share.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"limited_amenities"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Amenity limitations. Describe an amenity or service that’s limited, such as weak wifi or limited hot water.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"surveillance"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Surveillance or recording devices on property. Describe any device that records or sends video, audio, or still images. Specify each device’s location and whether it will be on or off <a href="https://www.airbnb.co.in/help/article/1529/what-are-airbnb-s-rules-about-weapons-in-a-listing?_ga=2.75888732.859794741.1517247990-69354025.1484083730">Learn more</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"weapons"</code> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Weapons on property. Describe any weapons (firearms, airguns, tasers, etc.), their location, and how they’re secured. <a href="https://www.airbnb.co.in/help/article/1529/what-are-airbnb-s-rules-about-weapons-in-a-listing?_ga=2.75888732.859794741.1517247990-69354025.1484083730">Learn more</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"animals"</code> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Dangerous animals on property. Describe any domesticated or wild animals that could be a health or safety risk to guests or other animals.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>

sections.name: Appendix
Room Type Inventory
sections.content:
<p>Some properties might have multiple rooms for a certain room type. For these listings, partners can provide Airbnb with a listing's <b>total inventory count</b>, <b>daily</b> <b>available count </b>for specific dates, as well as <b>property external id</b>. Note that the property type <code>house</code> <annotation>and deprecated fields are</annotation> not eligible for Room Type Inventory. You must add the <code>property_type_category</code> to use Room Type Inventory. </p>
<p>Room Type Inventory Attributes:</p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>description</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>required</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>total_inventory_count</code> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Total number of rooms for a room type provided in the Listings API. The maximum count is 500.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>No, but strongly recommended unless data is not available</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>property_external_id</code> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>ID of the hotel property. This allows Airbnb to group different room types of a same property together.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Yes</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>available_count</code> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Total number of rooms per day in the Calendar Operations API. The maximum count is 500.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Yes</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-request-set-total-inventory-count-and-property-external-id">example request - set total inventory count and property external id</h5>
<p>Create Listing:</p>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"POST"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/listings"</span>  <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key:cgdrdjfv4hvzptgcax0ncplnf'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-OAuth-Token:12taga7tyfzgm3bf73fwaq0e2'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -d <span class="s1">'{
  "amenity_categories": [
    "kitchen",
    "wireless_internet",
    "tv",
    "ac",
    "washer",
    "dryer"
  ],
  "bathrooms": 2,
  "bedrooms": 3,
  "beds": 3,
  "city": "St Helena",
  "state": "CA",
  "street": "1691 Sulphur Springs Ave",
  "zipcode": "94574",
  "country_code": "US",
  "directions": "Take a cab from the airport",
  "lat": 38.490468,
  "listing_price": 100,
  "listing_currency": "USD",
  "lng": -122.460452,
  "name": "Amazing House in Wine Country",
  "person_capacity": 8,
  "property_type_category": "bnb",
  "property_type_group": "bnb",
  "room_type_category": "entire_home",
  "user_defined_location": true,
  "total_inventory_count":3,
  "property_external_id": "Hotel1234",
  }'</span></code></pre>
<p>Update Listing:</p>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"PUT"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/listings/12345678"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: dzg84rxxxjkr4qo99so9rd8n0"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: 5jah5juioe4rnbbd7xef5xqnnThe "</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -d <span class="s1">'{
  "total_inventory_count":3,
  "property_external_id": "doubleroom001",
  }'</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-request-set-daily-available-count">example request - set daily available count</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X POST <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key:cgdrdjfv4hvzptgcax0ncplnf'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-OAuth-Token:12taga7tyfzgm3bf73fwaq0e2'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -d <span class="s1">'{
    "listing_id": 5240677,
    "operations": [
      {
        "dates": [
          "2016-01-01",
          "2016-01-03",
          "2016-01-05",
        ],
        "availability": "available",
        "available_count": 4
      },
      {
        "dates": [
          "2016-01-31",
          "2016-02-01:2016-02-03"
        ],
        "availability": "default",
        "available_count": 5
      },
      {
        "dates": [
          "2016-04-01", 
          "2016-05-01:2016-05-03"
        ],
        "availability": "unavailable",        
        "available_count": 0
      }
    ]
  }'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  https://api.airbnb.com/v2/calendar_operations?_allow_dates_overlap<span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">true</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Standard Fees
sections.content:
<p>Partners can provide <b>Standard fees</b> that will apply to reservations on top of the stay price. Fees can be specified as either percentage of the nightly price (after all adjustments) or a flat amount per reservation. </p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Fee Name</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Guest Display (where each fee is mapped)</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span>Resort fee</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Nightly price</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span>Community Fee</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Nightly price</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span>Management fee</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Nightly price</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span>Linen fee</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Cleaning fee</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p>In order to streamline the guest experience, the fees will not be shown as separate line items. Our system performs the calculation for the fee and  they are included in the nightly rate or cleaning fee when shown to guests. However,  Airbnb provide a detailed breakdown of these fees in reservation webhook notifications (see <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#reservation-object">Reservation Object</a>), so Airbnb transactions will be more consistent with a property manager's existing accounting structure. Airbnb currently supports 4 types of fees.</p>
<p>Fees are subject to the same taxes/fees and cancellation/refund policies as the price type they're mapped to. All applicable taxes and the Airbnb host and guest fees will be applied. Fees will inherit the cancellation/refund policy of the price type they're mapped to. For example, cleaning fees are refunded if a guest cancels before the reservation starts; this will apply to the linen fee as well. Similarly, if a strict cancellation policy refunds 50% of the stay price, we will refund 50% of any resort fees charged. </p>
<blockquote>If you have previously been manually customizing the base price to include any of the above fee types, remember to reduce the base price by the relevant amount after developing to standard fees. This ensures that you are not “double-charging” the fee.</blockquote>

sections.name: Applying Pricing Rules
sections.content:
<h5 id="setting-an-adjusted-seasonal-price">Setting an Adjusted Seasonal Price</h5>
<p>You can apply a percentage or fixed dollar amount change to the nightly price of highest precedence (base or custom) to get the nightly <i><b>adjusted seasonal price</b>. </i>This can add to, or subtract from, the base nightly price.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: This rule adjusts the base nightly price 20% higher. If the default nightly price is $100 USD, then the <b>adjusted seasonal price</b><i> </i>is $120 USD.</p>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"SEASONAL_ADJUSTMENT"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"priceChange"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"amount"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">20</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"PERCENT"</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="setting-a-length-of-stay-adjustment">Setting a Length-of-Stay Adjustment</h5>
<p>If a stay is  X days or more, you can increase or decrease the adjusted seasonal price a percentage or fixed dollar amount. This is similar to existing long-term adjustments applied to trips that are at least 7 days and 28 days respectively. This rule is applied to the longest day matched. This discount is shown to guests.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: This rule says this if the guest stays at least 3 nights, then they get a 20% nightly discount. If the adjusted seasonal price is $100 USD, then the new discounted price is $80 USD.</p>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"STAYED_AT_LEAST_X_DAYS"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"threshold"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"priceChange"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"amount"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">-20</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"PERCENT"</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="setting-a-last-minute-discount">Setting a Last-Minute Discount</h5>
<p>You can offer percentage or fixed dollar amount discounts to trips that are booked X days or less before a stay. This discount is not shown to guests.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: If the guest books 3 days or less before their stay, this rule entitles them to a $20 nightly discount. If the adjusted seasonal price is $100 USD, then the new discounted price is $80 USD.</p>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"BOOKED_WITHIN_AT_MOST_X_DAYS"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"threshold"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"priceChange"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"amount"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">-20</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"ABSOLUTE"</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="setting-a-booking-ahead-discount">Setting a Booking-Ahead Discount</h5>
<p>You can offer percentage or fixed dollar amount discounts to trips that are booked X days or more in advance. This discount is not shown to guests.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: If the guest books 60 nights or more in advance, this rule entitles them to  $20 per night discount. If the adjusted seasonal price is $120 USD, then the new discounted price is $100 USD.</p>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"BOOKED_BEYOND_AT_LEAST_X_DAYS"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"threshold"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">60</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"priceChange"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"amount"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">-20</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"ABSOLUTE"</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="calculating-the-final-price">Calculating the Final Price</h5>
<p><b>Adjusted seasonal price = </b>Seasonal price adjustment applied to base nightly price.</p>
<p><b>Final price</b> = Additional price adjustments applied to the adjusted seasonal price.</p>
<p>Suppose for a certain date range, the following pricing rules are created:</p>
<p><b>Base nightly price</b> = <b>$200</b></p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Seasonal adjusted discount = -10%,  nightly discount = -(200 * .10) = -20</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p><b>Adjusted s<b>easonal p</b>rice</b> = 200 - 20 = <b>$180</b></p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Long-term adjustment = -20, nightly discount = -20</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Last-minute discount = -2%,   nightly discount = -(180 * .02 ) = -3.6</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Booking-ahead discount = -2%,  nightly discount = -(180 * .02) = -3.6</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p><b>Final price  = </b>180 - 20 - 3.6 - 3.6<b> = $152.8</b></p>
<h5 id="staying-across-seasons">Staying Across Seasons</h5>
<p>Pricing rules are resolved on a per day basis. For a listing with base price $100, suppose there is 5% discount from 5/1 - 5/5, and $10 discount from 5/8 - 5/10. If the stay is from 5/1 - 5/10, it will get 5% off from 5/1 - 5/5, no discounts from 5/6 - 5/7, and $10 off for each day from 5/8 - 5/10. Thus, the total cost of the stay is <code>100 * (1-0.05) * 5 + 100 * 2 + (100 - 10) * 3 = 945</code>.</p>

sections.name: Applying Availability Rules
sections.content:
<h5 id="setting-when-guests-cannot-check-in">Setting When Guests Cannot Check-in</h5>
<p>You can set which days of the week guests cannot check-in.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: The following payload indicates that guests cannot check-in on Monday and Friday:</p>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"closed_for_checkin"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"MONDAY"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"FRIDAY"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="setting-when-guests-cannot-check-out">Setting When Guests Cannot Check-out</h5>
<p>You can set which days of the week guests  cannot check-out.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: The following payload indicates that guests cannot check-out on Sunday:</p>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"closed_for_checkout"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"SUNDAY"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="setting-the-minimum-nights-guests-have-to-stay">Setting the Minimum Nights Guests Have to Stay </h5>
<p>You can set the minimum number of nights guests have to stay depending on which day of the week they check-in.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: The following payload sets two rules: </p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>If the guest checks-in on Sunday, Tuesday, Friday or Saturday, they have to stay for 5 nights minimum. </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>For all other days, the guest has to stay for 3 nights minimum. <code>UNSPECIFIED</code> indicates that this applies to all days that haven't had a value specifically set.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"min_nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"SUNDAY"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"TUESDAY"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"FRIDAY"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"SATURDAY"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"UNSPECIFIED"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="setting-the-maximum-nights-guests-can-stay">Setting the Maximum Nights Guests can Stay </h5>
<p>You can set the maximum number of nights guests can stay depending on which day of the week they check-in.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: The following payload sets two rules: </p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>If the guest checks-in on Monday, Wednesday or Thursday,  they can stay for 8 nights maximum. </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>For all other days, the guest can stay for 6 nights minimum. <code>UNSPECIFIED</code> indicates that this applies to all days that haven't had a value specifically set.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"max_nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"MONDAY"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"WEDNESDAY"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"THURSDAY"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"UNSPECIFIED"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Applying LOS Records
sections.content:
<h5 id="interaction-with-pricing-and-availability-apis">Interaction with Pricing and Availability APIs</h5>
<p>If you use LOS records to set a listing's price and availability, some of the parameters in the Pricing Settings API, Availability Rules API and Calendar Settings API must be omitted. The following sections indicate which parameters will no longer be supported, since you will consolidate pricing and availability features into LOS records instead of using other API calls.</p>
<p>Please make sure to omit the unused parameters in the API calls when updating listings that are using LOS records, otherwise errors might be raised. If you are managing listings that are not using LOS records, then those listings may continue using all existing pricing and availability rules.</p>
<p><b>Interaction with the Pricing Settings API</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Allowed while using LOS records</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_currency</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>default_daily_price</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>security_deposit</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>cleaning_fee</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>standard_fees</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>weekend_price</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>N</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>guests_included</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>N</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>price_per_extra_person</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>N</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>monthly_price_factor</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>N</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>weekly_price_factor</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>N</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>Interaction with the Availability Rules API</b></p>
<p>We will continue supporting all existing availability rules for listings using LOS records. </p>
<p>For any combination of [check-in date, guest number, length of stay], if the LOS record price is 0 then we will mark it as unavailable, and all the other Availability Rules will not be able to change it. However, if the LOS record shows this date as available, the other Availability Rules will be applied on top. This may add additional restrictions to the date and possibly render it unavailable for certain stays.</p>
<p>If a date is not included in any LOS record, either as a date available for check-in or as a date available for a stay, we will mark it as unavailable.</p>
<p><b>Interaction with the Calendars API and Calendar Batch Operations API</b></p>
<p> If using these endpoints to set availability on a daily basis, please make sure the daily availability is consistent with the  LOS records.</p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Allowed while using LOS records</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>daily_price</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>N</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>availability</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>available_count</code><br>(Calendar Batch Operations API only)</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>min_nights</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>max_nights</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>closed_to_arrival</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>closed_to_departure</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>notes</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="interaction-with-nightly-prices-standard-fees-and-discounts">Interaction with Nightly Prices, Standard Fees and Discounts</h5>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Stay price adjustments for seasonal pricing, length of stay discounts, or any other price adjustment that are not supported by Seasonal Rule Groups can be incorporated into LOS records.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Standard fees should be sent separately so they can be itemized during the guest checkout flow. </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Discounts that need to be displayed separately to guests should be sent separately and will be applied on top of the LOS record prices.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: FAQ
sections.content:
<p><b>Why does the Airbnb calendar display dates as blocked when our app set them as available?</b></p>
<p>If a Host cancels or initiates alterations to a reservation’s start/end dates, the original dates stay blocked.</p>
<h5 id="document-feedback">Document Feedback</h5>
<p>If you have any feedback on this document, please let us know. We are always interested in learning how we can improve the documentation and the reader's experience. <annotation>Please submit your feedback through the <a href="https://airbnb.secure.force.com/contactus/APICaseForm">API Technical Support Request Form</a>.</annotation></p>
