sections.name: Introduction
sections.content:
<p>This document describes how to create, edit, and manage listings using XML listing files and one REST API (<code>.../listing_imports</code>). You can use this API to upload an XML listing file which is imported to create a listing and checked periodically for changes. </p>
<p>The uploaded XML listing file is assigned a <b>Listing Import ID </b>(as opposed to a Listing ID for a published listing on the Airbnb website) and this is the ID you need to use for any further retrieving, updating, or deleting operations via the API. </p>
<p>Please note that you are responsible for maintaining current availability and pricing information in the XML listing file.</p>
<p>To implement Listing Management utilizing XML files, your application must have the <code>vr_feed</code> scope.</p>

sections.name: Publishing a Listing
sections.content:
<p>Your application can create new listings as well as connect to existing listings that are not API-connected on behalf of a host. You need to obtain OAuth authorization from the host in order to create and manage listings on their behalf. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default">Getting Started</a> for more information.</p>
<p>When publishing a listing from your application, you have the following options:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span> <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#creating-a-new-listing">Create a new listing</a>. You can:</span><br>
</li>
<ul>
<li>
<span>Create and automatically publish a new listing.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Create a listing and let the host decide whether to publish it as new or merge it with an existing listing.</span><br>
</li>
</ul>
<li>
<span><a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#connecting-to-an-existing-listing-via-the-api">Connect to an existing listing via the API</a>.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Sync Categories
sections.content:
<p>An Airbnb listing that is synced via your application contains a special field called <code>synchronization_category</code> (or sync category), which describes how the listing is being synced.</p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Category name</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Category value</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span>Everything</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"sync_all"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>All listing data is synced via your application. hosts cannot modify listing details, pricing or availability on the Airbnb website.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span>Limited</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"sync_rates_and_availability"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Only pricing and availability data is synced via your application. Hosts can modify listing details on the Airbnb website, but not pricing and availability data.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span>Undecided</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"sync_undecided"</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>All listing data is synced via your application, but the listing cannot be published. The sync category must be updated to Everything or Limited in order for the listing to be published.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span>None</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>null</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The listing is not API-connected. The host manages the listing directly on the Airbnb website.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p>Setting of the sync category can be done in two ways:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>You can set the sync category through the API when publishing a listing from your application. You do so by passing the sync category during the creation of the listing import. You can  either allow the listing import job to create a brand new listing with the given sync category or you can provide the id of an existing listing you would like to connect to.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Alternatively, you can leave this action to be done by the host on the Airbnb <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/sync">sync page</a>.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Creating a New Listing
sections.content:
<p>The steps below describe the flow for publishing a new listing from your application.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><b>Create a listing import:</b><b> </b> Call the Listing Imports API to <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#creating-a-listing-import">create a listing import</a> with an XML listing file. Set the <code>published</code> field to <code>true</code> in the file to trigger publishing of your listing. A listing is created with the  <code>requested_approval_status_category</code> set to <code>"new"</code> and the synchronization process between your XML listing file and Airbnb begins.  You can also specify the <code>synchronization_category</code> for the listing in the request. You have two options for the <code>synchronization_category</code>:</span><br>
</li>
<ul>
<li>
<span>Set it to <code>"sync_all"</code> to mark it as a new listing to be automatically published.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Set it to <code>"sync_undecided"</code> (the default value) to let the host decide whether to publish it or merge it with an existing listing.</span><br>
</li>
</ul>
<li>
<span><b>Synchronization and validation:</b> The XML data is parsed and the listing information is validated. If validation is successful, the listing is updated with the information in the XML listing file. If the validation fails, you must address the synchronization error. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-synchronization">Synchronization</a> for more details on how the XML and Airbnb listing data is synchronized and <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#troubleshooting">Troubleshooting</a> for more details on handling synchronization errors.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Request review: </b>After a successful synchronization, if the <code>published</code> field in the XML listing file is  <code>true,</code> Airbnb's automated review is triggered. The review validates the listing against the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#api-program-listing-requirements">API Program Listing Requirements</a>. If the listing is rejected, you must address the rejection reason(s) and re-submit for review. Please note that some listings require manual approval, in which case the <code>requested_approval_status_category</code> is set to <code>"ready_for_review"</code>. Once these listings are reviewed by Airbnb, you will be notified of the result. </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Publish: </b>Once the listing is approved, one of three things will occur.</span><br>
</li>
<ul>
<li>
<span>If the  <code>synchronization_category</code> was set to <code>"sync_all"</code> via the API then it will automatically be published<b>,</b> and <code>has_availability</code> will be set to <code>true</code>.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>If the <code>synchronization_category</code> is <code>"sync_undecided"</code> and the host has no existing listings on Airbnb that are not API-connected, then the new listing will automatically be published. The sync category will be set to Everything (i.e. <code>"sync_all"</code>) and you will receive a <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-synchronization-settings-updated">Listing Synchronization Settings Updated</a> notification. The host can subsequently change the sync category at any time on the <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/sync">sync page</a>.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>If the <code>synchronization_category</code> is <code>"sync_undecided"</code> and the host has existing listings on Airbnb that are not API-connected, the host must go to the <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/sync">sync page</a> to ensure a duplicate listing is not created when publishing.</span><br>
</li>
</ul>
</ul></div>
<blockquote>You cannot create a new listing with a Limited sync category. The host must first create the listing on the Airbnb website and then your application <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#connecting-to-an-existing-listing-via-the-api">can connect to it</a> with a Limited sync category.</blockquote>
<blockquote>
<b>Note:</b> If at any time before a listing is published, the <code>published</code> field is set to false, the <code>requested_approval_status_category</code> will be reset to <code>"new"</code>.</blockquote>
<h5 id="merging-with-an-existing-listing-on-the-sync-page">Merging with an Existing Listing on the Sync Page</h5>
<p>If you create a new listing without setting the sync category via the API and the host has existing listings on Airbnb that are not API-connected, the host must go to the Airbnb <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/sync">sync page</a> to choose whether to merge the newly-created listing with an existing listing, or publish it as a new listing.</p>
<p>On the sync page the host can:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>merge a newly-created API-connected listing with an existing listing on Airbnb, if applicable. Note that the host can only merge with existing listings that they are an owner of,  cohosted listings are not supported.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>choose the sync category for the newly-created API-connected listing and publish it.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>You will receive a <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-synchronization-settings-updated">Listing Synchronization Settings Updated</a> notification whenever the host performs an action on the sync page. See this <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/2347/">Help Center article</a> for more information on merging listings using the sync page.</p>
<p>The example below describes what happens when a host merges a newly-created API-connected listing with an existing listing.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Your application successfully creates a surrogate listing through the API which gets assigned a listing ID of 12345.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>On the sync page, the host merges this listing with one of their existing listings with a listing ID of 67890.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>You receive a <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-synchronization-settings-updated">Synchronization Settings Changed notification</a> that contains both IDs.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Your application is now allowed to edit listing 67890. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#existing-listing-content">Existing Listing Content</a> for details on what happens when the existing listing becomes API-connected.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Listing 12345 is deleted.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Connecting to an Existing Listing via the API
sections.content:
<p>You can connect to an existing listing that is not API-connected when publishing from your application through the API. To do so, first retrieve the host's existing listings and provide an interface for the host to map the listing in your software to an existing listing on Airbnb. Then call the Listing Imports API to to create a listing import for that listing. </p>
<blockquote>You can only connect to existing listings owned by the host. You cannot connect to listings that are cohosted by the host.</blockquote>
<h5 id="retrieving-a-host-s-existing-listings"><b>Retrieving a Host's Existing Listings</b></h5>
<p>You can fetch the host's existing Airbnb listings using the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#retrieving-all-host-listings">Listings API</a> (the <code>vr_feed</code> scope already includes read access to the listing content APIs, more info <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default/application-scopes">here</a>). </p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>To retrieve only the listings that are not API-connected, select the listings whose <code>synchronization_category</code> field is <code>null</code>.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>To retrieve only the listings that the host owns (i.e. is not a cohost of), use the <code>exclude_cohosted</code> query parameter.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<h5 id="connection-steps">Connection Steps</h5>
<p>The steps below describe the flow for connecting to an existing listing from your application.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><b>Create a listing import for the listing:</b><b> </b> Call the Listing Imports API to <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#creating-a-listing-import">create a listing import</a> with the listing's <code>listing_id</code> and set the <code>synchronization_category</code>  to either <code>"sync_all"</code> or <code>"sync_rates_and_availability"</code> (see note below). If the connection is successful, the <code>requested_approval_status_category</code> will be initialized to <code>"new"</code> and the listing will be temporarily unlisted until it is approved<b>. </b>The synchronization process between your XML listing file and the existing listing begins.<b> </b>See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#existing-listing-content">Existing Listing Content</a> for details on what happens when the existing listing becomes API-connected.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Synchronization and validation:</b> The XML data is parsed and the listing information is validated. If validation is successful, the listing is updated with the information in the XML listing file. If the validation fails, you must address the synchronization error. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-synchronization">Synchronization</a> for more details on how the XML and Airbnb listing data is synchronized and <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#troubleshooting">Troubleshooting</a> for more details on handling synchronization errors.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Request review: </b>After a successful synchronization, if the <code>published</code> field in the XML listing file is  <code>true,</code> Airbnb's automated review is triggered. The review validates the listing against the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#api-program-listing-requirements">API Program Listing Requirements</a>. If the listing is rejected, you must address the rejection reason(s) and re-submit for review. Please note that some listings require manual approval, in which case the <code>requested_approval_status_category</code> is set to <code>"ready_for_review"</code>. Once these listings are reviewed by Airbnb, you will be notified of the result.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Publish: </b>Once the listing is approved, it will automatically be published, i.e. <code>has_availability</code> will be set to <code>true</code>.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<blockquote>
<b>Note:</b> If you use <code>"sync_rates_and_availability"</code> and the existing listing's content does not meet the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#api-program-listing-requirements">API Program Listing Requirements</a>, the connection will be rejected. The existing listing will be unaffected by the connection attempt.</blockquote>
<blockquote>
<b>Note:</b> If at any time before a listing is published, the <code>published</code> field is set to false, the <code>requested_approval_status_category</code> will be reset to <code>"new"</code>.</blockquote>

sections.name: Existing Listing Content
sections.content:
<p>When you connect to an existing listing on Airbnb via the API, or when the host merges a newly-created API-connected listing with an existing listing on the sync page, none of the existing listing's content is replaced. All reservations, reviews, and content of the existing listing remain untouched. Most pricing and availability settings also remain, with the following exceptions:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Any imported iCals on the existing listing are unlinked when it becomes API-connected. This may open up dates that were previously blocked by iCals. After the connection is made, check the listing's availability and make necessary updates through API.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>The existing listing is converted to Instant Book if it was previously Request to Book.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Custom pricing and availability settings, such as discounts, seasonal rules and standard fees are cleared as they may not be supported by your application. <b>After the connection is made, perform any updates that are needed.</b></span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>To update the existing listing's information, make all the necessary listing update calls. </p>
<p>You will not receive any webhook notifications for existing bookings for the newly connected listings. <b>We suggest you perform an initial fetch of all reservations</b> using the <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#retrieving-all-reservations">Reservations API</a>.</p>

sections.name: Syncing Only Pricing and Availability
sections.content:
<p>If you only have pricing and availability data for a listing and want to sync that with Airbnb without providing listing content, you can do so using Limited sync.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>First, the host must create the listing on the Airbnb website if it is not already created. They can enter any valid values for pricing information as these fields will be overwritten when your application connects to the listing. An API-connected host can create listings on the Airbnb website.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Once the listing has been created, you can connect to the listing and set the sync category to <code>"sync_rates_and_availability"</code>. You do not need to provide any content when you connect to the listing.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Your XML listing file when syncing only pricing and availability only needs to contain the <code>pricing</code>, <code>availability</code> and <code>publish</code> nodes. Other nodes are optional for this operation.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>The listing is now connected with your application and will sync pricing and availability data from it. Any pricing data on the listing prior to the connection is overwritten with data from your application.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Managing a Published Listing
Updating the Sync Category
sections.content: <p>You can update the sync category of a listing at any time. The host can also update the sync category of a listing after it is published via the sync page. You will receive a <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-synchronization-settings-updated">Listing Synchronization Settings Updated notification</a> when any changes to the sync category occur. </p>

sections.name: Updating Limited Sync Listings
sections.content: <p>For listings with a Limited sync category, only the following fields from the XML listing file are used to update the listing: the <code>published</code> and <code>propertyExternalId</code> fields in the <code>listing</code> node, the <code>guestsIncluded</code> field in the  <code>basicDetails</code> node (now available in the <code>pricing</code> node), and all fields in the  <code>pricing</code> and <code>availability</code> nodes. However, please note that your XML listing file must contain all fields required for XML validation.</p>

sections.name: Unlisting Listings
sections.content: <p>To unlist a listing, set <code>published</code> field to <code>false</code>. This removes the listing from search results and hides it from guests' view. While unlisted, the listing's content will still be updated. To re-list the listing, set the <code>published</code> field back to <code>true</code>. </p>

sections.name: Disconnecting (Unlinking) Listings
sections.content:
<p>An API-connected listing can be disconnected from your application at any time. The host can do this on the sync page using the “Stop Sync” button. Your application can do so by deleting the listing import but keeping the listing on Airbnb (see <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#deleting-a-listing-import">Deleting a Listing Import</a>). Once disconnected, the host must manage the listing directly on the Airbnb website. You will receive a <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listings-unlinked">Listings Unlinked notification</a> when a listing is disconnected from your application. </p>
<blockquote>The host cannot reverse a stop sync. If the host wants to resume managing the listing through your application, you must connect to the listing again.</blockquote>

sections.name: Deleting Listings
sections.content: <p>You can choose to completely delete a listing. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#deleting-a-listing-import">Deleting a Listing Import</a>.  This removes both the Listing Import object and the associated listing. You will receive a <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listings-unlinked">Listings Unlinked notification</a> when the listing is disconnected from your application. </p>

sections.name: Disconnecting the Host's Account from your Application
sections.content: <p>Your application can be disconnected from the host's account at any time. You can do this by <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default#revoking-a-token">revoking their token</a> and the host can perform this action from their Account Settings. When this occurs, all the host's listings will be disconnected from your application and you will lose access to the host's account. You will receive an <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#authorization-revoked">Authorization Revoked notification</a> when a host's account is disconnected from your application. </p>

sections.name: Listing Synchronization
sections.content: <p>Synchronization happens when Airbnb downloads and attempts to validate your imported XML listing file and check it for content requirements. The first time this happens is when a new Airbnb listing is created.</p>

sections.name: Synchronization Initiation
sections.content:
<p>An XML listing file synchronization is initiated in one of 4 ways:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>When a Listing Import is first <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#creating-a-listing-import">created</a> through the API.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>When a synchronization's scheduled time arrives (hourly, daily, etc.). You can set how often this occurs with the <code>synchronization_frequency</code> parameter.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>When an immediate synchronization is <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#updating-a-listing-import">requested</a> using Listing Import API’s <code>on_demand_synchronization_requested</code> flag.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>When a potential guest enters the payment information page during a booking process. For this kind of synchronization, Airbnb updates the pricing and availability.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Synchronization Process
sections.content:
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>A synchronization is initiated (see above).</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Airbnb attempts to retrieve your XML listing file via HTTPS.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>If the file <b>has not</b> changed, nothing further happens. Otherwise, any updates are pushed to its associated Airbnb listing. <br><b>Note</b>: A <i>change</i> is defined as an XML listing file update or Airbnb's ability to once again access the same document (if hadn't been able to before due to a server being down or other problem). Once access is restored, Airbnb again checks the file and pushes any updates.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>A new listing is created if this is the file's first synchronization. Once created, you can see the listing's ID when you <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#retrieving-a-listing-import">retrieve your XML listing file </a>via the <code>.../listing_imports</code> API.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>If the update succeeds, nothing further happens. </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>If the update fails, it is immediately retried three more times. After four failed attempts, the listing is taken offline and nothing happens until the next validation/sync is initiated. Once re-validated, the listing is again synced and put back online.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Pre-booking synchronization job
sections.content:
<p>When a guest attempts to book a property, Airbnb makes a best effort to make sure the listing is up-to-date with your XML listing file.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>A quick check is performed while the guest is providing payment information, so that, when the user finalizes the booking, the calendar and pricing is up-to-date. </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>If the date the guest is trying to book is blocked in the updated document, the guest is not be able to book the requested dates.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>There is a small window between when the guest starts providing payment information and finalizing booking where the listing may be out-of-date because the XML listing file is updated after synchronization but before booking. <b>Though unlikely, the possibility remains.</b></span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Other information, such as pictures and descriptions, are not synchronized. Those updates are not picked up until the next full synchronization.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: API Program Listing Requirements
sections.content:
<p>In addition to the XML schema and listing validations, all listings published via the API are subject to our <a href="/partner/api-docs/overview/default#listing-api-program-policies">Listing API Program Policies</a>. Any listing that fails to meet the requirements of the policies will not be approved for publishing.</p>
<p><annotation>For listings that require registration, the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-regulations-api">Listings Registration API</a> is available for XML partners. </annotation></p>

sections.name: Notes on Testing
Creating Test Listings
sections.content:
<p>Do not create test listings under the Airbnb partner account (i.e. the account that owns the test application). Instead, create a new Airbnb account and authorize your test application for access.</p>
<p>Always authorize your test application with your test user account <i>before</i> creating test listings with that account. Once you authorize your test application with the account, any listings created with that account will only be visible to your test users. Furthermore, these listings will not be subject to our fake inventory monitors. Creating test listings without first authorizing your test application with the test user account could result in those listings being deleted by our fake inventory monitors. </p>

sections.name: Testing Checklist
sections.content:
<p>Before granting supply partners access to a production application, Airbnb will verify that they have completed the following listing management checklist using their test application.</p>
<h5 id="onboarding-listings">Onboarding listings</h5>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Create listings that both meet and don’t meet our minimum standards.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Confirm receipt of listing approval notifications (both approval and rejections).</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Publish at least 5 listings. Make sure to test all variations:</span><br>
</li>
<ul>
<li>
<span>publishing a new listing with full sync and with with limited sync</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>connecting to an existing listing with full and with limited sync. When connecting to existing listings make sure to import all current reservations. Tip: a quick way to create listings to use for connecting to is to stop sync some API listings, which will disconnect them from your application.</span><br>
</li>
</ul>
<li>
<span>Confirm the receipt of the Synchronization Settings notifications.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<h5 id="managing-listings">Managing Listings</h5>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Make sure you can successfully <annotation>unlist</annotation> and relist listings.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Try unlinking (stop sync) several listings. Confirm the receipt of unlinked notifications.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Try unlinking the entire account in two ways: by revoking a token, and by clicking Disconnect under Connected Apps as a host. Confirm the receipt of the authorization revoked notification.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Rate Limits
sections.content:
<p>Please first review the general API <a href="/partner/api-docs/overview/default#rate-limiting">Rate Limiting </a>requirements and ways to handle such issues. </p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>We have rate limiting requirements for each partner.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>The limit is 1000 calendar availability and price updates per min for each partner.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>If partner reaches the limit, partner will receive the 429 rate limit error.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Listing Import API
sections.content:
<p>This section details the API calls you can make to create and manage listings using XML listing files. </p>
<p>Before you begin making <code>.../listing_imports</code> API calls, you need to create XML listing files that describe the listing information. Please refer to the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#xml-listing-schema">XML Listing Schema</a> and the sections describing each node that follow. You can also see a full <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#xml-file-example">XML File Example</a>.</p>

sections.name: Creating a Listing Import
sections.content:
<p>You can use this endpoint to let Airbnb know your XML listing file's location, which needs to be publicly-accessible via HTTPS. This call triggers an initial synchronization but the job is asynchronous, <annotation>so you will only be able to see the result aft</annotation>er some time (usually several seconds).</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>POST /v2/listing_imports</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-body-parameters">Request Body Parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>document_format</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The <code>document_uri</code> file format. Currently, <b>must</b> be <code>"airbnb-xml-v1"</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>document_uri</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Document's fully qualified URI which must be publicly accessible and must be accessible via HTTPS. Must be unique for each listing import.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>synchronization_frequency</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>How frequently this document for be crawled for changes. Only <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#synchronization-frequencies">supported strings</a> are accepted.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>synchronization_category</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional, default is <code>sync_undecided</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If you are creating a new listing, use one of <code>"sync_all"</code> or <code>"sync_undecided"</code>. If you are connecting to an existing listing use one of <code>"sync_all"</code> or <code>"sync_rates_and_availability"</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of an existing, not API connected, listing that you would like to connect to. The listing must be owned by the host. You must pass the <code>synchronization_category</code>. If you are trying to connect with limited sync, the existing listing content will be validated against our API program listing requirements before allowing the connection.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response">Response</h5>
<p>Returns a <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-import-object">Listing Import </a>Object. </p>
<h5 id="example-request">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"POST"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/listing_imports"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 8uaxi4r1busbeg21fuacga40c"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: av8mf8kd4k40fq26xxd9w4p44"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -d <span class="s1">'{
    "document_format": "airbnb-xml-v1",
    "document_uri": "https://example.com/listing-1.xml",
    "synchronization_frequency": "hourly"
  }'</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"listing_import"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">9473626</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"document_format"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"airbnb-xml-v1"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"document_uri"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"https://example.com/listing-1.xml"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"synchronization_frequency"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"hourly"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"current_listing_import_document_version"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"last_synchronization_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"last_synchronization_error"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"last_synchronization_status"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_approval_status"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"on_demand_synchronization_requested"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"user_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">199443</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Updating a Listing Import
sections.content:
<pre class="highlight text"><code>PUT https://api.airbnb.com/v2/listing_imports/:listing_import_id</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-id">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_import_id</code> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the listing </span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="request-body-parameters-2">Request Body Parameters</h5>
<p>You can pass any of these fields to manage the Listing upload. All other changes can be made in the XML listing file itself before re-syncing.</p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>document_format</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The format of the document located at <code>document_uri</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>document_uri</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Fully qualified URI to the import document. This must be publicly accessible.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>synchronization_frequency</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>How frequently Airbnb should crawl this document for changes. Only <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#synchronization-frequencies">supported strings</a> are accepted.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>synchronization_category</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>One of <code>"sync_all"</code> or <code>"sync_rates_and_availability"</code>. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#sync-categories">Sync Categories</a> for more information.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>on_demand_synchronization_requested</code> <br> <i>boolean</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Debug feature to trigger an on demand sync. Use this to troubleshoot document issues. Omit this value if you are not setting it to <code>true</code>. Note that the job runs asynchronously, so the response will still contain the result of the previous job.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-2">Response</h5>
<p>A <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-import-object">Listing Import Object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-2">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"PUT"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/listing_imports/9473626"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 8uaxi4r1busbeg21fuacga40c"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: av8mf8kd4k40fq26xxd9w4p44"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -d <span class="s1">'{
    "synchronization_frequency": "daily"
  }'</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-2">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"listing_import"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">9473626</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">165749</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"document_format"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"airbnb-xml-v1"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"document_uri"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"https://example.com/listing-1.xml"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"synchronization_frequency"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"daily"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"current_listing_import_document_version"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"last_synchronization_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-09-28 12:12:50 UTC"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"last_synchronization_error"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"last_synchronization_status"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"success"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_approval_status"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"status_category"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"new"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"notes"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"on_demand_synchronization_requested"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"user_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">199443</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Retrieving a Listing Import
sections.content:
<p>Use this endpoint to retrieve the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-import-object">Listing Import Object</a> associated with your XML listing file. To troubleshoot an error, you can check the file's synchronization status. This endpoint takes a listing import ID as a URL ID parameter.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>GET /v2/listing_imports/:listing_import_id</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-id-2">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_import_id</code> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the listing </span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-3">Response</h5>
<p>A <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-import-object">Listing Import Object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-3">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"GET"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/listing_imports/9473626"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 8uaxi4r1busbeg21fuacga40c"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: av8mf8kd4k40fq26xxd9w4p44"</span> <span class="se">\</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-3">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"listing_import"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">9473626</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">165749</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"document_format"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"airbnb-xml-v1"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"document_uri"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"https://example.com/listing-1.xml"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"synchronization_frequency"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"hourly"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"current_listing_import_document_version"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"last_synchronization_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-09-28 12:12:50 UTC"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"last_synchronization_error"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"last_synchronization_status"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"success"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_approval_status"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"status_category"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"new"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"notes"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"on_demand_synchronization_requested"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"user_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">199443</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Retrieving all User Listing Imports
sections.content:
<p>Use this endpoint to retrieve all <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-import-object">Listing Import Object</a>s associated with a host.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>GET /v2/listing_imports</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-parameters">Request URL parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Param</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>user_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The owner of the listing imports</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>_limit</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional, default is 100</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The maximum number of listing imports to return, up to 100.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>_offset</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional, default is 0</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The number of listing imports to skip over, where the ordering is consistent but unspecified. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-4">Response</h5>
<p>Array of  <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-import-object">Listing Import Objects</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-4">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"GET"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/listing_imports?user_id=3455434"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 8uaxi4r1busbeg21fuacga40c"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: av8mf8kd4k40fq26xxd9w4p44"</span> <span class="se">\</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-4">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"listing_imports"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">9473626</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">165749</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"document_format"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"airbnb-xml-v1"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"document_uri"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"https://example.com/listing-1.xml"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"synchronization_frequency"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"hourly"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"current_listing_import_document_version"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"last_synchronization_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-09-28 12:12:50 UTC"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"last_synchronization_error"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"last_synchronization_status"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"success"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"listing_approval_status"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"status_category"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"new"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"notes"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"on_demand_synchronization_requested"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">

    </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Deleting a Listing Import
sections.content:
<p>Deletes an existing listing import. You can choose between deleting the associated listing or keeping the associated listing as manual.</p>
<blockquote>NOTE<b>:</b> Deleting the listing will fail if it has at least one upcoming reservation.</blockquote>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>DELETE /v2/listing_imports/:listing_import_id/:entity_type</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-id-3">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_import_id</code> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the listing </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>entity_type</code> <br> <u>optional, default is <code>"import_with_listing"</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <code>"import"</code> to delete the listing import but keep the listing on Airbnb, or use <code>"import_with_listing"</code> to also delete the listing.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-5">Response</h5>
<p>A<a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-import-object"> Listing Import Object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-5">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"DELETE"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/listing_imports/9473626/import"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 8uaxi4r1busbeg21fuacga40c"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: av8mf8kd4k40fq26xxd9w4p44"</span> </code></pre>

sections.name: Listing Import Object
sections.content:
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing Import ID—assigned automatically when Listing is first exported.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>user_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>IDs the user doing the uploading.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing ID. This is assigned at listing import creation.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>document_format</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>document_uri</code> format</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>document_uri</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Fully qualified URI to the exported XML listing file. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>synchronization_frequency</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>How frequently Airbnb should check this file for changes. Only supported strings are accepted.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>on_demand_synchronization_requested</code> <br> <i>boolean</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Debug feature to trigger an on- demand sync. Use this to troubleshoot sync issues. Omit this value if you are not setting it to <code>true</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>current_listing_import_document_version</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The latest version of the document published to Airbnb.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>last_synchronization_at</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><a href="https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html">ISO-8601 </a>formatted string representing the last time Airbnb crawled this document.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>last_synchronization_error</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Last checked error status</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>last_synchronization_status</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Last checked status. Only <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#synchronization-statuses">valid strings</a> are given.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_approval_status</code> <br><i>object</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing Approval Status object (see below).</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>synchronization_category</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The synchronization category for this listing. One of <code>"sync_all"</code>, <code>"sync_rates_and_availability"</code>, <code>"sync_undecided"</code> or <code>null</code>. See Sync Categories for more details. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>Listing Approval Status object</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>status_category</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Status. One of <code>"new"</code>, <code>"ready for review"</code>, <code>"rejected"</code>, or <code>"approved"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>notes</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If rejected, the decision notes.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>

sections.name: Listing Import Document API
sections.content: <p>A listing import document represents a snapshot of a listing import crawl. Each successful crawl that finds a change in the source XML listing file is given a new version and cached for debugging purposes. We store the documents for the last 30 days. <br>This API allows developers to query the historical versions and verify changes as seen by Airbnb, e.g. check what prices Airbnb saw in the XML at the time of a reservation.</p>

sections.name: Retrieving Listing Import Documents
sections.content:
<p>Use this endpoint to retrieve all <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-import-object">Listing Import Object</a>s associated with a Partner.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>GET /v2/listing_import_documents</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-parameters-2">Request URL parameters</h5>
<p>We require at least one of the parameters <code>listing_import_id</code> or <code>reservation_confirmation_code</code> to be provided. In case both are present, <code>reservation_confirmation_code</code> has a higher priority and returns the last document created before that reservation.</p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Param</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_import_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The ID of the listing import to look up the documents for.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>reservation_confirmation_code</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The confirmation code to look up the last document created before that reservation.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>crawled_before</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><a href="https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html">ISO-8601</a> formatted string representing the time cutoff to look up documents created before that timestamp.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>_limit</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional, default is 100</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The maximum number of listing imports to return, up to 100.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>_offset</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional, default is 0</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The number of listing imports to skip over, where the ordering is consistent but unspecified. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-6">Response</h5>
<p>Array of  <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-import-document-object">Listing Import Document Objects</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-6">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"GET"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/listing_import_documents?listing_import_id=1"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 8uaxi4r1busbeg21fuacga40c"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: av8mf8kd4k40fq26xxd9w4p44"</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-5">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"listing_import_documents"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"document_uri"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"https://example.com/listing-1.xml"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"download_uri"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"https://airbnb-services-production.s3.amazonaws.com/…"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"first_synchronization_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2016-02-18T21:50:58+00:00"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"1/1"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"last_synchronization_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2016-02-18T21:50:58+00:00"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"listing_import_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"version"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Listing Import Document Object
sections.content:
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of this document version. Composed of <code>listing_import_id</code> and <code>version</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>version</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A monotonically increasing value representing an exact snapshot of the associated listing import.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_import_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the listing import associated with this document.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>download_uri</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>URI to download a copy of the document that was crawled and cached by Airbnb.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>document_uri</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The fully qualified URI that Airbnb accessed to create this document version.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>first_synchronization_at</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><a href="https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html">ISO-8601 </a>formatted string representing the first time Airbnb encountered this version of the document.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>last_synchronization_at</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><a href="https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html">ISO-8601 </a>formatted string representing the last time Airbnb crawled this version document.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>

        <span class="nt">&lt;xs:element</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"pricing"</span> <span class="na">type=</span><span class="s">"pricing"</span> <span class="na">minOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="na">maxOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>

    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:sequence&gt;</span>

        <span class="nt">&lt;xs:simpleType&gt;</span>

                  <span class="nt">&lt;xs:pattern</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"(D|I|O|N)(,(D|I|O|N))*"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
                <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:restriction&gt;</span>
              <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:simpleType&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:element&gt;</span>
          <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:sequence&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:complexType&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:element&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:sequence&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:complexType&gt;</span>
  
   <span class="nt">&lt;xs:simpleType</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"dailyAvailability"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:restriction</span> <span class="na">base=</span><span class="s">"xs:string"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
      <span class="c">&lt;!-- matches: D,A,U,A,... --&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:pattern</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"(D|A|U)(,(D|A|U))*"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:restriction&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:simpleType&gt;</span>

  <span class="nt">&lt;xs:simpleType</span> <span class="na">name =</span> <span class="s">"dailyAvailableCount"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:restriction</span> <span class="na">base=</span><span class="s">"xs:string"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
      <span class="c">&lt;!-- matches: 3,5,2,1,... --&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:pattern</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"([0-9]+)(,([0-9]+))*"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:restriction&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:simpleType&gt;</span>

  <span class="nt">&lt;xs:complexType</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"defaultAvailabilityRules"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:sequence&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:element</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"availabilityRule"</span> <span class="na">type=</span><span class="s">"availabilityRule"</span> <span class="na">minOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="na">maxOccurs=</span><span class="s">"30"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:sequence&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:complexType&gt;</span>
  
  <span class="nt">&lt;xs:complexType</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"seasonalAvailabilityGroups"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:sequence&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:element</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"seasonalAvailabilityGroup"</span> <span class="na">type=</span><span class="s">"seasonalAvailabilityGroup"</span> <span class="na">minOccurs=</span><span class="s">"0"</span> <span class="na">maxOccurs=</span><span class="s">"100"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:sequence&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:complexType&gt;</span>

  <span class="nt">&lt;xs:complexType</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"seasonalAvailabilityGroup"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:sequence&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:element</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"dateRange"</span> <span class="na">type=</span><span class="s">"dateRange"</span> <span class="na">minOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="na">maxOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:element</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"availabilityRules"</span> <span class="na">type=</span><span class="s">"availabilityRules"</span> <span class="na">minOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="na">maxOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:sequence&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:complexType&gt;</span>

  <span class="nt">&lt;xs:complexType</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"availabilityRules"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:sequence&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:element</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"availabilityRule"</span> <span class="na">type=</span><span class="s">"availabilityRule"</span> <span class="na">minOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="na">maxOccurs=</span><span class="s">"30"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:sequence&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:complexType&gt;</span>

 <span class="nt">&lt;xs:complexType</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"availabilityRule"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:sequence&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:element</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"type"</span> <span class="na">minOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="na">maxOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;xs:simpleType&gt;</span>
          <span class="nt">&lt;xs:restriction</span> <span class="na">base=</span><span class="s">"xs:string"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;xs:enumeration</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"MIN_NIGHTS"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;xs:enumeration</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"MAX_NIGHTS"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;xs:enumeration</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"CLOSED_FOR_CHECKIN"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;xs:enumeration</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"CLOSED_FOR_CHECKOUT"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
          <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:restriction&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:simpleType&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:element&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:element</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"value"</span> <span class="na">type=</span><span class="s">"xs:positiveInteger"</span> <span class="na">minOccurs=</span><span class="s">"0"</span> <span class="na">maxOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:element</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"daysOfWeek"</span> <span class="na">minOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="na">maxOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;xs:simpleType&gt;</span>
          <span class="nt">&lt;xs:restriction</span> <span class="na">base=</span><span class="s">"xs:string"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;xs:pattern</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"((MONDAY|TUESDAY|WEDNESDAY|THURSDAY|FRIDAY|SATURDAY|SUNDAY)(,(MONDAY|TUESDAY|WEDNESDAY|THURSDAY|FRIDAY|SATURDAY|SUNDAY))*)|UNSPECIFIED"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
          <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:restriction&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:simpleType&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:element&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:sequence&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:complexType&gt;</span>
  
  <span class="nt">&lt;xs:complexType</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"dateRange"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:sequence&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:element</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"startDate"</span> <span class="na">type=</span><span class="s">"xs:date"</span> <span class="na">minOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="na">maxOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:element</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"endDate"</span> <span class="na">type=</span><span class="s">"xs:date"</span> <span class="na">minOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="na">maxOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:sequence&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:complexType&gt;</span>
  
  <span class="nt">&lt;xs:complexType</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"losRecords"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:sequence&gt;</span>
      <span class="c">&lt;!-- support up to 18 months(550 days); max guest number is 16 --&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:element</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"r"</span> <span class="na">type=</span><span class="s">"losRecord"</span> <span class="na">minOccurs=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="na">maxOccurs=</span><span class="s">"8800"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:sequence&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:complexType&gt;</span>

  <span class="nt">&lt;xs:simpleType</span> <span class="na">name =</span> <span class="s">"losRecord"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:restriction</span> <span class="na">base=</span><span class="s">"xs:string"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
      <span class="c">&lt;!-- matches: 2019-02-28,1,100,200,300,... --&gt;</span>
      <span class="c">&lt;!-- guest number should &gt;=1 and &lt;=16; length of stay should &gt;=1 and &lt;=28 --&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:pattern</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"([12]\d{3}-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])-(0[1-9]|[12]\d|3[01])),([1-9]|1[0-6]),(\d+,){0,27}\d+"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:restriction&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:simpleType&gt;</span>

  <span class="c">&lt;!-- Simple types --&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;xs:simpleType</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"enumArray"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:restriction</span> <span class="na">base=</span><span class="s">"xs:string"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:pattern</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"([a-zA-Z_]+)(,[a-zA-Z_]+)*"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:restriction&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:simpleType&gt;</span>
  
  <span class="nt">&lt;xs:simpleType</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"hours"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:restriction</span> <span class="na">base=</span><span class="s">"xs:nonNegativeInteger"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:minInclusive</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"0"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:maxInclusive</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"23"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:restriction&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:simpleType&gt;</span>
  
  <span class="nt">&lt;xs:simpleType</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"feePercent"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:restriction</span> <span class="na">base=</span><span class="s">"xs:decimal"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:minExclusive</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"0"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:maxInclusive</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"100"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:restriction&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:simpleType&gt;</span>
  
  <span class="nt">&lt;xs:simpleType</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"checkInHours"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:restriction</span> <span class="na">base=</span><span class="s">"xs:nonNegativeInteger"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:minInclusive</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"8"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:maxInclusive</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"26"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:restriction&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:simpleType&gt;</span>

  <span class="nt">&lt;xs:simpleType</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"personCapacity"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:restriction</span> <span class="na">base=</span><span class="s">"xs:nonNegativeInteger"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:minInclusive</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"0"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:maxInclusive</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"100"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:restriction&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:simpleType&gt;</span>

  <span class="nt">&lt;xs:simpleType</span> <span class="na">name=</span><span class="s">"priceFactor"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;xs:restriction</span> <span class="na">base=</span><span class="s">"xs:decimal"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:minExclusive</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"0"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;xs:maxInclusive</span> <span class="na">value=</span><span class="s">"1"</span> <span class="nt">/&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:restriction&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/xs:simpleType&gt;</span>

<span class="nt">&lt;/xs:schema&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: XML Listing
sections.content: <p><code>listing</code> is the main node of the XML. Please include <code>xmlns="http://www.airbnb.com/schemas/airbnb-listing/v1"</code> and <code>schemaVersion='1.0'</code> as attributes.</p>

sections.name: listing
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Child</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>lastUpdated</code> <br> <i>datetime<br></i><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Last time the XML listing file was updated.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>published</code> <br> <i>boolean</i><br><b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Whether the listing is published.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>basicDetails</code> <br> <i>basicDetails</i><br><i><b>required<br></b></i><u>optional for Limited sync</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Basic listing information. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#basicdetails">basicDetails</a> type.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>descriptions</code> <br> <i>array of description</i><br><i><b>required<br></b></i><u>optional for Limited sync</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing descriptions. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#description">description</a> type.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>location</code> <br> <i>location</i><br><b><i>required<br></i></b><u>optional for Limited sync</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Location information node of  <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#location">location</a> type</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>photos</code> <br> <i>array of photo</i><br><b><i>required<br></i></b><u>optional for Limited sync</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Photos.  Minimum 0, maximum 200. Array of nodes of <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#photo">photo</a> type.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>bookingSettings</code> <br> <i>bookingSettings</i><br><b><i>required<br></i></b><u>optional for Limited sync</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The booking settings of the listing.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>pricing</code> <br> <i>pricing</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Pricing information node of <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#pricing">pricing</a> type.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>availability</code> <br> <i>availability</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Availability information node of  <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#availability">availability</a> type.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>losRecords</code> <br> <i>losRescords</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>LOS records table for the listing. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#xml-los-records">LOS Records</a> for more details.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>propertyExternalId</code><br><i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><b>Room Type inventory only.</b> A string indicating which property current listing belongs to. This id can be the property's id on PMS platform; the id for each property should be unique. For more information about representative inventory, see the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#room-type-inventory">Room Type Inventory</a> section of the Appendix.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="cp">&lt;?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;listing</span> <span class="na">xmlns=</span><span class="s">"http://www.airbnb.com/schemas/airbnb-listing/v1"</span> <span class="na">schemaVersion=</span><span class="s">"1.0"</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>
