   <span class="nt">&lt;lastUpdated&gt;</span>2017-07-03T14:55:35Z<span class="nt">&lt;/lastUpdated&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;published&gt;</span>true<span class="nt">&lt;/published&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;basicDetails&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/basicDetails&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;descriptions&gt;</span>
       <span class="nt">&lt;description&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/description&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/descriptions&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;location&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/location&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;photos&gt;</span>
       <span class="nt">&lt;photo&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/photo&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/photos&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;pricing&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/pricing&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;availability&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/availability&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/listing&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: XML Basic Listing Details
sections.content: <p>This section provides a breakdown of the elements included in the <code>basicDetails</code>  node</p>

sections.name: basicDetails
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements-2">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>bathrooms</code> <br> <i>double</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Number of bathrooms. The minimum value is 0, and the maximum is 50. Half values can be used, e.g. 1.5.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>bedrooms</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Number of bedrooms.  The minimum value is 0, and the maximum is 50. <b>Note: 0 bedrooms indicates a studio, and should only be used for this case.</b></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>propertyTypeGroup</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>General Property style group. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#property-types">possible values</a> and allowed property types for each group.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>propertyType</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Property style description. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#property-types">possible values</a> and allowed listing types for each group.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listingType</code> <br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Property's privacy description. One of <code>"private_room"</code>, <code>"shared_room"</code>, <code>"entire_home"</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>amenities</code> <br><i>array of amenity</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>An array of <code>amenity</code> nodes each containing one of <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#amenity-strings">amenity strings</a>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>checkInOption</code> <br><i>checkInOption</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Describes how guests will check in. See Checkin Option node below.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>cancellationPolicy</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>API only supports some of Airbnb's cancellation policies. See<a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#cancellation-policies"> possible values</a> for details.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>personCapacity</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Number of people who can stay at the listing, from <code>1</code> to <code>100</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>guestsIncluded</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional, default is <code>personCapacity<br></code>[DEPRECATED]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Beyond this number, any more guests are charged <code>extraPersonPrice</code> . If present must be from <code>1</code> to <code>100</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>beds</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The number of beds in the listing.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>checkInTime</code><u><br> integer<br></u><u>[DEPRECATED</u><u>]</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <code>checkInTimeStart</code> instead. Earliest time the guest can check in, indicated as hour between <code>0</code> and <code>24</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>checkInTimeStart</code><br><i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Earliest time the guest can check-in, indicated as hour between <code>8</code> and <code>25</code>. Can be combined with <code>checkInTimeEnd</code> to specify a check-in window. Default is <code>flexible</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>checkInTimeEnd</code><br><i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Latest time the guest can check in, indicated as hour between 9 and <code>26</code> (<code>25</code> and <code>26</code> are 1 am and 2am for the <b>next</b> day. <code>checkInTimeStart</code> is required for the end time to apply. The check-in window should be at least 2 hours.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>checkOutTime</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Time the guest must check out, indicated as hour between <code>0</code> and <code>23</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>directions</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Directions for confirmed guests. Directions are private and only shared with guests after a reservation is confirmed.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>houseManual</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Notes for guest on enjoying their visit and the property</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>permitId</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The local permit or tax ID (if required) for display on public listing page. <b>Note:</b> should not be used to provide registration information in cities where Airbnb works with local governments to register hosts.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>internalName</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Private name only viewable to the host, but not to guests.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>bathroomShared</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Is the bathroom shared? Ignore for <code>"entire_home"</code> listings.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>bathroomSharedWithCategory</code> <br><i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Who is the bathroom shared with? Comma separated values from <code>"host"</code>, <code>"family_friends_roommates"</code>, <code>"other_guests"</code>. Ignore for <code>"entire_home"</code> listings.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>commonSpacesShared</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Are the common spaces shared? Not applicable for <code>"entire_home"</code> listings.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>commonSpacesSharedWithCategory</code> <br><i>string</i><br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Who are the common spaces shared with? Comma separated values from <code>"host"</code>, <code>"family_friends_roommates"</code>, <code>"other_guests"</code>. Ignore for <code>"entire_home"</code> listings.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>roomConfigurations</code> <br> <i>array of roomConfiguration</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Bedroom details as an array of nodes of <code>roomConfiguration</code> type. Please note that the cumulative number of beds you have in this section will overwrite the number of beds specified at the listing level.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-2">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;basicDetails&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;bathrooms&gt;</span>4<span class="nt">&lt;/bathrooms&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;bedrooms&gt;</span>5<span class="nt">&lt;/bedrooms&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;propertyTypeGroup&gt;</span>houses<span class="nt">&lt;/propertyTypeGroup&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;propertyType&gt;</span>house<span class="nt">&lt;/propertyType&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;listingType&gt;</span>entire_home<span class="nt">&lt;/listingType&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;amenities&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;amenity&gt;</span>kitchen<span class="nt">&lt;/amenity&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;amenity&gt;</span>wireless_internet<span class="nt">&lt;/amenity&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;amenity&gt;</span>tv<span class="nt">&lt;/amenity&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;amenity&gt;</span>ac<span class="nt">&lt;/amenity&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;amenity&gt;</span>washer<span class="nt">&lt;/amenity&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/amenities&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;checkInOption&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/checkInOption&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;cancellationPolicy&gt;</span>strict<span class="nt">&lt;/cancellationPolicy&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;personCapacity&gt;</span>12<span class="nt">&lt;/personCapacity&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;beds&gt;</span>10<span class="nt">&lt;/beds&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;checkInTimeStart&gt;</span>14<span class="nt">&lt;/checkInTimeStart&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;checkInTimeEnd&gt;</span>FLEXIBLE<span class="nt">&lt;/checkInTimeEnd&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;checkOutTime&gt;</span>11<span class="nt">&lt;/checkOutTime&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;bathroomShared&gt;</span>false<span class="nt">&lt;/bathroomShared&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;commonSpacesShared&gt;</span>true<span class="nt">&lt;/commonSpacesShared&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;commonSpacesSharedWith&gt;</span>host,family_friends_roommates<span class="nt">&lt;/commonSpacesSharedWith&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;roomConfigurations&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;roomConfiguration&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/roomConfiguration&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/roomConfigurations&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/basicDetails&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: checkInOption
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements-3">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>category</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The type of check in the host offers. Must one of <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#check-in-option-types">supported strings</a>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>instruction</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The instructions for guests on how to checkin. Only shared with confirmed guests.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-3">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;checkInOption&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;category&gt;</span>lockbox<span class="nt">&lt;/category&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;instruction&gt;</span>Code 0813<span class="nt">&lt;/instruction&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/checkInOption&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: roomConfiguration
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements-4">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>roomNumber</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Room number, use <code>0</code> for common spaces arrangement.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>beds</code> <br><i>array of inventoryInfo</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>An array describing each bed type present in the room. See <code>inventoryInfo</code> schema below and <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#bed-types">the list of supported bed types.</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>roomAmenities</code> <br><i>array of inventoryInfo</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>An array describing each amenity type present in the room. See <code>inventoryInfo</code> schema below and note that only the <code>en_suite_bathroom</code> amenity type is supported for now.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>inventoryInfo</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>type</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The type of the inventory.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>quantity</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Number of beds of this type.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-4">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;roomConfiguration&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;roomNumber&gt;</span>1<span class="nt">&lt;/roomNumber&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;beds&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;bed&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>king_bed<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;quantity&gt;</span>2<span class="nt">&lt;/quantity&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/bed&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/beds&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;roomAmenities&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;roomAmenity&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>en_suite_bathroom<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;quantity&gt;</span>1<span class="nt">&lt;/quantity&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/roomAmenity&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/roomAmenities&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/roomConfiguration&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: XML Listing Descriptions
sections.content:
<p>This section provides a breakdown of the elements included in the <code>description</code>  node. </p>
<blockquote>To prevent updating, remove the description field node<br>To remove a description field node, pass the field as an empty node, IE. &lt;notes /&gt;</blockquote>

sections.name: description
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements-5">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>language</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A supported language code, such as <code>en</code> (see all <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#supported-locales">possible locales</a>). All fields in the description are to be in this language.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>name</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing name or title shown on top of the listing and in search results. Maximum string characters is 255.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>summary</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use this field to provide an overview. You can include details about the decor, amenities, and the neighborhood.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>space</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Details about what makes the space unique.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>access</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>What parts of the space the guests can access</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>interaction</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Whether or how you will be available to help throughout the day</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>neighborhood</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>What makes the listing's neighborhood unique</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>transit</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Whether the listing is close to public transportation (or far from it), and nearby parking options</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>houseRules</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>How guests are expected to behave</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>notes</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Other details that will impact the stay of the guests</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-5">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;description&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;language&gt;</span>en<span class="nt">&lt;/language&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;name&gt;</span>Amazing Listing<span class="nt">&lt;/name&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;summary&gt;</span>This is an amazing listing in San Francisco<span class="nt">&lt;/summary&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;space&gt;</span>2 Bedrooms for you to use and you can cook.<span class="nt">&lt;/space&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;access&gt;</span>You can access the stuff we allow you to.<span class="nt">&lt;/access&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;interaction&gt;</span>We are next door. Just knock.<span class="nt">&lt;/interaction&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;neighborhood&gt;</span>In beautiful Bay View neighborhood<span class="nt">&lt;/neighborhood&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;transit&gt;</span>Bike anywhere.<span class="nt">&lt;/transit&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;houseRules&gt;</span>No drinking or smoking.<span class="nt">&lt;/houseRules&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;notes&gt;</span>Great balcony for you to use.<span class="nt">&lt;/notes&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/description&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: XML Location
sections.content: <p>This section provides a breakdown of the elements included in the <code>location</code>  node.</p>

sections.name: location
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements-6">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>lat</code> <br> <i>double</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Latitude value with at least 6 decimal points precision.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>lng</code> <br> <i>double</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Longitude value with at least 6 decimal points precision.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>apt</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Apartment, suite, or unit number. Non-special characters only.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>streetAddress</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Street address</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>city</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>City</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>administrativeDivision</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>States, territories, districts, or province.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>postalCode</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Zip code</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>countryCode</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing's two-letter country code, capitalized. Format: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2">ISO 3166-1 alpha-2</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-6">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;location&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;lat&gt;</span>22.3566336<span class="nt">&lt;/lat&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;lng&gt;</span>-80.4440641<span class="nt">&lt;/lng&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;streetAddress&gt;</span>2785 Sugar Palm Road<span class="nt">&lt;/streetAddress&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;city&gt;</span>Kissimmee<span class="nt">&lt;/city&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;administrativeDivision&gt;</span>FL<span class="nt">&lt;/administrativeDivision&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;postalCode&gt;</span>32787<span class="nt">&lt;/postalCode&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;countryCode&gt;</span>US<span class="nt">&lt;/countryCode&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/location&gt;</span></code></pre>
<blockquote>
<b>NOTE: </b>Be careful with setting the location of the listing.<b> </b> Once set, you may not be able to change your listing's location. Airbnb's fraud/risk prevention department considers this a potential fraud red flag. If you get any error contact  support if this is what you would like to do. We can provide limited support with this so, if possible, delete and recreate the listing with correct coordinates.</blockquote>

sections.name: XML Photo
sections.content: <p>This section provides a breakdown of the elements included in the <code>photo</code>  node.</p>

sections.name: photo
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements-7">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>uri</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The photo URI, max file size is 25MB. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>caption</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Photo caption</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-7">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;photo&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;uri&gt;</span>https://mypms.com/4532432/bedroom.jpg<span class="nt">&lt;/uri&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;caption&gt;</span>Bedroom<span class="nt">&lt;/caption&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/photo&gt;</span></code></pre>
<blockquote>We use the photo URIs as IDs for your XML photos. Thus, we won't update listing photos unless we see a change in the URI.</blockquote>

sections.name: XML Booking Settings
sections.content: <p>This section provides a breakdown of the elements included in the <code>bookingSettings</code>  node</p>

sections.name: bookingSettings
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements-8">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>instantBookingAllowedCategory</code> <br><i>string</i><br><u>optional, default is "everyone"</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Defines categories of guests that can make Instant Book requests. Anyone who doesn’t meet these requirements can still send a reservation request. One of <a href="https://airbnb.com/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#instant-booking-allowed-category">supported strings</a>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>instantBookWelcomeMessage</code> <br><i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>When a guest books instantly, they’ll see this greeting while they’re booking. Greet the guest and gather info about their trip.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>guestControls</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Rules guests must agree to before they book. See <code>guestControls</code> node below.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listingExpectations</code> <br><i>array of listingExpectation</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Details guests must know about the home. Set expectations that the guests must agree to before booking. See <code>listingExpectation</code> node below.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<blockquote>Enabling <code>instantBookingAllowedCategory</code> (i.e. Instant Book guest requirements) means that reservation requests will be required for some bookings. You must also implement support for <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#accepting-or-denying-a-reservation-request">Accepting and Denying a Reservation Request</a> in your application.</blockquote>
<h5 id="example-8">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;bookingSettings&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;instantBookingAllowedCategory&gt;</span>experienced<span class="nt">&lt;/instantBookingAllowedCategory&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;instantBookWelcomeMessage&gt;&lt;/instantBookWelcomeMessage&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;guestControls&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/guestControls&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;listingExpectations&gt;</span>
       <span class="nt">&lt;listingExpectation&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/listingExpectation&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/listingExpectations&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/bookingSettings&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: listingExpectation
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements-9">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>type</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The type of the restriction the guests must agree to. Must be one of <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-expectation-types">Listing Expectation Types.</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>addedDetails</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Provide optional details. Max 150 characters.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-9">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;listingExpectation&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>has_pets<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;addedDetails&gt;</span>We have a cat.<span class="nt">&lt;/addedDetails&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/listingExpectation&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: guestControls
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements-10">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>allowsChildrenAsHost</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Is listing suitable for children (2-12 years)? <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/1348/if-i-set-my-house-rules-to-allow-infants-or-children--what-should-i-know">Learn More</a>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>allowsInfantsAsHost</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Is listing suitable for infants (under 2 years)? <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/1348/if-i-set-my-house-rules-to-allow-infants-or-children--what-should-i-know">Learn More</a>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>childrenNotAllowedDetails</code> <br><i>string</i><br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If you selected false for any of the above, this field is required to provide details about why the place is not suitable for children.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>allowsSmokingAsHost</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Is smoking allowed?</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>allowsPetsAsHost</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Are pets allowed? <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/1869/what-is-an-assistance-animal">Learn More.</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>allowsEventsAsHost</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Are parties or events allowed?</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-10">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;guestControls&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;allowsChildrenAsHost&gt;</span>true<span class="nt">&lt;/allowsChildrenAsHost&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;allowsInfantsAsHost&gt;</span>false<span class="nt">&lt;/allowsInfantsAsHost&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;childrenNotAllowedDetails&gt;</span>A lot of sharp objects in the house<span class="nt">&lt;/childrenNotAllowDetails&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;allowsSmokingAsHost&gt;</span>false<span class="nt">&lt;/allowsSmokingAsHost&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;allowsPetsAsHost&gt;</span>false<span class="nt">&lt;/allowsPetsAsHost&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;allowsEventsAsHost&gt;</span>true<span class="nt">&lt;/allowsEventsAsHost&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/guestControls&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: XML Pricing
sections.content:
<p>This section provides a breakdown of the elements included in the <code>pricing</code>  node</p>
<blockquote>The price displayed on a listing when no dates are selected is the lowest price within the next 30 available days.</blockquote>

sections.name: pricing
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements-11">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>currency</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><b><i>required</i> </b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The listing's pricing currency, such as USD and CAD. Must be a <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#supported-currencies">supported currency.</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>defaultDailyPrice</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Base listing price in listing currency when no pricing rules or custom daily pricing are in force. This is the price the guests see on the listing page when no dates are selected. Must be between 10 USD and 25000 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>defaultWeekendPrice</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Base weekend price (applied on weekends, Friday and Saturday nights) . Must be between 10 USD and 25000 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>guestsIncluded</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional, default is <code>personCapacity</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Beyond this number, any more guests are charged <code>extraPersonPrice</code> . If present must be from <code>1</code> to <code>100</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>extraPersonPrice</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Price for each additional person beyond <code>guestsIncluded</code>. Must range from 5 USD to 300 USD per person.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>monthlyPriceFactor</code> <br> <i>double</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If set, multiply the price by this factor for trips of at least 28 days.  Range from <code>0</code> to <code>1</code>. For example, <code>0.7</code> means 30% off. Note that this is treated as an <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#pricingrule">LOS pricing rule</a>, so be careful to avoid conflicts.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>weeklyPriceFactor</code> <br> <i>double</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If set, multiply the price by this factor for trips between 7 and 28 days.  Range from <code>0</code> to <code>1</code>. For example, <code>0.7</code> means 30% off. Must be greater than <code>montlyPriceFactor</code>. Note that this is treated as an <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#pricingrule">LOS pricing rule</a>, so be careful to avoid conflicts.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>cleaningFee</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Cleaning fee. Range from 5 USD to 600 USD plus 25% of daily price (this must also be satisfied for any custom daily price). To remove a cleaning fee, set the value to 0.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>securityDeposit</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Security deposit per trip. Range from 100 USD to  5000 USD.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>defaultPricingRules</code><br><i>array of pricingRule</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Pricing rules (e.g. length-of-stay discount) that apply to the listing when seasonal pricing rules are not in force. If present, must contain from 1 to 30 rules.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>seasonalPricingGroups</code><br><i>array of seasonalPricingGroup</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Seasonal groups that contain pricing rules for the chosen time periods. You can create up to 100 Seasonal Pricing Groups, each containing up to 30 Pricing Rule objects. Overlapping seasonal adjustment rules are not allowed. To reset all seasonal pricing you <b>MUST</b> pass an empty node.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>customPricing</code> <br> <i>array of customDailyPricing</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>An array of nodes of <code>customDailyPricing</code> type. Min 1 node, max 250 nodes.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>passThroughFees</code><br><i>passThroughFees</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A set of fees that will apply to guest reservations on top of the stay price.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-11">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;pricing&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;currency&gt;</span>USD<span class="nt">&lt;/currency&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;defaultDailyPrice&gt;</span>150<span class="nt">&lt;/defaultDailyPrice&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;defaultWeekendPrice&gt;</span>180<span class="nt">&lt;/defaultWeekendPrice&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;guestsIncluded&gt;</span>12<span class="nt">&lt;/guestsIncluded&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;extraPersonPrice&gt;</span>15<span class="nt">&lt;/extraPersonPrice&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;monthlyPriceFactor&gt;</span>0.7<span class="nt">&lt;/monthlyPriceFactor&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;weeklyPriceFactor&gt;</span>0.9<span class="nt">&lt;/weeklyPriceFactor&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;cleaningFee&gt;</span>100<span class="nt">&lt;/cleaningFee&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;securityDeposit&gt;</span>150<span class="nt">&lt;/securityDeposit&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;defaultPricingRules&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;pricingRule&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/pricingRule&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/defaultPricingRules&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;seasonalPricingGroups&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;seasonalPricingGroup&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/seasonalPricingGroup&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/seasonalPricingGroups&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;customPricing&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;customDailyPricing&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/customDailyPricing&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;customDailyPricing&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/customDailyPricing&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/customPricing&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;passThroughFees&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/passThroughFees&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/pricing&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: pricingRule
sections.content:
<p>With Pricing Rules, you can set the following types of pricing adjustment or discount rules to be applied to your highest precedence daily rate (i.e rules are applied <b>on top of custom pricing</b>). Note that an “adjustment” can be either positive or negative.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><b>Seasonal adjustment</b> - A percentage or fixed dollar amount applied to the base nightly price (daily or custom price). For example, if they book during Christmas week when demand is high, they have to pay 40 USD more per night. This new nightly price is referred to as the <i><b>adjusted seasonal price.</b></i></span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Length-of-stay adjustment </b>- A percentage or fixed dollar amount applied to the adjusted seasonal price if they stay a specified length of time. <b>Overwrites weekly/monthly discounts</b>. For example, if they stay more than 20 nights, they pay 10% more. If the adjusted seasonal price is $100, then the new nightly price is $100.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Last-minute discount </b>- Modify the adjusted seasonal price  by a percentage or fixed dollar amount if guests book within a specified date/time of their stay. For example, if they book a week or less before their stay, they get a 10% nightly discount. If the adjusted seasonal price is $100, then the new nightly price is $90.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Booking-ahead discount </b>- Deduct a percentage or fixed dollar amount from the adjusted seasonal price if they book before a specified date/time before their stay. For example, if they book 60 days  before their stay, they get a $20 nightly discount. If the adjusted seasonal price is $100, then the new nightly price is $80. </span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<blockquote>If you use both monthly/weekly price factors and LOS pricing rules, note that we treat monthly and weekly price factors as default LOS rules. Thus, either use only one of these or be careful to avoid unexpected conflicts.</blockquote>
<blockquote>For examples and more details on how pricing rules are applied see the appendix section about <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#applying-pricing-rules">Applying Pricing Rules</a>.</blockquote>
<h5 id="elements-12">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>type</code><br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>One of:<br><code>"SEASONAL_ADJUSTMENT"</code>,  <code>"STAYED_AT_LEAST_X_DAYS"</code>,  <code>"BOOKED_WITHIN_AT_MOST_X_DAYS"</code>,  <code>"BOOKED_BEYOND_AT_LEAST_X_DAYS"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>threshold</code><br><i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Specifies the X value in the rules, irrelevant for seasonal adjustments. Must be non-negative. Must be larger than 28 for <code>"BOOKED_BEYOND_AT_LEAST_X_DAYS"</code>, and smaller than 28 for <code>"BOOKED_WITHIN_AT_MOST_X_DAYS"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>priceChange</code><br><i>priceChange</i><br><b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Specific how the price should change given the condition above is satisfied. See <code>priceChange</code> type below</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>priceChange</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>amount</code><br><i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><br>Price change amount</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>type</code><br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Either <code>PERCENT</code> or <code>ABSOLUTE</code> (fixed dollar amount).</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-12">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;pricingRule&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>STAYED_AT_LEAST_X_DAYS<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;threshold&gt;</span>10<span class="nt">&lt;/threshold&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;priceChange&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;amount&gt;</span>-20<span class="nt">&lt;/amount&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>ABSOLUTE<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/priceChange&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/pricingRule&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: seasonalPricingGroup
sections.content:
<p>You can use a<b> </b>Seasonal Pricing Group<b> </b>to apply pricing rules to a specific date period. During those periods, <b>seasonal pricing rules override default pricing rules of the SAME TYPE for the date ranges applied.</b></p>
<p>For example, let's say you have default weekly and monthly Length-of-Stay discounts and a default 10% Seasonal Adjustment. If you then choose to set a weekly Length-of-Stay discount in <code>seasonalPricingGroup</code> for October, then the default weekly and monthly length-of-stay discounts no longer apply, though the default Seasonal Adjustment does.</p>
<blockquote>To clear all the rule groups, update <code>seasonalPricingGroups</code> as an empty node <code>&lt;seasonalPricingGroups /&gt;</code>
</blockquote>
<h5 id="elements-13">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>dateRange</code><br><i>dateRange</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Date range object</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>pricingRules</code><br><i>array of pricingRule</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A group of pricing rules to apply to this range. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#pricingrule">pricingRule</a>. Up to 30 rules allowed.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>dateRange</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>startDate</code> <br> <i>date</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Start date in the <code>YYYY-MM-DD</code> format</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>endDate</code> <br> <i>date</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>End date in the <code>YYYY-MM-DD</code> format (the date is inclusive)</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-13">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;seasonalPricingGroup&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;dateRange&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;startDate&gt;</span>2017-04-01<span class="nt">&lt;/startDate&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;endDate&gt;</span>2017-07-01<span class="nt">&lt;/endDate&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/dateRange&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;pricingRules&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;pricingRule&gt;</span>
         <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>SEASONAL_ADJUSTMENT<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
         <span class="nt">&lt;priceChange&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;amount&gt;</span>20<span class="nt">&lt;/amount&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>PERCENT<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
         <span class="nt">&lt;/priceChange&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;/pricingRule&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;pricingRule&gt;</span>
         <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>BOOKED_BEYOND_AT_LEAST_X_DAYS<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
         <span class="nt">&lt;threshold&gt;</span>60<span class="nt">&lt;/threshold&gt;</span>
         <span class="nt">&lt;priceChange&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;amount&gt;</span>-5<span class="nt">&lt;/amount&gt;</span>
            <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>PERCENT<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
         <span class="nt">&lt;/priceChange&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;/pricingRule&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/pricingRules&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/seasonalPricingGroup&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: customDailyPricing
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements-14">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>dateRange</code> <br> <i>object</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Daily pricing start and end dates. See dateRange type.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>dailyPrices</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Comma separated daily prices for the period. Use <code>D</code> to use the default pricing, or a number to set the price for the day. Currently we only support 365 days of custom daily price setting. For price after 1 year, the default daily price or default weekend price is used.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-14">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;customDailyPricing&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;dateRange&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;startDate&gt;</span>2016-12-01<span class="nt">&lt;/startDate&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;endDate&gt;</span>2016-12-04<span class="nt">&lt;/endDate&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/dateRange&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;dailyPrices&gt;</span>444,555,666,777<span class="nt">&lt;/dailyPrices&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/customDailyPricing&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: passThroughFees
sections.content:
<p>Partners can provide <b>Standard fees</b> that will apply to reservations on top of the stay price. Fees can be specified as either percentage of the nightly price (after all adjustments) or a flat amount per reservation. </p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Fee Name</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Guest Display (where each fee is mapped)</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span>Resort fee</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Nightly price</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span>Community Fee</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Nightly price</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span>Management fee</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Nightly price</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span>Linen fee</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Cleaning fee</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p>In order to streamline the guest experience, the fees will not be shown as separate line items. Our system performs the calculation for the fee and  they are included in the nightly rate or cleaning fee when shown to guests. However,  Airbnb provide a detailed breakdown of these fees in reservation webhook notifications (see <a href="https://admin-next.airbnb.com/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#reservation-object">Reservation Object</a>), so Airbnb transactions will be more consistent with a property manager's existing accounting structure. Airbnb currently supports 4 types of fees.</p>
<p>Fees are subject to the same taxes/fees and cancellation/refund policies as the price type they're mapped to. All applicable taxes and the Airbnb host and guest fees will be applied. Fees will inherit the cancellation/refund policy of the price type they're mapped to. For example, cleaning fees are refunded if a guest cancels before the reservation starts; this will apply to the linen fee as well. Similarly, if a strict cancellation policy refunds 50% of the stay price, we will refund 50% of any resort fees charged. </p>
<blockquote>If you have previously been manually customizing the base price to include any of the above fee types, remember to reduce the base price by the relevant amount after developing to standard fees. This ensures that you are not “double-charging” the fee.</blockquote>
<h5 id="elements-15">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>resortFee</code> <br> <i>StandardFee</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Resort fee. Mapped to the stay price.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>managementFee</code> <br> <i>StandardFee</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Management fee. Mapped to the stay price.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>communityFee</code> <br> <i>StandardFee</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Community fee. Mapped to the stay price.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>linenFee</code> <br> <i>StandardFee</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Linen fee. Mapped to the cleaning fee.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>standardFee</b></p>
<p>You can describe a fee using either the percent value or the amount value in micros value. Note that you can only use one of the two following fields, not both.</p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>percent</code> <br> <i>float</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Percentage, to be calculated off of the nightly rate after pricing rule adjustments. Value must be between <code>0</code> and <code>100</code> (inclusive). Linen fees cannot be used as percents and must be passed as amountMicros.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>amountMicros</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Flat amount, in micros of the listing currency unit, to be charged per reservation. For example, to set an amount of $15 for a USD listing, set this field as 15,000,000.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-15">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;passThroughFees&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;resortFee&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;percent&gt;</span>3.1<span class="nt">&lt;/percent&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/resortFee&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;managementFee&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;percent&gt;</span>9.5<span class="nt">&lt;/percent&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/managementFee&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;communityFee&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;amountMicros&gt;</span>10000000<span class="nt">&lt;/amountMicros&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/communityFee&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;linenFee&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;amountMicros&gt;</span>10000000<span class="nt">&lt;/amountMicros&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/linenFee&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/passThroughFees&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: XML Availability
sections.content: <p>This section provides a breakdown of the elements included in the <code>availability</code>  node</p>

sections.name: availability
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements-16">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>defaultAvailable</code> <br> <i>boolean</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Is the listing available by default? (Currently only <code>true</code> is supported.).</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>totalInventoryCount</code> <br><i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><b>Room Type inventory only.<i> </i></b>The total amount of rooms for current listing. Valid value: &gt;0. For more information about representative inventory, see the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#room-type-inventory">Room Type Inventory</a> section of the Appendix.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>bookingLeadTime</code> <br> <i>object</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Permits the host to set how much advance notice they need for a reservation. Instant Booking hosts can allow guests to send reservation requests for shorter notice. If not set, default is 48 hours notice allowing request to book.<br>See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#bookingleadtime">bookingLeadTime</a> type.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>maxDaysNotice</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional, default is unlimited</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Maximum booking window. How far from the current date can a guest make a booking. If not set, the default behavior is unlimited. If set, supported values are <code>90</code>, <code>180</code>, and <code>365</code>. <br><br><code>0</code> blocks all days in the future.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>turnOverDays</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional, default is 0</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>How many days required between bookings. Supported values are <code>0</code>, <code>1</code>, and <code>2</code>. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>defaultMinNights</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional, default is 1</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Minimum nights for each stay. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>defaultMaxNights</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional, default is unlimited</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Maximum nights for each stay. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>defaultWeekendMinNights</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Minimum night requirement for weekend reservations.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>defaultAvailabilityRules</code><br><i>array of availabilityRule</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Default availability rules for the listing. If applicable, these rules overwrite other default fields such as <code>defaultMinNights</code> and <code>defaultWeekendMinNights</code>. If present, must contain from 1 to 30 nodes. </span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>seasonalAvailabilityGroups</code><br><i>array of seasonalAvailabilityGroup</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Set specific availability rules for specific time periods. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#seasonalavailabilitygroup">seasonalAvailabilityGroup</a> type. Can contain up to 100 nodes. Overlapping dates are not allowed. To reset all seasonal availability you <b>MUST</b> pass an empty node.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>availabilityPeriods</code> <br> <i>array of availabilityPeriod</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use this to set availability on a daily basis. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#availabilityperiod">availabilityPeriod</a> type. If present, must contain between 1 and 250 nodes</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-16">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;availability&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;defaultAvailable&gt;</span>true<span class="nt">&lt;/defaultAvailable&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;bookingLeadTime&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/bookingLeadTime&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;maxDaysNotice&gt;</span>365<span class="nt">&lt;/maxDaysNotice&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;turnoverDays&gt;</span>1<span class="nt">&lt;/turnoverDays&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;defaultMinNights&gt;</span>2<span class="nt">&lt;/defaultMinNights&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;defaultMaxNights&gt;</span>90<span class="nt">&lt;/defaultMaxNights&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;defaultWeekendMinNights&gt;</span>3<span class="nt">&lt;/defaultWeekendMinNights&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;defaultAvailabilityRules&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRule&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRule&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/defaultAvailabilityRules&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;seasonalAvailabilityGroups&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;seasonalAvailabilityGroup&gt;</span>....<span class="nt">&lt;/seasonalAvailabilityGroup&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/seasonalAvailabilityGroups&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;availabilityPeriods&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;availabilityPeriod&gt;</span>....<span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityPeriod&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityPeriods&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/availability&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: bookingLeadTime
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements-17">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>hours</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The number of hours (before midnight of the night being booked) required for minimum notice before a booking. Allowed values are <code>0</code> - <code>24</code>, <code>48</code>, <code>72</code>, <code>168</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>allowRequestToBook</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Do you allow reservation requests for bookings with shorter notice? <code>0</code> for no and <code>1</code> for yes.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-17">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;bookingLeadTime&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;hours&gt;</span>72<span class="nt">&lt;/hours&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;allowRequestToBook&gt;</span>0<span class="nt">&lt;/allowRequestToBook&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/bookingLeadTime&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: availabilityRule
sections.content:
<p>We support the following types of availability rules: </p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Days of the week (Mon-Sun) when guests cannot check-in </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Days of the week (Mon-Sun) when guests cannot check-out</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>For each day of the week (Mon-Sun), the maximum nights guests can stay if they check-in on that day. <b>Note that this rule is only available for seasonal rule groups, not default availability rules.</b></span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>For each day of the week (Mon-Sun), the minimum nights guest have to stay if they check-in on that day</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<blockquote>
<a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#availabilityperiod">Custom daily changeover values</a> marking the dates as unavailable for checkin/checkout overwrite default/seasonal availability rules for checkin and checkout, if the latter mark days as available. <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#availabilityperiod">Custom daily changeover values</a>  marking the dates as available for checkin/checkout don't overwrite seasonal/default availability rules if the latter mark days as unavailable.</blockquote>
<blockquote>For more details on how availability rules are applied see the appendix section about <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#applying-availability-rules">Applying Availability Rules</a>.</blockquote>
<h5 id="elements-18">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>type</code><br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>One of:<br><code>"MIN_NIGHTS"</code>,  <code>"MAX_NIGHTS"</code>, <code>"CLOSED_FOR_CHECKIN"</code>, <code>"CLOSED_FOR_CHECKOUT"</code><br></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>value</code><br><i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Specifies the number of nights for min and max nights rules. Omit for other rules.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>daysOfWeek</code><br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Comma-separated days of the week that this rule applies to. Use <code>"MONDAY"</code>, <code>"TUESDAY"</code>, <code>"WEDNESDAY"</code>, <code>"THURSDAY"</code>, <code>"FRIDAY"</code>, <code>"SATURDAY"</code>, or <code>"SUNDAY".</code> For the min/max nights rule types, you can use <code>"UNSPECIFIED"</code>  to represent the days that you haven't specified this rule for. In order to specify min/max nights rules, your nodes <b>must</b> cumulatively cover <b>all days of the week</b> or have one node that includes <code>"UNSPECIFIED"</code>. Please note that <code>"UNSPECIFIED"</code> is not supported for <code>"CLOSED_FOR_CHECKOUT"</code> and <code>"CLOSED_FOR_CHECKIN".</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-18">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRule&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>MIN_NIGHTS<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;value&gt;</span>3<span class="nt">&lt;/value&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;daysOfWeek&gt;</span>SUNDAY,MONDAY,FRIDAY<span class="nt">&lt;/daysOfWeek&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRule&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRule&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>MIN_NIGHTS<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;value&gt;</span>7<span class="nt">&lt;/value&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;daysOfWeek&gt;</span>UNSPECIFIED<span class="nt">&lt;/daysOfWeek&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRule&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: seasonalAvailabilityGroup
sections.content:
<p>You can use a<b> </b>Seasonal Availability Group<b> </b>to apply availability rules to a specific date period. During those periods, <b>seasonal availability rules override default availability rules of the SAME TYPE.</b> </p>
<blockquote>
<b>NOTE</b>: To clear all the rules, update <code>seasonalAvailabilityGroups</code> as an empty node <code>&lt;<code>seasonalAvailabilityGroups</code> /&gt;</code>
</blockquote>
<h5 id="elements-19">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>dateRange</code><br><i>object</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Date range object</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>availabilityRules</code><br><i>array of availabilityRule</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>An array of availability rules to apply. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#availabilityrule">availabilityRule</a> type. Up to 30 rules allowed.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>dateRange</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>startDate</code> <br> <i>date</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Start date in the <code>YYYY-MM-DD</code> format</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>endDate</code> <br> <i>date</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>End date in the <code>YYYY-MM-DD</code> format (the date is inclusive)</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-19">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;seasonalAvailabilityGroup&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;dateRange&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;startDate&gt;</span>2017-10-02<span class="nt">&lt;/startDate&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;endDate&gt;</span>2017-12-21<span class="nt">&lt;/endDate&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/dateRange&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRules&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRule&gt;</span>
         <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>MIN_NIGHTS<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
         <span class="nt">&lt;value&gt;</span>4<span class="nt">&lt;/value&gt;</span>
         <span class="nt">&lt;daysOfWeek&gt;</span>UNSPECIFIED<span class="nt">&lt;/daysOfWeek&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRule&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRule&gt;</span>
         <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>MAX_NIGHTS<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
         <span class="nt">&lt;value&gt;</span>10<span class="nt">&lt;/value&gt;</span>
         <span class="nt">&lt;daysOfWeek&gt;</span>UNSPECIFIED<span class="nt">&lt;/daysOfWeek&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRule&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRule&gt;</span>
         <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>CLOSED_FOR_CHECKOUT<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
         <span class="nt">&lt;daysOfWeek&gt;</span>FRIDAY<span class="nt">&lt;/daysOfWeek&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRule&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRules&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/seasonalAvailabilityGroup&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: availabilityPeriod
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements-20">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>dateRange</code> <br> <i>object</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Date range of the availability period</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>periodMinNights</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The minimum night requirement for the period. Do not pass this if you are using Seasonal <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#availabilityrule">Min Nights rules</a>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>dailyAvailability</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Comma separated availabilities for each days of the period.  <code>D</code> is default (determined by period default or the listing default), <code>A</code> is available, and <code>U</code> is unavailable. Please be cautious, <code>A</code> will explicitly set availability to true and override basic availability rules (eg. <code>bookingLeadTime</code> and <code>maxDaysNotice</code>) on the given date. Pass <code>D</code> if you want to avoid overriding.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>dailyAvailableCount</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><b>Room Type inventory only.<i> </i></b>Comma separated non-negative integers for each day of the period. The integers in &lt;dailyAvailableCount&gt; node must be mapped to the dates in &lt;dateRange&gt; node, one for each date, in the same order. For more information about representative inventory, see the <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#room-type-inventory">Room Type Inventory section</a> of the Appendix.<br>This value is not automatically incremented or decremented when a reservation is made. The maximum count is 500.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>dailyChangeOver</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Comma separated change over settings for each day of the period. <code>D</code> is default (can check in and checkout), <code>I</code> is can check in only, <code>O</code> is can check out only, and <code>N</code> is no check in or checkout.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>dateRange</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>startDate</code> <br> <i>date</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Start date in the <code>YYYY-MM-DD</code> format</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>endDate</code> <br> <i>date</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>End date in the <code>YYYY-MM-DD</code> format (the date is inclusive)</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p>Detailed requirements for <code>dailyAvailableCount</code>:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><annotation>It is strongly recommended that you pass in <annotation>a <code>totalInventoryCount</code>  on the <code>availability</code> node when passing in <annotation><code>dailyAvailableCount</code></annotation></annotation>. The values in <code><code>dailyAvailableCount</code></code> must not exceed the <code>totalInventoryCount</code>.</annotation></span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Although both <code>dailyAvailabilityCount</code> and <code>dailyAvailability</code> are optional, you must pass in at least one of them in order for your listing to be imported.  We suggest you always pass in both fields to get best control of your listing. The table below shows the requirements for valid  <code>dailyAvailability</code> and  <code>dailyAvailableCount</code> values:</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Possible values for dailyAvailability</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Allowed values for dailyAvailableCount</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Notes</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"A"</code> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>&gt;0, &lt;=500</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>- On listing's calendar, this date will be marked as "<i>available</i>"; all availability rules will be overwritten.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"U"</code> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>&gt;=0</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>- On listing's calendar, this date will be marked as "<i>unavailable</i>"; all availability rules will be overwritten.<br>- A positive <i>dailyAvailableCount</i> can be used for stop sale.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>"D"</code> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>&gt;=0</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>- If <i>dailyAvailableCount</i> = 0, this date will be blocked on calendar as "<i>unavailable</i>".<br>- If <i>dailyAvailableCount</i> &gt; 0, the availability of this date will conform to the availability rules.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-20">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;availabilityPeriod&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;dateRange&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;startDate&gt;</span>2015-12-20<span class="nt">&lt;/startDate&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;endDate&gt;</span>2015-12-31<span class="nt">&lt;/endDate&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;/dateRange&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;periodMinNights&gt;</span>3<span class="nt">&lt;/periodMinNights&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;dailyAvailability&gt;</span>D,A,U,D,A,A,A,A,A,A,A,D<span class="nt">&lt;/dailyAvailability&gt;</span>
   <span class="nt">&lt;dailyChangeOver&gt;</span>D,D,I,I,I,I,N,N,O,O,O,D<span class="nt">&lt;/dailyChangeOver&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityPeriod&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: XML LOS Records
sections.content:
<p>As an alternative to seasonal pricing and availability rule groups, you can set a listing's pricing and availability for specified date/time periods by using a list of length-of-stay records (LOS records). Using LOS records allows for more flexibility in setting pricing and availability for specific dates and stays than seasonal rule groups.</p>
<blockquote>For more details on how applying LOS records interacts with other pricing and availability rules, see the appendix section about <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#applying-los-records">Applying LOS Records</a>.</blockquote>

sections.name: losRecords
sections.content:
<h5 id="elements-21">Elements</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>r</code><br><i>string</i><br><b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A comma separated string representing the LOS prices for a certain check in date and a certain max guest number. See the LOS Record Data Format section for more details. There must be at least 1 and up to 8800 <code>r</code> elements in a <code>losRecords</code> node.</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-21">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;losRecords&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;r&gt;</span>2019-01-01,1,100,210,0,390,550,580,0,820<span class="nt">&lt;/r&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;r&gt;</span>2019-01-01,2,200,410,0,690,1050,1080,0,1620<span class="nt">&lt;/r&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;r&gt;</span>2019-01-01,4,400,810,0,1290,1550,1580,0,1820<span class="nt">&lt;/r&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;r&gt;</span>2019-01-01,6,600,1620,2350,3500,0,4230,4750,5240<span class="nt">&lt;/r&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;r&gt;</span>2019-01-02,1,100,210,0,390,550,580,0,820<span class="nt">&lt;/r&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/losRecords&gt;</span></code></pre>
<blockquote>When applying LOS records, you must also provide a base nightly rate for the listing using the Pricing API. This value will only be used to display the price when guests search without dates and does not impact availability.</blockquote>

sections.name: LOS Record Data Format
sections.content:
<p>The general format for each string in the <code>los_records</code> array is:</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>&lt;checkin date&gt;,&lt;max guest number&gt;,&lt;1 night price&gt;,&lt;2 nights price&gt;,&lt;3 nights price&gt;,...</code></pre>
<h5 id="example-22">Example</h5>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>2019-01-01,1,100,210,0,390,550,580,0,820
</code></pre>
<p>If 1 guest checks in on 2019-01-01, the price for staying 1 night would be 100, the price for 2 nights would be 210, and staying 3 nights is not available.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>2019-01-01,2,200,410,0,690,1050,1080,0,1620</code></pre>
<p>Same as above, but this record indicates the prices for 2 guests checking in on 2019-01-01.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>2019-01-01,4,400,810,0,1290,1550,1580,0,1820</code></pre>
<p>Same as above, but this record indicates the prices for &gt;2 and &lt;=4 guests.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>2019-01-01,5,0
</code></pre>
<p>The listing is not available for 5 guests if check-in date is 2019-01-01.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>2019-01-01,6,600,1620,2350,3500,0,4230,4750,5240
</code></pre>
<p>Prices for 6 guests if check-in date is 2019-01-01.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>2019-01-02,1,100,210,0,390,550,580,0,820
</code></pre>
<p>Prices for 1 guest if check-in date is 2019-01-02.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>2019-01-02,4,300,610,0,990,1550,1580,0,2020</code></pre>
<p>Prices for &gt;1 and &lt;=4 guests if check-in date is 2019-01-02.</p>
<p>Note that:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>The check-in date should be within the next 18 months (550 days). If the LOS records do not contain prices for certain check-in dates, we will mark these dates as not available for check-in.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>The guest number is the <b>max</b> guest number (please see the example on third row). This number should be an integer &gt;=1 and &lt;=16, as bookings on Airbnb usually do not differentiate the prices beyond 16 guests.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>For any combination of check-in date and max guest number, we support up to 28 days' length-of-stay prices. This is a maximum cap; you can send prices for &gt;=1 and &lt;=28 nights. If the LOS records do not contain prices for certain length-of-stays, we will mark these dates as not available for check-in. For stays longer than 28 days, we will mark days as unavailable.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>If the LOS records do not contain data for certain dates, either as check-in dates or as part of a stay, we will mark these dates as unavailable.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Each price should be an integer. If the listing is not available for a particular length-of-stay, the price should be set to 0.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.content:

  <span class="nt">&lt;/basicDetails&gt;</span>

        <span class="nt">&lt;/dateRange&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;dailyPrices&gt;</span>111,222,333<span class="nt">&lt;/dailyPrices&gt;</span>
      <span class="nt">&lt;/customDailyPricing&gt;</span>

        <span class="nt">&lt;dateRange&gt;</span>
          <span class="nt">&lt;startDate&gt;</span>2018-03-01<span class="nt">&lt;/startDate&gt;</span>
