sections.name: Appendix
Room Type Inventory
sections.content:
<p>Some properties might have multiple rooms for a certain room type. For these listings, partners can provide Airbnb with a listing's <b>total inventory count</b>, <b>daily</b> <b>available count </b>for specific dates, as well as <b>property external id</b>. Note that the property type <code>house</code> is not eligible for Room Type Inventory.</p>
<p><b>Representative Inventory Attributes:</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>description</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>required</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>totalInventoryCount</code> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Total number of rooms for a room type. The maximum count is 500.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>No, but strongly recommended if data is available</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>dailyAvailableCount</code> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Total number of rooms per day. The maximum count is 500.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Yes</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>propertyExternalId</code> </span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>ID of the hotel property. This allows Airbnb to group different room types of a same property together.</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Yes</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-schema-set-property-external-id">Example Schema - set property external id</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;listing&gt;</span>
  ...
  <span class="nt">&lt;propertyExternalId&gt;</span>Hotel1234<span class="nt">&lt;/propertyExternalId&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/listing&gt;</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-schema-set-total-inventory-count">Example Schema - set total inventory count</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;availability&gt;</span>
  ...
  <span class="nt">&lt;totalInventoryCount&gt;</span>11<span class="nt">&lt;/totalInventoryCount&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/availability&gt;</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-schema-set-daily-available-count">Example schema - set daily available count</h5>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;availabilityPeriods&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;availabilityPeriod&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;dateRange&gt;</span>
       <span class="nt">&lt;startDate&gt;</span>2015-12-20<span class="nt">&lt;/startDate&gt;</span>
       <span class="nt">&lt;endDate&gt;</span>2015-12-31<span class="nt">&lt;/endDate&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/dateRange&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;dailyAvailablity&gt;</span>D,A,D,U,U....<span class="nt">&lt;/dailyAvailability&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;dailyAvailableCount&gt;</span>4,5,9,0,2....<span class="nt">&lt;/dailyAvailabilityCount&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;dailyChangeOver</span> <span class="err">required</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/dailyChangeOver&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityPeriod&gt;</span>
  ...
  <span class="nt">&lt;availabilityPeriod&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;dateRange&gt;</span>
       <span class="nt">&lt;startDate&gt;</span>2016-01-02<span class="nt">&lt;/startDate&gt;</span>
       <span class="nt">&lt;endDate&gt;</span>2016-01-03<span class="nt">&lt;/endDate&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/dateRange&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;dailyAvailability&gt;</span>D,A,D,U,U....<span class="nt">&lt;/dailyAvailability&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;dailyAvailableCount&gt;</span>4,7,10,0,2....<span class="nt">&lt;/dailyAvailabilityCount&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;dailyChangeOver</span> <span class="err">required</span><span class="nt">&gt;</span>...<span class="nt">&lt;/dailyChangeOver&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityPeriod&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityPeriods&gt;</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Applying Pricing Rules
sections.content:
<h5 id="setting-an-adjusted-seasonal-price">Setting an Adjusted Seasonal Price</h5>
<p>You can apply a percentage or fixed dollar amount change to the nightly price of highest precedence (base or custom) to get the nightly <i><b>adjusted seasonal price</b>. </i>This can add to, or subtract from, the base nightly price.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: This rule adjusts the base nightly price 20% higher. If the default nightly price is $100 USD, then the <b>adjusted seasonal price</b><i> </i>is $120 USD.</p>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;pricingRule&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>SEASONAL_ADJUSTMENT<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;priceChange&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;amount&gt;</span>20<span class="nt">&lt;/amount&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>PERCENT<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/priceChange&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/pricingRule&gt;</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="setting-a-length-of-stay-adjustment">Setting a Length-of-Stay Adjustment</h5>
<p>If a stay is  X days or more, you can increase or decrease the adjusted seasonal price a percentage or fixed dollar amount. This is similar to existing long-term adjustments applied to trips that are at least 7 days and 28 days respectively. This rule is applied to the longest day matched. This discount is shown to guests.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: This rule says this if the guest stays at least 3 nights, then they get a 20% nightly discount. If the adjusted seasonal price is $100 USD, then the new discounted price is $80 USD.</p>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;pricingRule&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>STAYED_AT_LEAST_X_DAYS<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;threshold&gt;</span>3<span class="nt">&lt;/threshold&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;priceChange&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;amount&gt;</span>-20<span class="nt">&lt;/amount&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>PERCENT<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/priceChange&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/pricingRule&gt;</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="setting-a-last-minute-discount">Setting a Last-Minute Discount</h5>
<p>You can offer percentage or fixed dollar amount discounts to trips that are booked X days or less before a stay. This discount is not shown to guests.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: If the guest books 3 days or less before their stay, this rule entitles them to a $20 nightly discount. If the adjusted seasonal price is $100 USD, then the new discounted price is $80 USD.</p>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;pricingRule&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>BOOKED_WITHIN_AT_MOST_X_DAYS<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;threshold&gt;</span>3<span class="nt">&lt;/threshold&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;priceChange&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;amount&gt;</span>-20<span class="nt">&lt;/amount&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>ABSOLUTE<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/priceChange&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/pricingRule&gt;</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="setting-a-booking-ahead-discount">Setting a Booking-Ahead Discount</h5>
<p>You can offer percentage or fixed dollar amount discounts to trips that are booked X days or more in advance. This discount is not shown to guests.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: If the guest books 60 nights or more in advance, this rule entitles them to  $20 per night discount. If the adjusted seasonal price is $120 USD, then the new discounted price is $100 USD.</p>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;pricingRule&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>BOOKED_BEYOND_AT_LEAST_X_DAYS<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;threshold&gt;</span>60<span class="nt">&lt;/threshold&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;priceChange&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;amount&gt;</span>-20<span class="nt">&lt;/amount&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>ABSOLUTE<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
  <span class="nt">&lt;/priceChange&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/pricingRule&gt;</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="calculating-the-final-price">Calculating the Final Price</h5>
<p><b>Adjusted seasonal price = </b>Seasonal price adjustment applied to base nightly price.</p>
<p><b>Final price</b> = Additional price adjustments applied to the adjusted seasonal price.</p>
<p>Suppose for a certain date range, the following pricing rules are created:</p>
<p><b>Base nightly price</b> = <b>$200</b></p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Seasonal adjusted discount = -10%,  nightly discount = -(200 * .10) = -20</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p><b>Adjusted s<b>easonal p</b>rice</b> = 200 - 20 = <b>$180</b></p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Long-term adjustment = -20, nightly discount = -20</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Last-minute discount = -2%,   nightly discount = -(180 * .02 ) = -3.6</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Booking-ahead discount = -2%,  nightly discount = -(180 * .02) = -3.6</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p><b>Final price  = </b>180 - 20 - 3.6 - 3.6<b> = $152.8</b></p>
<h5 id="staying-across-seasons">Staying Across Seasons</h5>
<p>Pricing rules are resolved on a per day basis. For a listing with base price $100, suppose there is 5% discount from 5/1 - 5/5, and $10 discount from 5/8 - 5/10. If the stay is from 5/1 - 5/10, it will get 5% off from 5/1 - 5/5, no discounts from 5/6 - 5/7, and $10 off for each day from 5/8 - 5/10. Thus, the total cost of the stay is <code>100 * (1-0.05) * 5 + 100 * 2 + (100 - 10) * 3 = 945</code>.</p>

sections.name: Applying Availability Rules
sections.content:
<h5 id="setting-when-guests-cannot-check-in">Setting When Guests Cannot Check-in</h5>
<p>You can set which days of the week guests cannot check-in.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: The following XML indicates that guests cannot check-in on Monday and Friday:</p>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRules&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRule&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>CLOSED_FOR_CHECKIN<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;daysOfWeek&gt;</span>MONDAY,FRIDAY<span class="nt">&lt;/daysOfWeek&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRule&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRules&gt;</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="setting-when-guests-cannot-check-out">Setting When Guests Cannot Check-out</h5>
<p>You can set which days of the week guests  cannot check-out.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: The following XML indicates that guests cannot check-out on Sunday:</p>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRules&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRule&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>CLOSED_FOR_CHECKOUT<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;daysOfWeek&gt;</span>SUNDAY<span class="nt">&lt;/daysOfWeek&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRule&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRules&gt;</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="setting-the-minimum-nights-guests-have-to-stay">Setting the Minimum Nights Guests Have to Stay </h5>
<p>You can set the minimum number of nights guests have to stay depending on which day of the week they check-in.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: The following XML sets two rules: </p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>If the guest checks-in on Sunday, Tuesday, Friday or Saturday, they have to stay for 5 nights minimum. </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>For all other days, the guest has to stay for 3 nights minimum. <code>UNSPECIFIED</code> indicates that this applies to all days that haven't had a value specifically set.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRules&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRule&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>MIN_NIGHTS<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;value&gt;</span>5<span class="nt">&lt;/value&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;daysOfWeek&gt;</span>SUNDAY,TUESDAY,FRIDAY,SATURDAY<span class="nt">&lt;/daysOfWeek&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRule&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRule&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>MIN_NIGHTS<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;value&gt;</span>3<span class="nt">&lt;/value&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;daysOfWeek&gt;</span>UNSPECIFIED<span class="nt">&lt;/daysOfWeek&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRule&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRules&gt;</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="setting-the-maximum-nights-guests-can-stay">Setting the Maximum Nights Guests can Stay </h5>
<p>You can set the maximum number of nights guests can stay depending on which day of the week they check-in.</p>
<p><b>Example</b>: The following XML sets two rules: </p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>If the guest checks-in on Monday, Wednesday or Thursday,  they can stay for 8 nights maximum. </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>For all other days, the guest can stay for 6 nights minimum. <code>UNSPECIFIED</code> indicates that this applies to all days that haven't had a value specifically set.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<pre class="highlight xml"><code><span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRules&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRule&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>MAX_NIGHTS<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;value&gt;</span>8<span class="nt">&lt;value&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;daysOfWeek&gt;</span>MONDAY, WEDNESDAY,THURSDAY<span class="nt">&lt;/daysOfWeek&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRule&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;availabilityRule&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;type&gt;</span>MAX_NIGHTS<span class="nt">&lt;/type&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;value&gt;</span>6<span class="nt">&lt;value&gt;</span>
        <span class="nt">&lt;daysOfWeek&gt;</span>UNSPECIFIED<span class="nt">&lt;/daysOfWeek&gt;</span>
    <span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRule&gt;</span>
<span class="nt">&lt;/availabilityRules&gt;</span></code></pre>
<p><b>NOTES</b></p>
<p>When you specify <code>MIN_NIGHTS</code> or <code>MAX_NIGHTS</code>, you must either:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Provide rules for all 7 days of week, or </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Provide at least one rule with <code>UNSPECIFIED</code> that sets a default for unspecified days</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Applying LOS Records
sections.content:
<h5 id="interaction-with-pricing-and-availability-apis">Interaction with Pricing and Availability APIs</h5>
<p>If you use LOS records to set a listing's price and availability, some of the parameters in the Pricing Settings API, Availability Rules API and Calendar Settings API must be omitted. The following sections indicate which parameters will no longer be supported, since you will consolidate pricing and availability features into LOS records instead of using other API calls.</p>
<p>Please make sure to omit the unused parameters in the API calls when updating listings that are using LOS records, otherwise errors might be raised. If you are managing listings that are not using LOS records, then those listings may continue using all existing pricing and availability rules.</p>
<p><b>Interaction with the Pricing Settings API</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Allowed while using LOS records</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_currency</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>default_daily_price</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>security_deposit</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>cleaning_fee</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>standard_fees</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>weekend_price</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>N</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>guests_included</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>N</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>price_per_extra_person</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>N</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>monthly_price_factor</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>N</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>weekly_price_factor</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>N</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>Interaction with the Availability Rules API</b></p>
<p>We will continue supporting all existing availability rules for listings using LOS records. </p>
<p>For any combination of [check-in date, guest number, length of stay], if the LOS record price is 0 then we will mark it as unavailable, and all the other Availability Rules will not be able to change it. However, if the LOS record shows this date as available, the other Availability Rules will be applied on top. This may add additional restrictions to the date and possibly render it unavailable for certain stays.</p>
<p>If a date is not included in any LOS record, either as a date available for check-in or as a date available for a stay, we will mark it as unavailable.</p>
<p><b>Interaction with the Calendars API and Calendar Batch Operations API</b></p>
<p> If using these endpoints to set availability on a daily basis, please make sure the daily availability is consistent with the  LOS records.</p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Allowed while using LOS records</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>daily_price</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>N</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>availability</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>available_count</code><br>(Calendar Batch Operations API only)</span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>min_nights</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>max_nights</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>closed_to_arrival</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>closed_to_departure</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>notes</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Y</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="interaction-with-nightly-prices-standard-fees-and-discounts">Interaction with Nightly Prices, Standard Fees and Discounts</h5>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Stay price adjustments for seasonal pricing, length of stay discounts, or any other price adjustment that are not supported by Seasonal Rule Groups can be incorporated into LOS records.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Standard fees should be sent separately so they can be itemized during the guest checkout flow. </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Discounts that need to be displayed separately to guests should be sent separately and will be applied on top of the LOS record prices.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Troubleshooting and Best Practices
Troubleshooting
sections.content:
<p>We send a daily email that notifies you if any listings have been taken down because of XML errors.  If you receive this email, please take action to resolve the error. Until you do, guests cannot book your listing.</p>
<p>First, you should look at the error information using the <code>.../listing_imports</code> API.</p>
<p><b>To retrieve error information:</b></p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Make an API call to retrieve your XML listing file. See<a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#retrieving-a-listing-import"> Retrieving a Listing Import</a></span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>In the response returned, check the <code>last_synchronization_error</code> field.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Best Practices
sections.content:
<p>For best results,  follow these practices:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><b>Test your end-to-end process</b> - Until you are  familiar with creating listings, set <code>published</code>  to <code>false</code>.  Once you are confident in your process and are ready for listings to be published, set this field to <code>true</code>. </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Synchronization frequency </b>- Use the synchronization frequency that your server can tolerate. <code>hourly</code> is recommended since your calendar and pricing is updated when a guest makes a booking request. There is no need to worry about the calendar being out-of-sync.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Immediate update - </b>To update the listing immediately after making changes to the XML listing file, you can set the <code>on_demand_synchronization_requested</code> flag to <code>true</code>. This feature should be used for debugging purposes only. Note that the sync this call initiates is run asynchronously and you won't see the results in the response. To get the results, you should then make a <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#retrieving-a-listing-import">Retrieving a Listing Import</a> call. With this call, you are limited to 120 on-demand requests per hour.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: FAQ
sections.content:
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><b>Am I allowed to reuse XML listing file URIs?<br></b>No, but you can always change the <code>document_uri</code> field, then update your XML listing file.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>If a XML listing file works correctly, then something changes and your crawl no longer correctly validates it, what happens to the listing?<br></b>We will retry up to three times to process the file. After three attempts, if the document still fails, the listing is taken offline. For more information, see <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listing-synchronization">Listing Synchronization Overview</a>.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><b>Why are some dates blocked when the XML says they are available?<br></b>If a host cancels or initiates alterations to a reservation’s start/end dates, the original dates stay blocked. A host can contact Airbnb to have the dates re-opened on the calendar. See <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/990/i-m-a-host--what-penalties-apply-if-i-need-to-cancel-a-reservation">here</a> for more information about penalties</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<h5 id="document-feedback">Document Feedback</h5>
<p>If you have any feedback on this document, please let us know. We are always interested in learning how we can improve the documentation and the reader's experience. <annotation>Please submit your feedback through the <a href="https://airbnb.secure.force.com/contactus/APICaseForm">API Technical Support Request Form</a>.</annotation></p>

children.name: Connecting to an Existing Listing via the API
Disconnecting the Host's Account from your Application

sections.name: Introduction
sections.content:
<p>Reservation Management is a mission-critical feature that allows you to confirm a new reservation in real-time, receive reservation changes, and retrieve reservation and payout details. For guests, this is a critical part of the booking flow, as Airbnb relies on you to make a final confirmation that a reservation is possible after collecting payment details from a potential guest.</p>
<p>Before proceeding, please confirm that you have OAuth and Webhook Notifications integrated and working properly. For information on setting this up, see the <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default">Getting Started</a><i> </i>guide.</p>

sections.name: Notes on Testing
Reservation Payments
sections.content:
<p>When testing reservations with your test application, you will still need to provide a real payment method which will be charged for the test reservation. To process a refund yourself, create test listings with a cancellation policy that offers a full refund and cancel the reservation within the grace period. For example, reservations for listings with a Flexible cancellation policy can be cancelled by the test guest account for a full refund up to 24 hours before the start date. Review the full list of <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/home/cancellation_policies">Airbnb cancellation policies</a>.</p>
<p>If you are unable to cancel for a full refund yourself, contact your Airbnb Partner Manager. They can cancel your test reservations manually upon request so that you receive a full refund. </p>

sections.name: Testing Checklist
sections.content:
<p>Before granting supply partners access to a production application, Airbnb will verify that they have completed the following reservation management checklist using their test application.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Complete 3 guest reservations for 3 different listings. Confirm receipt of the reservation acceptance notifications. If you are planning to allow Request to Book for late notice reservations (see Booking Lead Time) test that kind of reservation to see how the manual acceptance flow works.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Familiarize yourself with the Inquiry, Special Offer and Request to Book flows.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Complete 3 reservation alterations and confirm receipt of the appropriate notifications.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Cancel all reservations and confirm receipt of the cancellation notifications.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Reservation Overview
Booking Flow
Alteration flow
sections.content:
<p>Any reservation on Airbnb can be modified after the host and guest come to an agreement about the changes. We call this a Reservation Alteration. Both host and guest have an ability to initiate an alteration, which creates a pending alteration. </p>
<p>The guest has an ability to create to request changes to the dates and the number of guests (the price is auto-calculated using the current price for the dates outside of the existing reservation dates, the existing days price is preserved). The host can modify the dates, the number of guests, the price and the listing on the reservation.</p>
<p>The other party has the opportunity to accept or deny the alteration request. Upon accepts, the reservation details are modified.</p>

sections.name: Receiving Booking Updates
sections.content:
<p>You can receive updates for booking flow through webhook notifications. The types of notifications sent are:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management#special-offer-updates-notifications">Special Offer Notifications</a>, which include notifications about new or expired/withdrawn Special Offers or pre-approvals.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management#confirmed-reservation-notifications">Confirmed Reservation Notifications</a>, which include notifications about new confirmed reservations, confirmed alterations to existing reservations and cancellations of reservations.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management#pending-reservation-notifications">Pending Reservation Notifications</a>, which include notifications about new pending reservations that require a host's response and pending reservations that were not confirmed. See the <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management#request-to-book-flow">Request to Book flow</a> section for more information.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Confirming Pricing and Availability
sections.content:
<p>In order to ensure a listing has the latest pricing and availability information at the time of a new reservation or an alteration, Airbnb performs special checks during the booking flow. There are two options for performing these special pricing and availability checks:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management#confirming-reservations-using-the-xml-listing-file">Confirming Reservations using the XML listing file</a> (XML Listing API only). When a guest is checking out, Airbnb updates listing information from the XML listing file provided by your application to ensure the latest pricing and availability.  This option is automatically enabled for applications with the <code>vr_feed</code> (XML) scope. </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management#confirming-reservations-using-synchronous-availability-checks">Confirming Reservations in real time using the Synchronous Availability Checks</a>. Airbnb makes a set of calls to your application throughout the booking flow in order to ensure the listing is still available and its price is accurate. This option is automatically enabled and required for applications with the <code>vr</code> (REST) scope, and can be optionally enabled for applications with the <code>vr_feed</code> (XML) scope to make the booking flow more robust. </span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Confirming Reservations using the XML listing file
Confirming Reservations using Synchronous Availability Checks
Request to Book Flow
Synchronous Availability Checks
sections.content: <p>This section describes each of the synchronous availability checks in detail. For more information about how they are used in the booking flow see <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#confirming-reservations-using-synchronous-availability-checks">Confirming Reservations using Synchronous Availability Checks</a>.</p>

sections.name: Setup
sections.content:
<p>This functionality is enabled by the <code>reservations_web_hooks</code> scope (which is not related to the Reservation Webhook Notifications). This scope is automatically included in the <code>vr</code> (REST) scope. For applications with the <code>vr_feed</code> (XML) scope, this scope can be requested in your application's <a href="/partner/profile/scopes">Scopes page</a>. See <a href="https://admin-next.airbnb.com/partner/api-docs/get-started/default#application-scopes">Application Scopes</a> for more information on how to add scopes. Once a host is authorized with the <code>reservations_web_hooks</code> scope, the synchronous availability checks will automatically start occurring for all of the host's reservations.</p>
<p>Once the scope is granted, you should specify the reservation URL in your application's <a href="/partner/profile/settings">Settings page</a>. See <a href="https://airbnb.com/partner/api-docs/get-started/default#setting-up-webhook-calls">Setting up Webhook calls</a> for more details.</p>

sections.name: Check Availability Call
sections.content:
<pre class="highlight text"><code>GET [APPLICATION_RESERVATION_WEBHOOK_URL]</code></pre>
<p><annotation>Airbnb calls this endpoint right after the guest clicks to submit the booking on the checkout screen. If this call fails, the guest is informed that the dates for the reservation are no longer available.</annotation></p>
<blockquote>Do NOT use this call as a substitute for ensuring you are pushing real-time availability data to Airbnb. Your application could be suspended if it refuses a large number of reservation requests.</blockquote>
<h5 id="request-url-parameters">Request URL parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>action</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"check_availability"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>start_date</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The reservation start date, in <a href="https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html">ISO 8601</a> YYYY-MM-DD format.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>nights</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The number of nights in the reservation.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The Airbnb Listing ID.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response">Response</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>available</code> <br> <i>boolean</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Is the listing available for the reservation dates?</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>failure_code</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>This field is reserved for future use.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-request">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl <span class="s2">"http://54.201.222.204/airbnb/reservations?action=check_availability&amp;start_date=2015-06-01&amp;nights=2&amp;listing_id=166672"</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-success-response">Example Success Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">"available"</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">true</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-failure-response">Example Failure Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">"available"</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">"failure_code"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Make Reservation Call
sections.content:
<pre class="highlight text"><code>POST [APPLICATION_RESERVATION_WEBHOOK_URL]</code></pre>
<p>This check is called before any reservation is confirmed, i.e. when the guest has confirmed the reservation; their payment has been charged and the availability has been confirmed.</p>
<p>At this point, a reservation could fail for 2 reasons:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Your application rejects the reservation or the call times out.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>A system error, e.g. a server going down.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>For completeness and fault tolerance, you should wait for the <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management#confirmed-reservation-notifications">reservation acceptance confirmation notification</a> to block your calendar.</p>
<h5 id="request-body-parameters">Request Body Parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>confirmation_code</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The pending reservation's code (10 characters).</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>start_date</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The reservation start date, in<a href="https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html"> ISO 8601 </a>YYYY-MM-DD format.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>nights</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The number of nights in the reservation.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The Airbnb listing ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>number_of_guests</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The number of guests for the reservation.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>guest_details</code> <br><i>object</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The breakdown of the number of guests. A hash including <code>number_of_adults</code>, <code>number_of_children</code>, <code>number_of_infants</code>.  (Note: infants do not count towards the guest count on Airbnb).</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_base_price</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The reservation price.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>guest_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The Airbnb user ID of the guest booking this reservation.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>special_offer_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the special offer if the reservation was initiated through an offer. <code>null</code> otherwise</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-parameters">Response parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>succeed</code> <br> <i>boolean</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Whether the reservation was successfully created.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>failure_code</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If <code>succeed</code> is false, this field must have a value of <code>null</code>. It is reserved for future use.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-request-2">Example Request </h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X POST -d <span class="s1">'{
  "confirmation_code": "8QA2BP",
  "guest_details": {
    "localized_description": "1 guest",
    "number_of_adults": 1,
    "number_of_children": 0,
    "number_of_infants": 0
  },
  "guest_id": 1111,
  "listing_base_price": 477.0,
  "listing_id": 10816,
  "nights": 3,
  "number_of_guests": 1,
  "start_date": "2019-01-01"
  }'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'Content-Type: application/json'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  http://54.201.222.204/airbnb/reservations</code></pre>
<h5 id="example-success-response-2">Example success response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">"succeed"</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">true</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-failure-response-2">Example failure response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">"succeed"</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">"failure_code"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Update Reservation Call
sections.content:
<pre class="highlight text"><code>PUT [APPLICATION_RESERVATION_WEBHOOK_URL]/:confirmation_code</code></pre>
<p>Please get familiarized with <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#alteration-flow">the alteration flow</a> first. This call is made once both, the guest and the host, have accepted the alteration on Airbnb. At this point, you can check if the alteration is possible based on the most up-to-date calendar. Please note that you should only check the daily availability, as the host and guest could have agreed on a set of dates that doesn't match their standard availability rules, e.g. minimum length of stay rules.</p>
<p>If your application responds successfully, the alteration is applied. Otherwise, it is rejected and remains pending. The guest receives a message saying, “There was an error accepting the alteration request.”, while the host receive a message and an email saying “Please reach out to your Channel Manager”.</p>
<h5 id="request-body-parameters-2">Request body parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>start_date</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The reservation start date, in <a href="https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html">ISO 8601 </a>YYYY-MM-DD format.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>nights</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The number of nights in the reservation.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The Airbnb listing ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>number_of_guests</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The number of guests for the reservation.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_base_price</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Price of the reservation</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-parameters-2">Response parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>succeed</code> <br> <i>boolean</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Whether the reservation was successfully created.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>failure_code</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If <code>succeed</code> is <code>false</code>, this field must have a value of <code>null</code>. It is reserved for future use.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-request-3">Example request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X PUT -d <span class="s1">'{ "listing_id": 10816, "start_date": "2015-07-26", "nights": 3, "number_of_guests": 1, "listing_base_price": 477.0 }'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s1">'Content-Type: application/json'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
      http://54.201.222.204/airbnb/reservations/8QA2BP</code></pre>
<h5 id="example-success-response-3">Example Success Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">"succeed"</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">true</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-failure-response-3">Example failure Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">"succeed"</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">"failure_code"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Special Offers API
sections.content:
<p>The Special Offers API allows creating, updating, withdrawing and retrieving Special Offers and pre-approvals. More information on Special Offers and pre-approvals can be found in this <a href="https://www.airbnb.com/help/topic/1117/pre-approvals---special-offers">help topic</a>. </p>
<p> Note: A pre-approval is modeled as a Special Offer. The difference with a pre-approval is that its parameters are based on the inquiry sent by the guest.</p>
<blockquote>Using the Special Offers API requires also implementing the Messaging API, since Special Offers are presented to guests in message threads.</blockquote>

sections.name: Sending a Special Offer or pre-approval
sections.content:
<pre class="highlight text"><code>POST v2/special_offers</code></pre>
<p>Use this call to send a Special Offer or pre-approval. Special Offers and pre-approvals expire 24 hours after they are sent.</p>
<h5 id="request-body-parameters-3">Request Body Parameters</h5>
<p><b>For sending a pre-approval:</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>offer_type</code> <br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <code>"preapproval"</code> .</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>thread_id</code> <br><i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the thread the host would like to preapprove.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<p><b>For sending a Special Offer:</b></p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>offer_type</code> <br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <code>"special_offer"</code> .</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>thread_id</code> <br><i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the thread to send the special offer to.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code> <br><i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the listing to include in the offer. Can be different from the inquiry listing id.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>start_date</code> <br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The beginning date of the offer, in ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DD format.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>nights</code> <br><i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The number of nights included in the offer.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>guest_details</code> <br><i>object</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The breakdown of the number of guests. A hash including <code>number_of_adults</code>, <code>number_of_children</code>, <code>number_of_infants</code>.  (Note: infants do not count towards the guest count on Airbnb).</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>total_price</code> <br><i>integer</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The total price of the offer in listing's currency. Must be inclusive of all fees (the cleaning fee and standard fees).</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>block_instant_booking</code> <br><i>boolean</i><br><u>optional, default is <code>false</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>If true, the dates will be blocked on Airbnb so other guests can't book them until the offer expires.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-2">Response</h5>
<p>A <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#special-offer-object">Special Offer object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-4">Example Request</h5>
<p>Sending a pre-approval</p>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X POST <span class="se">\</span>
  https://api.airbnb.com/v2/special_offers/ <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'Content-Type: application/json'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key: 8j1516pdu8gljpd4ygmbsv3tg'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-OAuth-Token: cc850b0z54iuysjn1tkdlxfle'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -d <span class="s1">'{
  "offer_type": "preapproval",
  "thread_id": 476749234
}'</span></code></pre>
<p>Sending a Special Offer</p>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X POST <span class="se">\</span>
  https://api.airbnb.com/v2/special_offers/ <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'Content-Type: application/json'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key: 8j1516pdu8gljpd4ygmbsv3tg'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-OAuth-Token: cc850b0z54iuysjn1tkdlxfle'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -d <span class="s1">'{
  "offer_type": "special_offer",
  "thread_id": 476749234,
  "start_date": "2018-10-24",
  "nights": 3,
  "listing_id": 27110350,
  "guest_details": {
    "number_of_adults": 1,
    "number_of_children": 1,
    "number_of_infants": 0
  },
  "total_price": 300,
  "native_currency":"USD"
}'</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"special_offer"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"block_instant_booking"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"created_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2018-10-11T10:19:38Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"expires_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2018-10-12T10:19:38Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"guest_details"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"number_of_adults"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"number_of_children"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"number_of_infants"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">134665650</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"is_active"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">true</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">27110350</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"offer_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"preapproval"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"rescinded_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"start_date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2018-10-24"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"thread_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">476749234</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"total_price"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">300</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"metadata"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Retrieving a Special Offer or pre-approval
sections.content:
<p>This API lets you retrieve a Special Offer or pre-approval using the id.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>GET /v2/special_offers/:special_offer_id</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-id">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>special_offer_id</code> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the Special Offer or pre-approval to retrieve.</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-3">Response</h5>
<p>A <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#special-offer-object">Special Offer object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-5">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X GET <span class="se">\</span>
  https://api.airbnb.com/v2/special_offers/134665650 <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key: 8j1516pdu8gljpd4ygmbsv3tg'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-OAuth-Token: cc850b0z54iuysjn1tkdlxfle'</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-2">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"special_offer"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"block_instant_booking"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"created_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2018-10-11T10:19:38Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"expires_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2018-10-12T10:19:38Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"guest_details"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"number_of_adults"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"number_of_children"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"number_of_infants"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">134665650</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"is_active"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">true</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">27110350</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"offer_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"preapproval"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"rescinded_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"start_date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2018-10-24"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"thread_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">476749234</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"total_price"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">300</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"metadata"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Withdrawing a Special Offer or pre-approval
sections.content:
<p>This API lets you withdraw an active Special Offer or pre-approval.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>PUT /v2/special_offers/:special_offer_id</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-id-2">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>special_offer_id</code> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the Special Offer or pre-approval to update.</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="request-body-parameters-4">Request Body Parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>update_type</code> <br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Use <code>"withdraw"</code>  to withdraw the offer.</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-4">Response</h5>
<p>A <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#special-offer-object">Special Offer object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-6">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X PUT <span class="se">\</span>
  https://api.airbnb.com/v2/special_offers/134672654 <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key: 8j1516pdu8gljpd4ygmbsv3tg'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-OAuth-Token: cc850b0z54iuysjn1tkdlxfle'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -d <span class="s1">'{
  "update_type":"withdraw"
}'</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-3">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"special_offer"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"block_instant_booking"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"created_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2018-10-11T10:19:38Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"expires_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2018-10-12T10:19:38Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"guest_details"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"number_of_adults"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"number_of_children"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"number_of_infants"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">134665650</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"is_active"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">27110350</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"offer_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"special_offer"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"rescinded_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2018-10-11T10:35:08Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"start_date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2018-10-24"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"thread_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">476749234</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"total_price"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">300</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"metadata"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Special Offer Object
sections.content:
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The id of the special offer</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>created_at</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><a href="https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html">ISO-8601 </a>formatted string representing the time the offer was sent.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>expires_at</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><a href="https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html">ISO-8601 </a>formatted string representing the time the offer was set to expire.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>rescinded_at</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><a href="https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html">ISO-8601 </a>formatted string representing the time the offer was withdrawn. The value is <code>null</code> if the offer was not withdrawn.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>is_active</code> <br> <i>boolean</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Whether the special offer is still active or not.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>offer_type</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The type of the offer. One of  <code>"special_offer"</code> or <code>"preapproval"</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>thread_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The thread id associated with the offer.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The listing id associated with the offer.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>start_date</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The beginning of the offer, in ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DD format.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>nights</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The number of nights included in the offer.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>guest_details</code> <br><i>object</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The breakdown of the number of guests. A hash including <code>number_of_adults</code>, <code>number_of_children</code>, <code>number_of_infants</code>. If the breakdown wasn't specified, the <code>number_of_adults</code> will equal the number of guests.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>total_price</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The total price of the offer in the listing's currency. Is inclusive of all fees (the cleaning fee and standard fees).</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>

sections.name: Reservations API
sections.content: <p>Reservations API allow querying information about future and past reservations. This endpoint allows you to query a specific reservation or a set of reservations. It also allows you to accept or deny reservation requests.</p>

sections.name: Accepting or Denying a Reservation Request
sections.content:
<pre class="highlight text"><code>PUT v2/reservations/:confirmation_code</code></pre>
<p>Use this call to accept or deny a pending reservation request. See <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management#request-to-book-flow">Request to Book Flow</a> for more details.</p>
<h5 id="request-url-id-3">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>confirmation_code</code> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The confirmation code of the reservation.</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="request-body-parameters-5">Request Body Parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>attempt_action</code> <br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Either <code>"accept"</code> or <code>"deny"</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<p>In case of denying a reservation, you should also specify:</p>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>decline_reason</code> <br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>An Airbnb-provided reason for declining the reservation request. One of: <code>"dates_not_available"</code>, <code>"not_a_good_fit"</code>, <code>"waiting_for_better_reservation"</code>, and <code>"not_comfortable"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>decline_message_to_guest</code> <br><i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A reply message to the guest to explain the need to decline.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>decline_message_to_airbnb</code> <br><i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A private message that Airbnb would receive when the reservation request is declined.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-5">Response</h5>
<p>A <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#reservation-object">Reservation object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-7">Example Request</h5>
<p>Accepting a reservation</p>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 8k4rgwwudgprm758t9fkd6y24'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key: gu7tsjffe4vzptgcax0ncplnq'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -X PUT <span class="se">\</span>
     -d <span class="s1">'{
       "attempt_action": "accept",
     }'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/reservations/HMNQHXBC4Z"</span></code></pre>
<p>Denying a reservation</p>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 8k4rgwwudgprm758t9fkd6y24'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key: gu7tsjffe4vzptgcax0ncplnq'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -X PUT <span class="se">\</span>
     -d <span class="s1">'{
       "attempt_action": "deny",
       "decline_reason": "dates_not_available",
       "decline_message_to_guest": "Sorry, those dates are not available",
       "decline_message_to_airbnb": "",
     }'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/reservations/HMNQHXBC4Z"</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Retrieving All Reservations
sections.content:
<p>This API lets you get all reservations for a specific listing or user.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>GET /v2/reservations/</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-parameters-2">Request URL Parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>URL Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>host_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Host's User ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>start_date</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional, default is current date</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Beginning of the date range, in <a href="https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html">ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DD</a> format. Returns the reservations that start on or after this date.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>end_date</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional, default is 1 year away</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>End of the date range, in <a href="https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html">ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DD</a> format. Returns the reservations that end before this date.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>all_status</code> <br> <i>boolean</i> <br> <u>optional, default is <code>false</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Set to <code>true</code> to return all reservations. By default is <code>false</code>, so only accepted reservations are returned.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>include_only_status</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Returns only the reservations with a specific status. Must be one of <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#reservation-status">supported strings</a>. Mutually exclusive with <code>all_status</code> parameter.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>_limit</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional, default is </u><u><code>20</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Maximum number of reservations to return, up to 50.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>_offset</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional, default is 0</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Number of reservations to skip over, where the ordering is consistent but unspecified. For example, to get the 10th through 14th reservations, use <code>_limit=5</code> and <code>_offset=9</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-6">Response</h5>
<p>An array of <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#reservation-object">Reservation objects</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-8">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: fasdrfw8lrqfz5pfsdmjc3z'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key: cfd2tsjfv4hasdfe0ncplnf'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     https://api.airbnb.com/v2/reservations/?host_id<span class="o">=</span>1743298&amp;start_date<span class="o">=</span>2014-01-01&amp;end_date<span class="o">=</span>2014-08-30</code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-4">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"metadata"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{},</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"reservations"</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"cancellation_policy_category"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"super_strict_30"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"confirmation_code"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"XEPATD"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"created_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-12-18T11:50:58+00:00"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"updated_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-12-28T16:40:23+00:00"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"booked_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-12-18T11:56:35+00:00"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"end_date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"2018-01-03"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"expected_payout_amount"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">1102</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"expected_payout_amount_accurate"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"1102.00"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"guest_email"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"nick-owme5321y975kcat@guest.airbnb.com"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"guest_first_name"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"Nick"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"guest_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">1603069</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">

  </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Retrieving a Reservation
sections.content:
<pre class="highlight text"><code>GET /v2/reservations/:confirmation_code</code></pre>
<p>This allows you to obtain details about a specific reservation. You can use the previous endpoint to search for confirmation codes first.</p>
<h5 id="request-url-id-4">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>confirmation_code</code> <br> <b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The confirmation code of the reservation</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-7">Response</h5>
<p>A <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#reservation-object">Reservation object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-9">Example Request</h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: fasdrfw8lrqfz5pfsdmjc3z'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key: cfd2tsjfv4hasdfe0ncplnf'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     https://api.airbnb.com/v2/reservations/XEPATDRYT4</code></pre>

    </span><span class="nt">"listing_base_price"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">1136</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">

    </span><span class="nt">"special_offer_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w"> 
    </span><span class="nt">"start_date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"2014-01-01"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"status_type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"accept"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
