sections.name: Introduction
sections.content:
<p>The Messaging API allows Partners to read and send messages on a host's behalf. It consists of three main components</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><a href="/partner/api-docs/messaging/default#webhook-notifications">Webhook notifications</a> that Airbnb sends for each new message added to a thread. Notifications are posted to the  notification URL you provided in the Airbnb Partner Portal.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>The ability to <a href="/partner/api-docs/messaging/default#sending-a-message">send messages</a> through the API using the <code>/messages</code> endpoint.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>The ability to <a href="/partner/api-docs/messaging/default#retrieving-a-conversation">retrieve conversations</a> for the host.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>To access the Messaging API, a host needs to authorize your application with two scopes <code>messages_read</code> and <code>messages_write</code>. For more information on scopes authorization, see our <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default#application-scopes">Getting Started</a><i> </i>guide.</p>

sections.name: Rate Limits
sections.content:
<p>Please first review the general API <a href="/partner/api-docs/overview/default#rate-limiting">Rate Limiting </a>requirements and ways to handle such issues. Messaging API comes with its own specific requirements, described below.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span><code>POST .../messages</code> . We have a per application limit of 50 requests per minute. Once reached, an error is returned for up to one minute.</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span><code>GET .../threads</code> . We have a per application limit of 200 requests per minute. Once reached, an error is returned for up to one minute.</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Message and Thread API
Sending a Message
sections.content:
<p>You can either send a text or an image as a single message.</p>
<pre class="highlight text"><code>POST v2/messages?_format=for_api_partners</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-parameters">Request URL parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>_format</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"for_api_partners"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="request-body-parameters">Request Body parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>thread_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><b><i>required</i></b></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Thread ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>message</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Message text</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>image</code><br><i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Attachment image contents in base64 string format. Images cannot be larger then 25MB and are auto-cropped. Text message is ignored if image is passed.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>content_type</code><br><i>string</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Image MIME content type. Currently supported: <code>image/jpeg</code>, <code>image/jpg</code>, <code>image/png</code> and <code>image/gif</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response">Response</h5>
<p>Returns a <a href="/partner/api-docs/messaging/default#message-object">Message object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request">Example Request</h5>
<p>Text message:</p>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"POST"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/messages?_format=for_api_partners"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 8uaxi4r1busbeg21fuacga40c"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: av8mf8kd4k40fq26xxd9w4p44"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -d <span class="s1">'{
    "thread_id": 123123,
    "message": "the key is in the lockbox"
  }'</span></code></pre>
<p>Image message:</p>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -X <span class="s2">"POST"</span> <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/messages?_format=for_api_partners"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"Content-Type: application/json"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 8uaxi4r1busbeg21fuacga40c"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -H <span class="s2">"X-Airbnb-API-Key: av8mf8kd4k40fq26xxd9w4p44"</span> <span class="se">\</span>
  -d <span class="s1">'{
    "thread_id": 123123,
    "image": "'</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="k">$(</span>base64 ~/Downloads/artLoft4.jpg<span class="k">)</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="s1">'",
    "content_type": "image/jpeg"
  }'</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response">Example Response</h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"message"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">2345433</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"message"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"created_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-03-29 15:57:45"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"attachment_images"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"user_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">124021</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Retrieving a Conversation
sections.content:
<pre class="highlight text"><code>GET v2/threads/:thread_id?_format=for_api_partners</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-id">Request URL ID</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>thread_id</code> <br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The ID of the thread to retrieve.</span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="request-url-parameters-2">Request URL parameters</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody><tr>
<td>
<span><code>_format</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"for_api_partners"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr></tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-2"><b>Response</b></h5>
<p>Returns a <a href="/partner/api-docs/messaging/default#thread-object">Thread Object</a></p>
<h5 id="example-request-2"><b>Example Request</b></h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 3k4rgwwudgprm758t9fkd6y14'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key: ke1usjffe4vzptgcax0ncplnq'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/threads/222333?_format=for_api_partners"</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-2"><b>Example Response</b></h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"thread"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">222333</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"business_purpose"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"booking_direct_thread"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"updated_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-03-29T16:01:43Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"last_message_sent_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-03-29T15:57:45Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"users"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">124021</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"first_name"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Andrei"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"preferred_locale"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"ru"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"location"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"San Francisco"</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">5678432</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"name"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Giuseppe"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"preferred_locale"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"it"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"location"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Palermo"</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"attachment"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"type"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Reservation"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"status"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"accepted"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"roles"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="nt">"role"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"owner"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="nt">"user_ids"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="mi">5678432</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="nt">"role"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"guest"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="nt">"user_ids"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="mi">124021</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"booking_details"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"listing_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">323549</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"listing_name"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Sunny Vila"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"checkin_date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-03-29"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"checkout_date"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-04-01"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"expected_payout_amount_accurate"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s2">"1102.00"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"non_response_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-03-30T12:57:45Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"nights"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"number_of_guests"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"number_of_adults"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"number_of_children"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"number_of_infants"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"reservation_confirmation_code"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"HDTYS45DS2"</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"messages"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">2345433</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="nt">"message"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Hi, I'm visiting Palermo with my family."</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="nt">"created_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-03-29T15:57:45Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="nt">"attachment_images"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="nt">"user_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">124021</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">2345343</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="nt">"message"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Hi, Andrei. We are happy to host you!"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="nt">"created_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-03-29T18:57:45Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="nt">"attachment_images"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
              </span><span class="nt">"url"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"http://image.com/img.jpg"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
              </span><span class="nt">"width"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">400</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
              </span><span class="nt">"height"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">600</span><span class="w">
            </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="p">],</span><span class="w">
          </span><span class="nt">"user_id"</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">5678432</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">}</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Retrieving all Conversations
sections.content:
<pre class="highlight text"><code>GET v2/threads?_format=for_api_partners</code></pre>
<h5 id="request-url-parameters-3"><b>Request URL Parameters</b></h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>URL Parameter</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>_format</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"for_api_partners"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>selected_inbox_type</code> <br> <i>string</i><br><i><b>required</b></i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>"host"</code>. This field is required if the host has made any reservations as guest, in which case you won't be allowed to read those details.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>_limit</code> <br> <i>integer</i><br><u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Maximum number of threads to return, up to 50. The default is 20.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>_offset</code> <br> <i>integer</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Number of threads to skip over.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>_order</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional</u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The order to sort the threads. One of <code>"created_at desc"</code>, <code>"created_at asc"</code>, <code>"updated_at desc"</code>, <code>"updated_at asc"</code>, <code>"updated_at desc"</code>, or <code>"id desc"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>role</code> <br> <i>string</i> <br> <u>optional, default is </u><u><code>all</code></u></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A filter for the type of thread. One of <code>"all"</code> (all non-archived threads), <code>"hidden"</code> (archived threads), <code>"late_or_no_response"</code>, <code>"never_responded"</code>, or <code>"reservations"</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="response-3"><b>Response</b></h5>
<p><a href="/partner/api-docs/messaging/default#thread-object">Thread Object</a> array.</p>
<h5 id="example-request-3"><b>Example Request</b></h5>
<pre class="highlight bash"><code>curl -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-Oauth-Token: 3k4rgwwudgprm758t9fkd6y14'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     -H <span class="s1">'X-Airbnb-API-Key: ke1usjffe4vzptgcax0ncplnq'</span> <span class="se">\</span>
     <span class="s2">"https://api.airbnb.com/v2/threads?selected_inbox_type=host&amp;_limit=1&amp;_offset=0&amp;_format=for_api_partners"</span></code></pre>
<h5 id="example-response-3"><b>Example Response</b></h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"threads"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">222333</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"business_purpose"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"booking_direct_thread"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="nt">"last_message_sent_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-03-29T15:57:45Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="err">...</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="err">}</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">]</span><span class="w">
</span><span class="p">}</span></code></pre>

sections.name: Message Object
sections.content:
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Message ID.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>message</code> <br><i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Message text. This could, for example, be an empty string when only images are attached.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>created_at</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>When message was created - date and time in <a href="https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html">iso8601</a> format.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>attachment_images</code> <br> <i>array of objects</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The Image Objects attached to this message.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>user_id</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Message sender's User ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="attachment-image-object">Attachment Image Object</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>url</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Image URL</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>width</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Image width in pixels</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>height</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Image height in pixels</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>

sections.name: Thread Object
sections.content:
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Thread ID. Threads are unique between a host and guest. If there is not an existing thread between a host and a guest, a new one is created.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>business_purpose</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Thread type; currently, only <code>booking_direct_thread</code> is supported.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>updated_at</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Date and time the thread was updated in iso8601 format. Note that <code>updated_at</code> is always equal to or larger than <code>last_message_sent_at</code>. An update could consist of an event that didn't come with a message, e.g. a new reservation with no text message from guest. This field is useful when fetching most recent threads for a user.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>last_message_sent_at</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Date and time last text message was sent in iso8601 format.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>users</code> <br> <i>array of object</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Thread participants. See Participant Object</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>attachment</code> <br> <i>object</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The Thread Attachment object representing the current booking state. Since only <code>booking_direct_thread</code> purpose is supported, the only possible attachments are <code>Inquiry</code>, <code>SpecialOffer</code>, or <code>Reservation</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>messages</code> <br> <i>array of objects</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>All thread messages sorted by date in ascending order. The same format as Message Object but excludes <code>thread_id</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="participant-object">Participant Object</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>User ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>first_name</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>User's first name</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>preferred_locale</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>User's preferred locale. See the list of <a href="/partner/api-docs/messaging/default#supported-locales">supported locales</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>location</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>User location</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="thread-attachment-object">Thread Attachment Object</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>type</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Attachment type, can be  <code>Inquiry</code>, <code>SpecialOffer</code>, or <code>Reservation</code>.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>status</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Attachment status. See the <a href="/partner/api-docs/messaging/default#attachment-statuses">possible statuses</a> are accepted. in the appendix.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>roles</code> <br> <i>array of objects</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Role object array representing users' roles in the conversation.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>booking_details</code> <br> <i>object</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Object containing current booking state details.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="role-object">Role Object</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>role</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Role name, either <code>owner</code>,or <code>guest</code>  .</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>user_ids</code> <br> <i>array of integers</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Array of user_ids assigned this role. Currently API listings have only one owner and all booking threads have one guest, but this might change in the future.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="booking-details-object">Booking Details Object</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_id</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing ID</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>listing_name</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Listing name</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>checkin_date</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Check-in date in iso8601 format.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>checkout_date</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Check-out date</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>nights</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Number of nights</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>number_of_guests</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Total number of guests</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>number_of_adults</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Number of adults</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>number_of_children</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Number of children</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>number_of_infants</code> <br> <i>integer</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Number of infants</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>reservation_confirmation_code</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Reservation code if present, <code>null</code> otherwise.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>non_response_at</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>When the inquiry is considered "not responded to," in <a href="https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html">iso8601</a> date/time format. Note that this negatively impacts a host's response rate. The value is <code>null</code> if no response is required.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>expected_payout_amount_accurate</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>The amount to be paid out to the host, in the host's currency. Formatted with the recommended <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217">ISO-4217 exponent</a> corresponding to the currency.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>

sections.name: Webhook Notifications
sections.content: <p>This section describes the Webhook notifications your application could receive. Please refer to the <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default">Getting Started </a>guide for information on setting up your application for notifications and correctly handling them.</p>

sections.name: Message Added Notification
sections.content:
<p>We send notifications for all new messages, even for messages from the host (we notify you when the host manually sends messages on Airbnb). Please note that when the host sends a message through the API,  your application will still receive notifications.</p>
<blockquote>Note that a message from the guest is not required for Instant Book reservations. Therefore, you might not receive a new message notification with a new reservation that comes in. If you would still like to message this guest, you can find the ID of the thread as <code>thread_id</code> field in the <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#reservation-object">Reservation Object</a>.</blockquote>
<h5 id="notification-payload"><b>Notification Payload</b></h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Field</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>action</code> <br> <i>string</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span><code>message_added</code></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>message</code> <br> <i>object</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A <a href="/partner/api-docs/messaging/default#message-object">Message Object</a></span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>thread</code> <br> <i>object</i></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A <a href="/partner/api-docs/messaging/default#thread-object">Thread Object</a> but will exclude the <code>messages</code> field</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="example-notification"><b>Example notification</b></h5>
<pre class="highlight json"><code><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"action"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"message_added"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"message"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">3234553</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"user_id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">124021</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"message"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Hi, I'm visiting Palermo with my family."</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"created_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-03-29T15:57:45Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"attachment_images"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[]</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="p">},</span><span class="w">
  </span><span class="nt">"thread"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">222333</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"business_purpose"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"booking_direct_thread"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"updated_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-03-29T16:01:43Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"last_message_sent_at"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"2017-03-29T15:57:45Z"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
    </span><span class="nt">"users"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="w">
      </span><span class="p">{</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"id"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">124021</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">
        </span><span class="nt">"first_name"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">"Andrei"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="w">

sections.name: Enum values
Attachment Statuses
sections.content:
<h5 id="inquiry-status">Inquiry Status</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Value</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>active</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Corresponds to a guest-sent inquiry. An active inquiry might require a reply from the host, but will continue being in an active state, until approved (not required), expired or until the guest books.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>declined</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Represents a declined inquiry</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>expired</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Corresponds to an expired inquiry (host hasn't replied or the guest hasn't booked)</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>not possible</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Corresponds to an inquiry, which the host can no longer accommodate, e.g., some other guest booked the dates</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>unknown</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>A thread broken state</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="specialoffer-status">SpecialOffer Status</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Value</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>active</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Corresponds to a host's special offer or a pre-approval.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>expired</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Corresponds to an expired offer (guest has not booked)</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>not possible</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Corresponds to an offer, which the host can no longer accommodate, e.g., some other guest booked the dates</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>unknown</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Thread broken state</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
<h5 id="reservation-status">Reservation Status</h5>
<div><table>
<thead><tr>
<th>
<span>Value</span><br>
</th>
<th>
<span>Description</span><br>
</th>
</tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>pending</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Pending reservation request which needs to be accepted. Irrelevant to Instant Booking hosts.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>declined</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Declined reservation request. Irrelevant to Instant Booking hosts.</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>accepted</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Represents a confirmed reservation</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>canceled</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Represents a canceled reservation</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>expired</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Corresponds to an expired reservation (e.g., the guest did not pay in time)</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>unknown</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Reservation broken state</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<span><code>awaiting_payment</code>, <code>pending_verification</code>, <code>checkpoint</code></span><br>
</td>
<td>
<span>Intermediary states of a reservation, that usually don't require host's action</span><br>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>

sections.name: FAQ
sections.content:
<p><b>Is there a way to pre-approve a listing inquiry via the API?</b></p>
<p>Not in the current version, but it's something we are considering to implement in near future.</p>
<h5 id="document-feedback">Document Feedback</h5>
<p>If you have any feedback on this document, please let us know. We are always interested in learning how we can improve the documentation and the reader's experience. <annotation>Please submit your feedback through the <a href="https://airbnb.secure.force.com/contactus/APICaseForm">API Technical Support Request Form</a>.</annotation></p>

sections.name: Overview
sections.content:
<p>Airbnb requires all API supply partners to pass an integration certification. The certification is designed to protect our platform and community, and also to help you ensure your application is setup for success from a technical perspective. Our assessment of your application's technical integration quality is a requirement before granting you access to our production environment (see <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default#test-and-production-applications">Test and Production Applications</a> for more information). The documentation that you provide as part of this process will be stored as a long-term reference and source of truth for our technical support team to better assist when you submit technical issues.</p>
<p>We require you to demonstrate a complete technical understanding of what our APIs offer, how the available API feature set is used in your specific context with regards to the overarching application architecture and business and code logic, and showcase the overall soundness of your application. The below sections will provide more insights into the <a href="https://airbnb.com/partner/api-docs/certification/default#process">Certification Process</a>. Please reach out to your Airbnb Partner Manager or our Technical Support team via the Support Intake Form to find out more about the process and technical requirements for the certification.</p>

sections.name: Process
Specifications
sections.content: <p>Please ensure that each technical integration specification question listed below is answered in detail. We are looking for a detailed technical breakdown of each call / endpoint that you're using for each step. Outlining your application's specific business and code logic with the available and utilised API feature set is crucial for our technical team to assess the integration health of your application. Supporting flow charts, graphs, and diagrams are a big plus to underline your technical understanding of our APIs. For any technical api related questions, please reach out to our <a href="https://airbnb.secure.force.com/contactus/APICaseForm">API Technical Support</a> or contact your API Partner Manager. </p>

sections.name: Background
sections.content:
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>[Describe the services and/or products you offer to your customers]</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>[Describe the relationship between you and your various customers, in particular how they work with each other]</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>[Describe the payout model, to whom the payout should be sent, how often, and at what time]</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>[Write down anything else you want to call out as specific about your business]</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Rate Limits
sections.content:
<p>We need to understand how you handle your requests when using our apis to create, update and manage api connected listings. We're looking for a better understanding of your request patterns, software infrastructure, and optimization details.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>[Please describe in detail how you manage your requests through a queue structure to retry failed requests after backoff period]</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>[Provide us estimates on how many requests you will send to airbnb per minute]</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>[Describe what kind of request you will send to airbnb and if you will be running any high frequency checks on your side. In particular, highlight how you are planning to run larger updates such as annual data uploads for an entire year when having multiple thousands of listings live on airbnb.]</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>To prevent system abuse and ensure API stability, Airbnb enforces several rate limits. Your application is responsible for operating within these rate limits. Once a rate limit has been exceeded, no more requests are handled until the limit expires. If you hit any of the rate limits described below, stop and do an exponential back-off. </p>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/overview/default#rate-limiting">IP &amp; API Level Rate Limiting</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default#notes-on-testing">Test Listing Rate Limits</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#rate-limits">REST Listing Management Rate Limits</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#rate-limits">XML Listing Management Rate Limits</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/messaging/default#rate-limits">Messaging Rate Limits</a></p>

sections.name: Authorization
sections.content:
<p>We need to understand how you connect and disconnect airbnb host accounts. We’re looking for a break down of your business and code logic regarding how you’re software utilizes our API when handling authorizations. Please provide a detailed breakdown of each call / endpoint that you're using for each step.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>[Please provide a step-by-step outline (eg. flowchart) specific to your application on how you initiate a host authorization, obtain and manage tokens. Describe exactly how you authenticate airbnb requests and setup webhook responses]</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>[Please describe your host and listing structure and how you intend to allocate listings to hosts (eg. by geography, quality and performance, etc.). In particular, describe how you or your clients plan to split listings on different host accounts including the average/maximum number of listings per host account.]</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p><b>UI/UX</b> We need to understand the onboarding and departure flow of various airbnb hosts. </p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>[Please provide a step-by-step outline on the end-to-end host user journey specific to your application for onboarding hosts that are new and/or existing on airbnb, and departing hosts through your software, but also through airbnb]</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>[Please ensure authorizations are revoked before a user account is deleted on your end]</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Listing Onboarding
sections.content:
<p>We need to understand how you create listings on Airbnb. We’re looking for a break down of your business and code logic regarding how you’re software utilizes our API when creating, mapping, and publishing listings. Please provide a detailed breakdown of each call / endpoint that you're using for each step.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>[Please provide a step-by-step outline specific to your application about how you create listings. Go into details for at least one of the below:</span><br>
</li>
<ul>
<li>
<span>publish listings as new ones and by merging created listings with an existing listing on the sync page, </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>publish new listings via API and connecting to an existing listing via the API]</span><br>
</li>
</ul>
</ul></div>
<p><b>UI/UX</b> We need to understand your end-to-end listing creation flow. </p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>[Please provide diagrams and screenshots of your software that outline the entire user journey of hosts that create listings through your software]</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Once we understand how you create listings, we want to understand how you update listings with the available api feature set.</p>

sections.name: Listing Management
sections.content:
<p>We need to understand how you manage listings. We’re looking for a break down of your business and code logic regarding how your software utilizes our API when CRUD listings. This includes price, availabilities, content, and synchronization changes. Please provide a detailed breakdown of each call / endpoint that you're using for each step.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>[Please describe how you</span><br>
</li>
<ul>
<li>
<span>update the synchronization categories, </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>unlist listings,</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>disconnect (unlinking) listings, and</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>delete listings. In addition, please describe your</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>calendar and pricing update flow, how often, how it is triggered, expected latency etc.]</span><br>
</li>
</ul>
<li>
<span>[Please provide additional context on updating if you are using Advanced Pricing Rules, Standard Fees, LOS Records so we understand how you are using our pricing and availability feature set.]</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>[If you plan to have Room Type Inventory on airbnb, we need to understand your ability to manage multiple availabilities for the same listing on the same day. Describe how you use daily availability counts to manage the availability of listings]</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p><b>UI/UX</b> We need to understand the listing update and management flow for various listings. </p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>[Please describe the user flows when a listing gets </span><br>
</li>
<ul>
<li>
<span>updated (pricing and availabilities), </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>unlisted, disconnected, and </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>deleted by starting with the hosts using your system]</span><br>
</li>
</ul>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Reservation Management
sections.content:
<p>We need to understand how you handle reservations. We’re looking for a break down of your business and code logic regarding how your software utilizes our API when handling reservations (including synchronous checks). Please provide a detailed breakdown of each call / endpoint that you're using for each step.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>[Please describe the booking flow, start from Airbnb sending the reservation notification. Include both Instant Book (IB) and Request to Book (RTB)]</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>[Describe the cancellation by guest flow starting from Airbnb sending the cancellation notification, and also describe the cancellation by host flow starting from the host action on Airbnb] </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>[In addition, describe the alternation flow and special offer flow]</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>[For reservation synchronous checks including Make Reservation and Update Reservation, do not validate the price and availability rules, only daily availability. Special Offers may affect these values.]</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Messaging API
sections.content:
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>[Describe the guest inquiry flow]</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>[Describe host retrieving thread flow, pull/push/hybrid]</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>[Describe host sending message flow]</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>[If your application supports the Special Offer API, please also describe how you handle notifications for special offer updates performed both via API and by the host manually on Airbnb]</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

sections.name: Additional APIs
sections.content: <p>We want to understand which other APIs you are using and how. Please provide a detailed breakdown of each call / endpoint that you're using for each step.</p>

sections.name: Milestones
sections.content: <p>Please ensure completion of all technical integration steps listed below. For any technical api related questions, please reach out to our <a href="https://airbnb.secure.force.com/contactus/APICaseForm">API Technical Support</a> or contact your API Partner Manager. </p>

sections.name: 1. Authorization | Week 1
sections.content:
<h5 id="1-1-register-your-application"><b>1.1 Register Your Application</b></h5>
<p>To get started, please provide the following information about your application in the App Settings page to fully register your application:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Application Name</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Application Description</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Email</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Redirect URL</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Notification URL</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Reservation URL</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Webhook Authentication </span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default#registering-your-application">Register Your Application</a> / <a href="/partner/profile/:dev_account_id/settings">https://www.airbnb.com/partner/profile/:dev_account_id/settings</a></p>
<h5 id="1-2-pass-webhook-tests">
<br><b>1.2 Pass Webhook Tests</b>
</h5>
<p>We need to ensure that the reservation and the notification URLs provided are correct. You can hit the "test" button on the App Settings page, and it should return a 200 success status.</p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Confirm successful response for both Reservation and Notification URL test. </span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/profile/:dev_account_id/settings">https://www.airbnb.com/partner/profile/:dev_account_id/settings</a></p>
<h5 id="1-3-add-authorised-test-accounts-as-test-users">
<br>1.3 Add authorised test accounts as test users</h5>
<p>Our Test Sandbox allows you to add test users to view and book your sandbox listings. Any user that you add must have an existing Airbnb account. Copy the URL to their Airbnb.com profile and enter it. </p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Add test users to your Sandbox application through the App Settings page. </span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/profile/:dev_account_id/testing">https://www.airbnb.com/partner/profile/:dev_account_id/testing</a></p>
<h5 id="1-4-connect-host-accounts">
<br>1.4 Connect host accounts</h5>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Connect at least 2 host accounts to ensure successful authorization with your test application. </span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default#initiating-host-authorization">Initiating Host Authorization</a> / <a href="https://www.airbnb.ie/partner/api-docs/get-started/default#obtaining-tokens">Obtaining Tokens</a> / <a href="https://www.airbnb.ie/partner/api-docs/get-started/default#managing-tokens">Managing Tokens</a></p>
<h5 id="1-5-disconnect-host-accounts">
<br>1.5 Disconnect host accounts</h5>
<p>Try unlinking the entire account in both of the following ways: </p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Revoking a Token </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Disconnecting your application at <a href="https://admin.airbnb.com/users/apps">https://airbnb.com/users/apps</a></span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/get-started/default#revoking-a-token">Revoking a Token</a></p>
<h5 id="1-6-confirm-webhook-notifications-success-failure">
<br>1.6 Confirm Webhook Notifications (success/failure)</h5>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Confirm successful receipt of authorization_revoked notification with a 200 response </span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#authorization-revoked">REST Authorization Revoked</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#authorization-revoked">XML Authorization Revoked</a></p>

sections.name: 2. Listing Onboarding | Week 2
sections.content:
<h5 id="2-1-listing-creation-min-requirements">2.1 Listing Creation (min. requirements)</h5>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Create listings that both meet and don’t meet our minimum standards</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Confirm receipt of listing approval notifications (both approval and rejections)</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#publishing-a-listing">REST Listing Management</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#publishing-a-listing">XML Listing Management</a><b> </b></p>
<h5 id="2-2-number-of-connected-listings">
<br>2.2 Number of Connected Listings</h5>
<p>You need to have a positive total number of Airbnb listing that are connected via the api.</p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Publish at least two listings in total through one or multiple of the below options 2.3 - 2.6 so that you have tested all supported use cases that you are planning to support with your Production App</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#publishing-a-listing">REST Listing Management</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#publishing-a-listing">XML Listing Management</a><b> </b></p>
<h5 id="2-3-sync-page-mapping">
<br>2.3 Sync Page Mapping</h5>
<p>You can leave manually setting a sync category to the Host on the Airbnb Sync Page to map to an existing listing on Airbnb.</p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>If supported, map at least two existing listings on the Airbnb Sync Page </span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#creating-a-new-listing">REST Merging with an Existing Listing on the Sync Page</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#creating-a-new-listing">XML Merging with an Existing Listing on the Sync Page</a></p>
<h5 id="2-4-sync-page-publishing">2.4 Sync Page Publishing</h5>
<p>You can leave manually setting a sync category to the Host on the Airbnb sync page to publish a new listing on Airbnb.</p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>If supported, publish at least two new listings on the Airbnb Sync Page </span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#creating-a-new-listing">REST Creating a New Listing</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#creating-a-new-listing">XML Creating a New Listing</a></p>
<h5 id="2-5-auto-publish">
<br>2.5 Auto Publish</h5>
<p>If the host has no existing listings on airbnb, you can also set the sync category to "sync_undecided" and your listings will automatically publish with "sync all" once they pass validation against the min api listing </p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>If supported, auto-publish listings by setting the Sync Category to “sync_undecided” for api created listings of hosts with no listings</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#creating-a-new-listing">REST Creating a New Listing</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#creating-a-new-listing">XML Creating a New Listing</a></p>
<h5 id="2-6-publish-listings-via-api">
<br>2.6 Publish listings via API</h5>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Connect at least two existing listing via the API</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more:<a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#connecting-to-an-existing-listing-via-the-api"> REST Connecting to Existing Listings via API</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#connecting-to-an-existing-listing-via-the-api">XML Connecting to Existing Listings via API</a></p>
<h5 id="2-7-confirm-webhook-notifications">
<br>2.7 Confirm Webhook Notifications</h5>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Confirm successful receipt and 200 response of listing_approval_status_changed notification</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Confirm successful receipt and 200 response of listing_synchronization_settings_updated notification</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#webhook-notifications">REST Listing Management Webhook Notifications</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#webhook-notifications">XML Listing Management Webhook Notifications</a></p>

sections.name: 3. Listing Management | Week 3-4
sections.content:
<h5 id="3-1-changing-sync-category-after-publishing">3.1 Changing Sync Category After Publishing</h5>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Confirm successful receipt and 200 response of listing_synchronization_settings_updated notification</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#updating-the-sync-category">REST Updating the Sync Category</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#updating-the-sync-category">XML Updating the Sync Category</a></p>
<h5 id="3-2-listings-ever-activated-has_availability-true">
<br>3.2 Listings Ever Activated (has_availability=true)</h5>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Confirm API listings have been activated with has_availability = true</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#creating-a-new-listing">REST Creating a New Listing</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#creating-a-new-listing">XML Creating a New Listing</a></p>
<h5 id="3-3-listings-deactivated-has_availability-false">
<br>3.3 Listings Deactivated (has_availability=false)</h5>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Confirm API listings have been deactivated with has_availability = false</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#unlisting-listings">REST Unlisting Listings</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#unlisting-listings">XML Unlisting Listing</a></p>
<h5 id="3-4-unlinking-stop-sync-and-deleting-listings">
<br>3.4 Unlinking (stop sync) and deleting listings</h5>
<p>Once unlinked/disconnected, the Host must manage the listing directly on the Airbnb website</p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Try unlinking a listing from the API</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#disconnecting-unlinking-listings">REST Disconnecting Unlinking Listings</a> / <a href="https://admin.airbnb.com/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#disconnecting-unlinking-listings">XML Disconnecting Unlinking Listings</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#deleting-a-listing-import">XML Deleting a Listing Import</a></p>
<p>Deleting the listing will fail if it has at least one upcoming reservation.</p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Try deleting a listing from the API</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#deleting-listings">REST Deleting Listings</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#deleting-listings">XML Deleting Listings</a></p>
<h5 id="3-5-listing-webhook-notification-success-failure">
<br>3.5 Listing Webhook Notification (success/failure)</h5>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Confirm successful receipt and 200 response of listings_unlinked notification</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listings-unlinked">REST Listing Unlinked Webhook </a>/ <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#listings-unlinked">XML Listing Unlinked Webhook</a></p>
<h5 id="ui-logic-for-min-requirements-optional-if-not-supported">
<br>UI/logic for min. requirements [optional if not supported]</h5>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Implement UI/logic that checks for API listing minimum requirements</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="https://www.airbnb.co.uk/partner/api-docs/overview/default#minimum-listing-standards">Minimum Listing Standards</a></p>
<h5 id="3-6-advanced-pricing-rules-optional-if-not-supported">
<br>3.6 Advanced Pricing Rules [optional if not supported]</h5>
<p>Seasonal adjustment, Length-of-stay adjustment, Last-minute discount and Booking-ahead discount  </p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Implement one or multiple of the Advanced Pricing Rules</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#pricing-rules-overview">REST Pricing Rules</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#pricingrule">XML Pricing Rules</a></p>
<h5 id="3-7-standard-fees-optional-if-not-supported">
<br>3.7 Standard Fees [optional if not supported]</h5>
<p>Standard Fees apply to reservations on top of the stay price. Fees can be specified as either percentage of the nightly price (after all adjustments) or a flat amount per reservation.</p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Implemented Standard Fees</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#standard-fees">REST Standard Fees</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#passthroughfees">XML Standard Fees</a></p>
<h5 id="3-8-los-records-api-optional-if-not-supported">
<br>3.8 LOS Records API [optional if not supported]</h5>
<p>LOS table allows to exchange exact/precalculated price and availability for each combination of checkin date, occupancy, and length of stay.</p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Implemented LOS Records </span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="https://admin.airbnb.com/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#los-records-api">REST LOS Record API</a> / <a href="https://admin.airbnb.com/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#xml-los-records">XML LOS Record API</a></p>
<h5 id="3-9-room-type-inventory-optional-if-not-supported">
<br>3.9 Room Type Inventory [optional if not supported]</h5>
<p>Some properties might have multiple rooms for a certain room type. For these listings, partners can provide Airbnb with a listing's total inventory count, daily available count for specific dates, as well as property external id. Note that the property type house is not eligible for Room Type Inventory.</p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Implemented Roomy Type Inventory</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#room-type-inventory">REST Room Type Inventory</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#room-type-inventory">XML Room Type Inventory</a></p>
<h5 id="3-10-listing-registration-api-optional-if-not-supported">
<br>3.10 Listing Registration API [optional if not supported]</h5>
<p>Listing Registration API lets you submit the listing registration for an Airbnb listing in markets where registration is required.</p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Implemented Listing Registration API</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#listing-regulations-api">REST Listing Registration API</a></p>

sections.name: 4. Reservation Management | Week 4-5
sections.content:
<h5 id="4-1-confirmed-accepted-reservation">4.1 Confirmed Accepted Reservation</h5>
<p>Airbnb fully refunds your test reservations once you inform your Partner Manager. Please test reservations a few weeks out of the current date so reservations can be refunded in time, before payments are actually processed.</p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Complete 2 guest reservations</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management">Reservation Management</a> / <a href="https://www.airbnb.co.uk/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#booking-flow">Booking Flow</a></p>
<h5 id="4-2-confirmed-alteration">
<br>4.2 Confirmed Alteration</h5>
<p>Ensure you receive and reflect reservation alterations, after the host and guest come to an agreement, in your system correctly.</p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Alter one reservation from the previously confirmed accepted reservations</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="https://www.airbnb.co.uk/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#alteration-flow">Alteration Flow</a></p>
<h5 id="4-3-confirmed-cancellation">
<br>4.3 Confirmed Cancellation</h5>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Cancel one reservation from the previously confirmed accepted reservations. Inform your airbnb Partner Manager to help you refund all test reservations by requesting a Cancel by Admin (CBA).</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<h5 id="4-4-confirmed-pending-reservation">
<br>4.4 Confirmed Pending Reservation</h5>
<p>Although the Listing API does not support creating listings with a default Request to Book setting, reservations can be Request to Book in certain cases. In these cases the reservation will enter a pending state and the host will have 24 hours to accept the reservation request, either directly on Airbnb or through your application via the Reservations API. If you are planning to allow Request to Book for late notice reservations (see <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/rest#rule-schemas">REST Booking Lead Time</a> / <a href="/partner/api-docs/listing-management/xml#bookingleadtime">XML Booking Lead Time</a>) test that kind of reservation to see how manual acceptance flow works.</p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Create pending reservation</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="https://airbnb.com/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#request-to-book-flow">Request To Book Flow</a></p>
<h5 id="4-5-reservation-webhook-notifications-success-failures">
<br>4.5 Reservation Webhook Notifications (success/failures)</h5>
<p>We notify the partners when a new reservation is confirmed, when a confirmed reservation is altered by guest or host, or the reservation is cancelled.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Confirm successful receipt and 200 response of reservation_acceptance_confirmation</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span> Confirm successful receipt and 200 response of reservation_cancellation_confirmation </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Confirm successful receipt and 200 response of reservation_alteration_confirmation</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>Reservation notifications are a critical element of the integration. We advise partners to perform a daily or weekly audit of all user reservations using the Reservations API to make sure no reservations are missed. Also, we might send several cancellation notifications for the same reservation because there are 3 different cancellation types (see Reservation status). We decided to notify the partner when reservation changes the cancellation type (even if it's already canceled) because a change from cancelled_by_host to cancelled_by_admin might result in a different payout amount. You can choose to ignore any additional cancelation notifications.</p>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#webhook-notifications">Reservation Webhook Notification</a></p>
<h5 id="4-6-synchronous-availability-checks">
<br>4.6 Synchronous Availability Checks</h5>
<p>Three types of synchronous calls used for checking availability </p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Confirm successful receipt and 200 response of of check_availability to confirm if a listing is available </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Confirm successful receipt and 200 response of of make_reservation to confirm if a listing is available</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Confirm successful receipt and 200 response of of update_reservation to confirm if a listing is available</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>This functionality is enabled by the reservations_web_hooks scope (which is not related to the Reservation Webhook Notifications). This scope is automatically included in the vr (REST) scope. For applications with the vr_feed (XML) scope, this scope can be requested in your application's Scopes page. Please reach out to your Partner Manager at Airbnb once you have requested this scope.</p>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#synchronous-availability-checks">Synchronous Availability Checks</a></p>
<h5 id="4-7-special-offer-api">
<br>4.7 Special Offer API</h5>
<p>The Special Offers API allows creating, updating, withdrawing and retrieving Special Offers and pre-approvals. Using the Special Offer API requires also implementing the Messaging API, since Special Offers are presented to guests in message threads. Airbnb sends notifications for special offer updates performed both via API and by the host manually on Airbnb.</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Confirm successful receipt and 200 response of special_offer_created notification</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Confirm successful receipt and 200 response of special_offer_voided notification </span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/reservation-management/default#special-offers-api">Special Offers API</a></p>

sections.name: 5. Additional APIs (Optional) | Week 5-6
sections.content:
<h5 id="5-1-messaging-api">5.1 Messaging API</h5>
<p>Allows Partners to read and send messages on a host's behalf. To access the Messaging API, a host needs to authorize your application with two scopes </p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>messages_read </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>messages_write </span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>
<p>Please reach out to your Partner Manager that can help you submit a request for messaging scopes.</p>
<div><ul><li>
<span>Confirm successful receipt and 200 response of message_added</span><br>
</li></ul></div>
<p>Learn more: <a href="/partner/api-docs/messaging">Messaging API</a></p>

sections.name: Demo Call
sections.content:
<p>Please make sure that you come prepared to the final certification meeting and ensure that both technical teams have enough time to focus on the certification process. Please also ensure that the technical team that has built the integration is attending the meeting so all questions can be answered within the allocated slots. Below is a meeting guidance to give you more insights into what to expect from the call:</p>
<div><ul>
<li>
<span>Dial-in, Introduction &amp; Agenda [5 mins] </span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Specifications: Outline and demonstrate your understanding of Airbnb’s APIs and their usage, and outline the soundness of your development based on the provided Specifications. Answer any technical questions our integrations team has regarding your partner application. [30 mins]</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Demo: Showcase your ability to use Airbnb’s APIs fluently by successfully passing the following steps upon request from the assigned Airbnb Certifiers:</span><br>
</li>
<ul>
<li>
<span>Authorizing one Host account (5 mins)</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Creating and publishing one listing with 2 full weeks of availabilities (5 mins)</span><br>
</li>
<li>
<span>Updating pricing and availabilities of your listing (5 mins) (Note: XML partners might get asked to perform an on-demand sync of the listing XML) by setting both weekends (Fri-Sun) unavailable and doubling Mon-Fri prices in the first week, and deleting/unlinking your listing (5 mins) [20 mins] </span><br>
</li>
</ul>
<li>
<span>Open Questions, Best Practices &amp; Closing [5 mins]</span><br>
</li>
</ul></div>

phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.marquee_titl: Conecta con nuestra API.%{linebreak}Conecta con millones de viajeros en Airbnb.
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.marquee_subt: %{strong_start}¿Eres anfitrión y tienes varios anuncios?%{strong_end} Tenemos herramientas para ayudarte a seguir creciendo. %{link_start}Más información%{link_end}
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.benefits.rea: Conecta con nuestra comunidad internacional que te pondrá en contacto con millones de huéspedes nuevos.
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.benefits.int: Establece tu integración para que los clientes puedan decidir cómo quieren publicar su anuncio en Airbnb.
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.benefits.acc: Consulta documentación técnica más exhaustiva y recibe asesoramiento de un gestor.
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.offerings.ti: Lo que pueden hacer los anfitriones
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.offerings.li: Importa rápidamente varios anuncios en Airbnb y sincroniza automáticamente los datos con los anuncios nuevos o ya existentes.
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.offerings.re: Gestiona los precios y la disponibilidad
Establece precios flexibles y normas para las reservas. Utiliza un solo calendario para varios anuncios.
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.offerings.me: Mantén una comunicación fluida con los huéspedes
Para mantener tu ratio de respuesta alta, usa los hilos de correos electrónicos y mensajes automáticos para responder a los huéspedes.
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.process.get_: %{link_start}Solicita acceso%{link_end} y nuestro equipo internacional de gestores se pondrá en contacto contigo.
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.process.acce: Cuando se apruebe la solicitud, tendrás acceso a toda la documentación de la API para que puedas organizar tu programa de desarrollo.
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.process.buil: ¡Termina los cambios y lanza la aplicación! Tu gestor de Airbnb te ayudará a solucionar cualquier duda que te surja.
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.process.onbo: Empieza trasvasando tu inventario a través de la API y recibe a viajeros en Airbnb de todos los rincones del mundo.
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.faq.title: Preguntas frecuentes
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.faq.how_can_: ¿Cómo puedo obtener acceso a la API de Airbnb?

En estos momentos, no aceptamos nuevas solicitudes de acceso para nuestra API. Nuestro equipo global de gestión de asociados se pondrá en contacto con los posibles asociados en función de la oferta de mercado que represente su empresa, la robustez de su tecnología y la capacidad de ofrecer ayuda a los clientes que compartamos.
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.faq.what_can: ¿Qué puedo hacer con la API de Airbnb?

La API permite a los equipos de desarrollo conectarse a través de Oauth a cuentas nuevas y existentes de Airbnb. Los usuarios de tu aplicación podrán actualizar el contenido, las tarifas y la disponibilidad. Cuando los huéspedes en Airbnb reserven tus alojamientos, recibirás los mensajes y los datos de las reservas, de modo que tu aplicación podrá crear un flujo de trabajo personalizado y ofrecer una experiencia de usuario fabulosa a nuestros huéspedes compartidos.
phrases.partner_portal.landing_page.faq.do_you_o: Si necesitas soporte técnico más allá de lo incluido en la documentación técnica, puedes requerir la ayuda de nuestro equipo global de gestión de asociados.

También puedes introducir directamente el número de identificación de usuario de Airbnb
